197 
199 // some temp debugging functions
200 #define DUMP_LEN 1024
201 static void * dump_handle;
202 static char p_buffer[1024];
203 static char *p_pos;
204 
205 int dumping_printfs = 0;
206 
207 bool dump_open(const char *name)
208 {
209  dump_handle = File::Open( name, "wb");
210  p_pos = p_buffer;
211 
212  if (dump_handle != NULL)
213  {
214  dumping_printfs = 1;
215  }
216 
217  return ( dump_handle != NULL );
218 }
219 
220 void dump_flush()
221 {
222  int len = p_pos - p_buffer;
223  if (len)
224  {
225  File::Write( p_buffer, len, 1, dump_handle );
226  p_pos = p_buffer;
227  }
228 }
229 
230 // print to file, replacing lf with cr/lf, so I can read them in notepad
231 void dump_printf(char *p)
232 {
233  int len = strlen(p);
234  if ((int)(p_pos + len) > (int)(p_buffer + DUMP_LEN-16))
235  {
236  dump_flush();
237  }
238 
239  for (int i= 0; i<len;i++)
240  {
241  if (*p != 0x0a)
242  {
243  *p_pos ++ = *p++;
244  }
245  else
246  {
247  p++;
248  *p_pos++ = 0x0d;
249  *p_pos++ = 0x0a;
250  }
251  }
252 }
253 
254 void dump_close()
255 {
256  dump_flush();
257  File::Close( dump_handle );
258  dumping_printfs = 0;
259 }

318 /*
319 static void test_network_task( const Tsk::Task< Tmr::Time >& task )
320 {
321  // Wait a second before testing so the user can see the status box
322  if(( Tmr::GetTime() - s_start_network_test_time ) < Tmr::Seconds( 1 ))
323  {
324  return;
325  }
326 
327  Net::Manager * net_man = Net::Manager::Instance();
328  bool properly_setup;
329 
330  properly_setup = net_man->NetworkEnvironmentSetup();
331  if( !properly_setup )
332  {
333  if( net_man->GetLastError() == Net::vRES_ERROR_DEVICE_NOT_HOT )
334  {
335  Script::CStruct* pStructure;
336 
337  pStructure = new Script::CStruct;
338 
339  pStructure->AddComponent( Script::GenerateCRC( "text" ), ESYMBOLTYPE_STRING, Script::GetString( "net_error_not_connected" ));
340  Script::RunScript( "create_net_startup_error_dialog", pStructure );
341 
342  delete pStructure;
343  }
344  else if( ( net_man->GetLastError() == Net::vRES_ERROR_DEVICE_NOT_CONNECTED ) ||
345  ( net_man->GetLastError() == Net::vRES_ERROR_UNKNOWN_DEVICE ))
346  {
347  Script::CStruct* pStructure;
348 
349  pStructure = new Script::CStruct;
350 
351  pStructure->AddComponent( Script::GenerateCRC( "text" ), ESYMBOLTYPE_STRING, Script::GetString( "net_error_not_detected" ));
352  Script::RunScript( "create_net_startup_error_dialog", pStructure );
353 
354  delete pStructure;
355  }
356  else if( net_man->GetLastError() == Net::vRES_ERROR_DHCP )
357  {
358  Script::CStruct* pStructure;

360  pStructure = new Script::CStruct;
361 
362  pStructure->AddComponent( Script::GenerateCRC( "text" ), ESYMBOLTYPE_STRING, Script::GetString( "net_error_dhcp_error" ));
363  Script::RunScript( "create_net_startup_error_dialog", pStructure );

365  delete pStructure;

398 
399  pParams->AddChecksum( "change_gamemode", Script::GenerateCRC( "change_gamemode_net" ));
400  Script::RunScript( "launch_select_skater_menu", pParams );
401 
402  delete pParams;
403  }
404 
405  delete s_network_test_task;
406 }

408 
409 /******************************************************************/
410 /* */
411 /* */
412 /******************************************************************/
413 
414 static void s_second_controller_check_code( const Tsk::Task< int > &task )
415 {
416  // Get the second controller.
417  SIO::Manager * pSioMan = SIO::Manager::Instance();
418  SIO::Device *pFirstController=pSioMan->GetDeviceByIndex(0);
419  SIO::Device *pSecondController=pSioMan->GetDeviceByIndex(1);
420 
421 #ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
422  int num_plugged_devices;
423  SIO::Device *pThirdController=pSioMan->GetDeviceByIndex(2);
424  SIO::Device *pFourthController=pSioMan->GetDeviceByIndex(3);
425 
426  num_plugged_devices = 0;
427  if( pFirstController->IsPluggedIn())
428  {
429  num_plugged_devices++;
430  }
431  if( pSecondController->IsPluggedIn())
432  {
433  num_plugged_devices++;
434  }
435  if( pThirdController->IsPluggedIn())
436  {
437  num_plugged_devices++;
438  }
439  if( pFourthController->IsPluggedIn())
440  {
441  num_plugged_devices++;
442  }
443 
444  if( num_plugged_devices >= 2 )
445  {
446  Script::RunScript( "enable_two_player_option" );
447  }
448  else
449  {
450  Script::RunScript( "disable_two_player_option" );
451  }
452 #else
453  if (pSecondController->IsPluggedIn() && pFirstController->IsPluggedIn())
454  {
455  Script::RunScript( "enable_two_player_option" );
456  }
457  else
458  {
459  Script::RunScript( "disable_two_player_option" );
460  }
461 #endif
462 #ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
463  DWORD result;
464  static Tmr::Time s_last_link_test;
465 
466  if(( Tmr::GetTime() - s_last_link_test ) >= Tmr::Seconds( 1 ))
467  {
468  result = XNetGetEthernetLinkStatus();
469  if(( result & XNET_ETHERNET_LINK_ACTIVE ) == 0 )
470  {
471  Script::RunScript( "disable_system_link_option" );
472  }
473  else
474  {
475  Script::RunScript( "enable_system_link_option" );
476  }
477  s_last_link_test = Tmr::GetTime();
478  }
479 #endif
480 }
481

488 static bool SetupNetworkDeviceDialogHandler( Front::EDialogBoxResult Result )
489 {
490 
491  switch (Result)
492  {
493  case Front::DB_YES:
494  {
495  Mdl::FrontEnd* front = Mdl::FrontEnd::Instance();
496  Front::MenuFactory* menu_factory = Front::MenuFactory::Instance();
497  Front::DialogBox* dlg;
498 
499  dlg = front->GetDialogBox();
500  dlg->GoBack();
501 
502  Front::MenuEvent event;
503  event.SetTypeAndTarget( Front::MenuEvent::vLINK, Script::GenerateCRC("net_network_setup_menu") );
504  menu_factory->LaunchEvent(&event);
505 
506  return false;
507  }
508  default:
509  break;
510  }
511 
512  return true;
513 }

525 bool ScriptDummyCommand(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
526 {
527  return true;
528 }

530 /******************************************************************/
531 /* */
532 /* */
533 /******************************************************************/
534 
535 // C++ version of the script command
536 bool SetActiveCamera(uint32 id, int viewport, bool move_to_current)
537 {
538  Obj::CCompositeObject *p_obj = (Obj::CCompositeObject *)Obj::CCompositeObjectManager::Instance()->GetObjectByID(id);
539  if (!p_obj)
540  {
541  return false;
542  }
543 
544  Obj::CCameraComponent * p_cam_comp = GetCameraComponentFromObject(p_obj);
545 
546  if (p_cam_comp)
547  {
548  // Move this camera to the current camera position. Useful for seamlessly
549  // transitioning between cameras
550  if (move_to_current)
551  {
552  Dbg_MsgAssert(Nx::CViewportManager::sGetActiveCamera(viewport), ("No active camera for viewport %d\n",viewport));
553  p_obj->m_matrix = Nx::CViewportManager::sGetActiveCamera(viewport)->GetMatrix();
554  p_obj->m_pos = Nx::CViewportManager::sGetActiveCamera(viewport)->GetPos();
555  p_cam_comp->Update(); // bit dodgy... force the camera to update itself from the parent object
556  }
557 
558  Nx::CViewportManager::sSetCamera( viewport, p_cam_comp->GetCamera() );
559  }
560  else
561  {
562  Dbg_Message("WARNING: Trying to set camera from object with no camera component");
563  }
564 
565 #if 0
566 // this is not needed any more, as the proxim trigger component has been deprecated in favour
567 // of using whatever camera directly
568  // deactivate all proxim trigger components with this viewport on other objects with cameras and activate any proxim trigger on the new camera object
569  Obj::CProximTriggerComponent* p_prox_comp
570  = static_cast< Obj::CProximTriggerComponent* >(Obj::CCompositeObjectManager::Instance()->GetFirstComponentByType(CRC_PROXIMTRIGGER));
571  while (p_prox_comp)
572  {
573  Obj::CCameraComponent* p_peer_cam_comp = GetCameraComponentFromObject(p_prox_comp->GetObject());
574 
575  if (p_peer_cam_comp)
576  {
577  if (p_peer_cam_comp == p_cam_comp)
578  {
579  p_prox_comp->SetActive();
580  p_prox_comp->SetViewport(viewport);
581  }
582  else
583  {
584  if (p_prox_comp->GetViewport() == viewport)
585  {
586  p_prox_comp->SetInactive();
587  }
588  }
589  }
590 
591  p_prox_comp = static_cast< Obj::CProximTriggerComponent* >(p_prox_comp->GetNextSameType());
592  }
593 
594  // K: If a different camera is switched to when the game is paused it could be that the geometry
595  // it is looking at was switched off by the previous camera. So refresh the proxim component
596  // to make sure it switches back on.
597  // (This fixes a bug when scrolling through the view-gaps menu, where geometry was switching off)
598  p_prox_comp=GetProximTriggerComponentFromObject(p_obj);
599  if (p_prox_comp)
600  {
601  p_prox_comp->ProximUpdate();
602  }
603 #endif
604 
605  return true;
606 }
607 
608 /******************************************************************/
609 /* */
610 /* Waits for n CScript::Update calls. */
611 /******************************************************************/
612 
613 // @script | Wait | Waits for a period of time, where the time can be specified in various units. <nl>
614 // For example: Wait 1200 By default, the units are milliseconds, so
615 // this will wait for 1.2 seconds <nl>
616 // Wait 2.1 seconds This will wait for 2.1 seconds. <nl>
617 // Wait 60 frames This will wait for 60 sixtieths of a second, regardless of the framerate. <nl>
618 // Wait 60 gameframes This will wait for exactly 60 logic calls,
619 // so the actual time it takes will depend on the current framerate. <nl>
620 // In all the above, the units do not have to be plural, so one could type
621 // Wait 1 second instead of Wait 1 seconds
622 // @parm float | | number of units to wait
623 // @flag seconds | measure time in seconds
624 // @flag frames | measure time in frames
625 // @flag gameframes | measure time in gameframes
626 bool ScriptWait(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
627 {
628  float Period=0.0f;
629  pParams->GetFloat(NONAME,&Period);
630 
631  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(0xd029f619/*"seconds"*/) || pParams->ContainsFlag(0x49e0ee96/*"second"*/))
632  {
633  pScript->WaitTime((int)(Period*1000.0f));
634  return true;
635  }
636 
637  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(0xfc37df05/*"gameframe"*/) || pParams->ContainsFlag(0xb99ae3d6/*"gameframes"*/) || pParams->ContainsFlag(0xdcd4ce73/*"game"*/))
638  {
639  pScript->Wait((int)Period);
640  return true;
641  }
642 
643  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(0x4a07c332/*"frame"*/) || pParams->ContainsFlag(0x19176c5/*"frames"*/))
644  {
645  pScript->WaitTime((int)(Period*1000.0f/60.0f)); // This should NOT be changed for PAL, as Tmr::GetTime accounts for PAL
646  return true;
647  }
648 
649  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(0xecaa3345/*"one_per_frame"*/))
650  {
651  pScript->WaitOnePerFrame((int)Period);
652  return true;
653  }
654 
655 
656 
657  pScript->WaitTime((int)Period);
658  return true;
659 }
660 
661 /******************************************************************/
662 /* */
663 /* Added for testing if statements, may be useful anyway though */
664 /******************************************************************/
665 
666 // @script | IsZero | added for testing if statements. may be useful
667 bool ScriptIsZero(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
668 {
669 
670 
671  int Val=0;
672  pParams->GetInteger(NONAME,&Val);
673  if (Val==0)
674  {
675  return true;
676  }
677  else
678  {
679  return false;
680  }
681 }
682 
683 /******************************************************************/
684 /* */
685 /* */
686 /******************************************************************/
687 
688 // @script bool | CastToInteger | If a parameter with the passed name exists and is a float,
689 // this will cast it down to an integer.
690 // So for example, if x=3.141, after calling CastToInteger x, x will be 3.
691 // @uparmopt name | The name of the parameter to be cast down
692 bool ScriptCastToInteger(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
693 {
694  uint32 param_name=0;
695  if (!pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME,&param_name))
696  {
697  return false;
698  }
699 
700  float v=0.0f;
701  if (!pScript->GetParams()->GetFloat(param_name,&v))
702  {
703  return false;
704  }
705 
706  // Need to remove the parameter first, otherwise we will end up with both an integer
707  // and a float parameter with the same name. Components are only automatically replaced if
708  // the new component has the same name and type.
709  pScript->GetParams()->RemoveComponent(param_name);
710  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(param_name,(int)v);
711  return true;
712 }
713 
714 // @script bool | StringToInteger | If a parameter with the passed name exists and is a string,
715 // this will convert it to a integer.
716 // So for example, if x="123", after calling StringToInteger x, x will be 123.
717 // @uparmopt name | The name of the string parameter to be converted.
718 bool ScriptStringToInteger(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
719 {
720  uint32 param_name=0;
721  if (!pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME,&param_name))
722  {
723  return false;
724  }
725 
726  const char *p_string="";
727  if (!pScript->GetParams()->GetString(param_name,&p_string))
728  {
729  return false;
730  }
731 
732  // Need to remove the parameter first, otherwise we will end up with both an integer
733  // and a string parameter with the same name. Components are only automatically replaced if
734  // the new component has the same name and type.
735  pScript->GetParams()->RemoveComponent(param_name);
736 
737  int v=0;
738  int len=strlen(p_string);
739  const char *p_ch=p_string;
740  for (int i=0; i<len; ++i)
741  {
742  Dbg_MsgAssert(*p_ch>='0' && *p_ch<='9',("\n%s\nNon-numeric char in '%s'",pScript->GetScriptInfo(),p_string));
743  v=v*10+*p_ch++-'0';
744  }
745 
746  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(param_name,(int)v);
747  return true;
748 }
749 
750 /******************************************************************/
751 /* */
752 /* */
753 /******************************************************************/
754 
755 // @script bool | IntegerEquals | Returns true if the two values equal
756 // @parmopt int | a | 0 | First value
757 // @parmopt int | b | 0 | Second value
758 bool ScriptIntegerEquals(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
759 {
760  int a = 0;
761  pParams->GetInteger( CRCD(0x174841bc,"a"), &a );
762 
763  int b = 0;
764  pParams->GetInteger( CRCD(0x8e411006,"b"), &b );
765 
766  return ( a == b );
767 }
768 
769 /******************************************************************/
770 /* */
771 /* */
772 /******************************************************************/
773 
774 // @script bool | ChecksumEquals | Returns true if two checksums are equal
775 // @parmopt name | a | 0 (checksum value) | First name
776 // @parmopt name | b | 0 (checksum value) | Second name
777 bool ScriptChecksumEquals(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
778 {
779 
780 
781  uint32 a=0;
782  pParams->GetChecksum("a",&a);
783  uint32 b=0;
784  pParams->GetChecksum("b",&b);
785 
786  return a==b;
787 }
788 
789 /******************************************************************/
790 /* */
791 /* */
792 /******************************************************************/
793 
794 // @script bool | StringEquals | Returns true if two strings are equal
795 // @parm string | a | First string
796 // @parm string | b | Secnond string
797 bool ScriptStringEquals(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
798 {
799 
800 
801  const char* a;
802  pParams->GetText("a",&a,true);
803  const char* b;
804  pParams->GetText("b",&b,true);
805 
806  return Script::GenerateCRC(a)==Script::GenerateCRC(b);
807 }
808 
809 /******************************************************************/
810 /* */
811 /* */
812 /******************************************************************/
813 
814 // @script bool | ArrayContains | Returns true if the array contains an
815 // element equal to the variable. <nl>
816 // Example: ArrayContains array=some_int_array contains=4 <nl>
817 // ArrayContains array=some_string_array contains="some_string"
818 // @parm array | array | The array to search
819 // @parm | contains | The element to search for. Must match array type
820 bool ScriptArrayContains(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
821 {
822 
823 
824  Script::CArray* pArray;
825  pParams->GetArray( "array", &pArray, true );
826 
827  uint8 array_type = pArray->GetType();
828 
829  for ( uint32 i = 0; i < pArray->GetSize(); i++ )
830  {
831  switch ( array_type )
832  {
833  case ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER:
834  {
835  int desiredInteger;
836  pParams->GetInteger( "contains", &desiredInteger, true );
837  if ( desiredInteger == pArray->GetInt( i ) )
838  return true;
839  break;
840  }
841  case ESYMBOLTYPE_NAME:
842  {
843  uint32 desiredChecksum;
844  pParams->GetChecksum( "contains", &desiredChecksum, true );
845  if ( desiredChecksum == pArray->GetNameChecksum( i ) )
846  return true;
847  break;
848  }
849  case ESYMBOLTYPE_STRING:
850  {
851  const char* pDesiredString;
852  pParams->GetText( "contains", &pDesiredString, true );
853  // Changed to use stricmp instead of GenerateCRC because GenerateCRC sees \ and / as
854  // being the same character.
855  if (stricmp(pDesiredString, pArray->GetString( i )) == 0)
856  return true;
857  break;
858  }
859  default:
860  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0, ( "This data type is not yet supported by ArrayContains" ) );
861  break;
862  }
863  }
864 
865  // item was not found
866  return false;
867 }
868 
869 /******************************************************************/
870 /* */
871 /* */
872 /******************************************************************/
873 
874 // @script | GetArraySize | returns the number of elements in the specified structure
875 // @parm | array_size | return value for array size
876 bool ScriptGetArraySize(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
877 {
878  Script::CArray* pArray;
879 
880  pParams->GetArray( NONAME, &pArray, Script::ASSERT );
881 
882  // Add support for higher dimensional arrays
883  uint32 index = 0;
884  if(pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0xba453b9,"index1"),(int*)&index, Script::NO_ASSERT))
885  {
886  pArray = pArray->GetArray(index);
887 
888  if(pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0x92ad0203,"index2"),(int*)&index, Script::NO_ASSERT))
889  {
890  pArray = pArray->GetArray(index);
891 
892  if(pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0xe5aa3295,"index3"),(int*)&index, Script::NO_ASSERT))
893  {
894  pArray = pArray->GetArray(index);
895  }
896  }
897  }
898 
899  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger( "array_size", pArray->GetSize() );
900 
901  return true;
902 }
903 
904 /******************************************************************/
905 /* */
906 /* */
907 /******************************************************************/
908 
909 // @script | SetArrayElement | Changes the value of an element of an array.
910 // @parm name | ArrayName | The name of the array in the current script's parameters whose
911 // value is to be changed.
912 // @parm int | Index | The index of the array element whose value is to be changed.
913 // @parm int | NewValue | The new value for the element. The type of this value must match the
914 // type of the array, so it is not necessarily an integer. If the type does not match that of
915 // the array it will assert.
916 bool ScriptSetArrayElement(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
917 {
918  // TODO: Most of this code should really be in the CArray class. Need to go over that
919  // class to make it easier to manipulate arrays safely. (resize, etc)
920 
921  // Get a pointer to the CArray that is to be modified.
922  // It will be in the script's parameters.
923  uint32 array_name=0;
924  pParams->GetChecksum("ArrayName",&array_name,Script::ASSERT);
925  Script::CArray *p_array=NULL;
926  pScript->GetParams()->GetArray(array_name,&p_array,Script::ASSERT);
927 
928  // Get the index of the element to be changed.
929  uint32 index=0;
930  pParams->GetInteger("Index",(int*)&index,Script::ASSERT);
931 
932  // Find the new value which is to be written into the array.
933  Script::CComponent *p_new_value=pParams->FindNamedComponentRecurse(CRCD(0x4b40630d,"NewValue"));
934  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_new_value,("\n%s\nMissing NewValue parameter in call to SetArrayElement",pScript->GetScriptInfo()));
935  // Resolve the componentn in case the new value is referring to some global.
936  Script::ResolveNameComponent(p_new_value);
937 
938  // Now make a copy of the component. This is because it may contain a pointer, eg a pointer to
939  // a struct, vector, string etc, and that entity may only exist temporarily.
940  // CopyComponent will create a new pointer which will be safe to delete later.
941  Script::CComponent *p_copy=new Script::CComponent;
942  Script::CopyComponent(p_copy,p_new_value);
943 
944  // Check that the type of the new value is consistent with the type of the array.
945  if (p_array->GetType()==ESYMBOLTYPE_FLOAT &&
946  p_copy->mType==ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER)
947  {
948  // It's OK to write an integer value into an array of floats so don't assert in this case.
949  }
950  else
951  {
952  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_copy->mType==p_array->GetType(),("Array type of %s does not match the NewValue type of %s in call to SetArrayElement",Script::GetTypeName(p_array->GetType()),Script::GetTypeName(p_copy->mType)));
953  }
954 
955  // Write the new value into the array.
956  switch (p_array->GetType())
957  {
958  case ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER:
959  p_array->SetInteger(index,p_copy->mIntegerValue);
960  break;
961  case ESYMBOLTYPE_FLOAT:
962  if (p_copy->mType==ESYMBOLTYPE_FLOAT)
963  {
964  p_array->SetFloat(index,p_copy->mFloatValue);
965  }
966  else
967  {
968  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_copy->mType==ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER,("Eh ?"));
969  p_array->SetFloat(index,(float)p_copy->mIntegerValue);
970  }
971  break;
972  case ESYMBOLTYPE_NAME:
973  p_array->SetChecksum(index,p_copy->mChecksum);
974  break;
975  // Now for the types that are referenced by a pointer.
976  // In each of these cases, first the existing pointer in the array gets deleted.
977  // The the pointer to the array of pointers is got, and the new pointer written in.
978  // Cannot use the regular SetString, SetVector etc functions because they all assert if
979  // the existing pointer is not NULL, to catch memory leaks.
980  case ESYMBOLTYPE_STRING:
981  {
982  Script::DeleteString(p_array->GetString(index));
983  char **pp_strings=(char**)p_array->GetArrayPointer();
984  // Need to do a bounds check since not using SetString
985  Dbg_MsgAssert(index<p_array->GetSize(),("Bad index of %d sent to SetArrayElement, array size is %d",index,p_array->GetSize()));
986  pp_strings[index]=p_copy->mpString;
987  break;
988  }
989  case ESYMBOLTYPE_LOCALSTRING:
990  {
991  Script::DeleteString(p_array->GetString(index));
992  char **pp_strings=(char**)p_array->GetArrayPointer();
993  Dbg_MsgAssert(index<p_array->GetSize(),("Bad index of %d sent to SetArrayElement, array size is %d",index,p_array->GetSize()));
994  pp_strings[index]=p_copy->mpLocalString;
995  break;
996  }
997  case ESYMBOLTYPE_PAIR:
998  {
999  delete p_array->GetPair(index);
1000  Script::CPair **pp_pairs=(Script::CPair**)p_array->GetArrayPointer();
1001  Dbg_MsgAssert(index<p_array->GetSize(),("Bad index of %d sent to SetArrayElement, array size is %d",index,p_array->GetSize()));
1002  pp_pairs[index]=p_copy->mpPair;
1003  break;
1004  }
1005  case ESYMBOLTYPE_VECTOR:
1006  {
1007  delete p_array->GetVector(index);
1008  Script::CVector **pp_vectors=(Script::CVector**)p_array->GetArrayPointer();
1009  Dbg_MsgAssert(index<p_array->GetSize(),("Bad index of %d sent to SetArrayElement, array size is %d",index,p_array->GetSize()));
1010  pp_vectors[index]=p_copy->mpVector;
1011  break;
1012  }
1013  case ESYMBOLTYPE_STRUCTURE:
1014  {
1015  delete p_array->GetStructure(index);
1016  Script::CStruct **pp_structs=(Script::CStruct**)p_array->GetArrayPointer();
1017  Dbg_MsgAssert(index<p_array->GetSize(),("Bad index of %d sent to SetArrayElement, array size is %d",index,p_array->GetSize()));
1018  pp_structs[index]=p_copy->mpStructure;
1019  break;
1020  }
1021  case ESYMBOLTYPE_ARRAY:
1022  {
1023  Script::CArray *p_old_array=p_array->GetArray(index);
1024  Script::CleanUpArray(p_old_array);
1025  delete p_old_array;
1026  Script::CArray **pp_arrays=(Script::CArray**)p_array->GetArrayPointer();
1027  Dbg_MsgAssert(index<p_array->GetSize(),("Bad index of %d sent to SetArrayElement, array size is %d",index,p_array->GetSize()));
1028  pp_arrays[index]=p_copy->mpArray;
1029  break;
1030  }
1031  default:
1032  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("Unsupported array type of %s in SetArrayElement",Script::GetTypeName(p_array->GetType())));
1033  break;
1034  }
1035 
1036  // Now delete the temporary component, but set any pointer in it to NULL first since the
1037  // pointer has been given to the array.
1038  p_copy->mUnion=0;
1039  delete p_copy;
1040 
1041  return true;
1042 }
1043 
1044 /******************************************************************/
1045 /* */
1046 /* */
1047 /******************************************************************/
1048 
1049 // @script | Get2DarrayData |
1050 bool ScriptGet2DArrayData(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1051 {
1052  uint32 array_name=0;
1053  pParams->GetChecksum(CRCD(0x8f61d602,"ArrayName"),&array_name,Script::ASSERT);
1054  Script::CArray *p_array1=NULL;
1055  if(!pScript->GetParams()->GetArray(array_name,&p_array1,Script::NO_ASSERT))
1056  {
1057  p_array1 = Script::GetArray( array_name,Script::ASSERT);
1058  }
1059 
1060  // Get the index of the element
1061  uint32 index1=0;
1062  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0xba453b9,"Index1"),(int*)&index1,Script::ASSERT);
1063 
1064  // Get the index of the element
1065  uint32 index2=0;
1066  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0x92ad0203,"Index2"),(int*)&index2,Script::ASSERT);
1067 
1068 
1069  Dbg_MsgAssert(index1<p_array1->GetSize(),("Bad index of %d sent to Get2DArrayData, array size is %d",index1,p_array1->GetSize()));
1070  Script::CArray *p_array2=p_array1->GetArray(index1);
1071 
1072  Dbg_MsgAssert(index2<p_array2->GetSize(),("Bad index of %d sent to Get2DArrayData, array size is %d",index2,p_array2->GetSize()));
1073 
1074  switch (p_array2->GetType())
1075  {
1076  case ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER:
1077  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array2->GetInteger(index2) );
1078  break;
1079  case ESYMBOLTYPE_FLOAT:
1080  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array2->GetFloat(index2) );
1081  break;
1082  case ESYMBOLTYPE_NAME:
1083  pScript->GetParams()->AddChecksum( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array2->GetChecksum(index2) );
1084  break;
1085  case ESYMBOLTYPE_STRING:
1086  {
1087  pScript->GetParams()->AddString( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array2->GetString(index2) );
1088  break;
1089  }
1090  case ESYMBOLTYPE_LOCALSTRING:
1091  {
1092  pScript->GetParams()->AddString( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array2->GetString(index2) );
1093  break;
1094  }
1095  case ESYMBOLTYPE_PAIR:
1096  {
1097  Script::CPair *p_pair = p_array2->GetPair(index2);
1098  pScript->GetParams()->AddPair( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_pair->mX, p_pair->mY );
1099  break;
1100  }
1101  case ESYMBOLTYPE_VECTOR:
1102  {
1103  Script::CVector *p_vector = p_array2->GetVector(index2);
1104 
1105  pScript->GetParams()->AddVector( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_vector->mX, p_vector->mY, p_vector->mZ );
1106  break;
1107  }
1108  case ESYMBOLTYPE_STRUCTURE:
1109  {
1110  pScript->GetParams()->AddStructure( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array2->GetStructure(index2) );
1111  break;
1112  }
1113  case ESYMBOLTYPE_ARRAY:
1114  {
1115  pScript->GetParams()->AddArray( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array2->GetArray(index2) );
1116  break;
1117  }
1118  default:
1119  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("Unsupported array type of %s",Script::GetTypeName(p_array2->GetType())));
1120  break;
1121  }
1122  return true;
1123 }
1124 
1125 /******************************************************************/
1126 /* */
1127 /* */
1128 /******************************************************************/
1129 
1130 // @script | Get3DarrayData |
1131 bool ScriptGet3DArrayData(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1132 {
1133  uint32 array_name=0;
1134  pParams->GetChecksum(CRCD(0x8f61d602,"ArrayName"),&array_name,Script::ASSERT);
1135  Script::CArray *p_array1=NULL;
1136  if(!pScript->GetParams()->GetArray(array_name,&p_array1,Script::NO_ASSERT))
1137  {
1138  p_array1 = Script::GetArray( array_name,Script::ASSERT);
1139  }
1140 
1141  // Get the index of the element
1142  uint32 index1=0;
1143  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0xba453b9,"Index1"),(int*)&index1,Script::ASSERT);
1144 
1145  // Get the index of the element
1146  uint32 index2=0;
1147  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0x92ad0203,"Index2"),(int*)&index2,Script::ASSERT);
1148 
1149  // Get the index of the element
1150  uint32 index3=0;
1151  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0xe5aa3295,"Index3"),(int*)&index3,Script::ASSERT);
1152 
1153  Dbg_MsgAssert(index1<p_array1->GetSize(),("Bad index of %d sent to Get3DArrayData, array size is %d",index1,p_array1->GetSize()));
1154  Script::CArray *p_array2=p_array1->GetArray(index1);
1155 
1156  Dbg_MsgAssert(index2<p_array2->GetSize(),("Bad index of %d sent to Get3DArrayData, array size is %d",index2,p_array2->GetSize()));
1157  Script::CArray *p_array3=p_array2->GetArray(index2);
1158 
1159  Dbg_MsgAssert(index3<p_array3->GetSize(),("Bad index of %d sent to Get3DArrayData, array size is %d",index3,p_array3->GetSize()));
1160 
1161 
1162  switch (p_array3->GetType())
1163  {
1164  case ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER:
1165  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array3->GetInteger(index3) );
1166  break;
1167  case ESYMBOLTYPE_FLOAT:
1168  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat(CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array3->GetFloat(index3) );
1169  break;
1170  case ESYMBOLTYPE_NAME:
1171  pScript->GetParams()->AddChecksum( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array3->GetChecksum(index3) );
1172  break;
1173  case ESYMBOLTYPE_STRING:
1174  {
1175  pScript->GetParams()->AddString( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array3->GetString(index3) );
1176  break;
1177  }
1178  case ESYMBOLTYPE_LOCALSTRING:
1179  {
1180  pScript->GetParams()->AddString( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array3->GetString(index3) );
1181  break;
1182  }
1183  case ESYMBOLTYPE_PAIR:
1184  {
1185  Script::CPair *p_pair = p_array3->GetPair(index3);
1186  pScript->GetParams()->AddPair( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_pair->mX, p_pair->mY );
1187  break;
1188  }
1189  case ESYMBOLTYPE_VECTOR:
1190  {
1191  Script::CVector *p_vector = p_array3->GetVector(index3);
1192 
1193  pScript->GetParams()->AddVector( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_vector->mX, p_vector->mY, p_vector->mZ );
1194  break;
1195  }
1196  case ESYMBOLTYPE_STRUCTURE:
1197  {
1198  pScript->GetParams()->AddStructure( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array3->GetStructure(index3) );
1199  break;
1200  }
1201  case ESYMBOLTYPE_ARRAY:
1202  {
1203  pScript->GetParams()->AddArray( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array3->GetArray(index3) );
1204  break;
1205  }
1206  default:
1207  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("Unsupported array type of %s",Script::GetTypeName(p_array3->GetType())));
1208  break;
1209  }
1210  return true;
1211 }
1212 
1213 /******************************************************************/
1214 /* */
1215 /* */
1216 /******************************************************************/
1217 
1218 // @script | GetNDarrayData |
1219 bool ScriptGetNDArrayData(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1220 {
1221  uint32 array_name=0;
1222  pParams->GetChecksum(CRCD(0x8f61d602,"ArrayName"),&array_name,Script::ASSERT);
1223  Script::CArray *p_array=NULL;
1224  if(!pScript->GetParams()->GetArray(array_name,&p_array,Script::NO_ASSERT))
1225  {
1226  p_array = Script::GetArray( array_name,Script::ASSERT);
1227  }
1228 
1229  uint32 indices_name=CRCD(0xffc8e484,"Indices");
1230  //pParams->GetChecksum("Indices",&indices_name,Script::ASSERT);
1231  Script::CArray *p_indices=NULL;
1232  pScript->GetParams()->GetArray(indices_name,&p_indices,Script::ASSERT);
1233 
1234  uint32 i = 0;
1235  uint32 index=0;
1236  for(; i < p_indices->GetSize()-1; ++i)
1237  {
1238  // Get the index of the element
1239  index = p_indices->GetInteger( i );
1240 
1241  p_array = p_array->GetArray(index);
1242  }
1243  index = p_indices->GetInteger( i );
1244 
1245  switch (p_array->GetType())
1246  {
1247  case ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER:
1248  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array->GetInteger(index) );
1249  break;
1250  case ESYMBOLTYPE_FLOAT:
1251  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array->GetFloat(index) );
1252  break;
1253  case ESYMBOLTYPE_NAME:
1254  pScript->GetParams()->AddChecksum( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array->GetChecksum(index) );
1255  break;
1256  case ESYMBOLTYPE_STRING:
1257  {
1258  pScript->GetParams()->AddString( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array->GetString(index) );
1259  break;
1260  }
1261  case ESYMBOLTYPE_LOCALSTRING:
1262  {
1263  pScript->GetParams()->AddString( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array->GetString(index) );
1264  break;
1265  }
1266  case ESYMBOLTYPE_PAIR:
1267  {
1268  Script::CPair *p_pair = p_array->GetPair(index);
1269  pScript->GetParams()->AddPair( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_pair->mX, p_pair->mY );
1270  break;
1271  }
1272  case ESYMBOLTYPE_VECTOR:
1273  {
1274  Script::CVector *p_vector = p_array->GetVector(index);
1275 
1276  pScript->GetParams()->AddVector( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_vector->mX, p_vector->mY, p_vector->mZ );
1277  break;
1278  }
1279  case ESYMBOLTYPE_STRUCTURE:
1280  {
1281  pScript->GetParams()->AddStructure( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array->GetStructure(index) );
1282  break;
1283  }
1284  case ESYMBOLTYPE_ARRAY:
1285  {
1286  pScript->GetParams()->AddArray( CRCD(0x6820459a,"val"), p_array->GetArray(index) );
1287  break;
1288  }
1289  default:
1290  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("Unsupported array type of %s",Script::GetTypeName(p_array->GetType())));
1291  break;
1292  }
1293  return true;
1294 
1295 }
1296 
1297 /******************************************************************/
1298 /* */
1299 /* */
1300 /******************************************************************/
1301 
1302 // @script | AddParams | appends the given structure to the list of params
1303 // @uparmopt {} | structure to append to params
1304 bool ScriptAddParams(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1305 {
1306  pScript->GetParams()->AppendStructure(pParams);
1307  return true;
1308 }
1309 
1310 /******************************************************************/
1311 /* */
1312 /* */
1313 /******************************************************************/
1314 
1315 // @script | RemoveComponent | removes a component from the script's list of params
1316 // @uparm name | name of component to remove
1317 bool ScriptRemoveComponent(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1318 {
1319  uint32 name;
1320  if ( !pParams->GetChecksum("name", &name, Script::NO_ASSERT) )
1321  {
1322  pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME, &name, Script::ASSERT);
1323  }
1324 
1325  pScript->GetParams()->RemoveComponent(name);
1326 
1327  return true;
1328 }
1329 
1330 /******************************************************************/
1331 /* */
1332 /* */
1333 /******************************************************************/
1334 
1335 static uint32 s_get_bottom_up_free(bool includeFrag)
1336 {
1337  Mem::Manager& mem_man = Mem::Manager::sHandle();
1338  Mem::Heap* p_heap = mem_man.GetHeap( CRCD(0xc7800b0,"BottomUpHeap") );
1339  Mem::Region* p_region = p_heap->ParentRegion();
1340 
1341  if (includeFrag)
1342  {
1343  return p_heap->mFreeMem.m_count + p_region->MemAvailable();
1344  }
1345  return p_region->MemAvailable();
1346 }
1347 
1348 // @script | SetScriptString |
1349 bool ScriptSetScriptString(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1350 {
1351  int index=0;
1352  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0x7f8c98fe,"index"),&index);
1353 
1354  const char *p_string="";
1355  pParams->GetString(CRCD(0x61414d56,"string"),&p_string);
1356 
1357  Script::SetScriptString(index,p_string);
1358  return true;
1359 }
1360 
1361 // @script | GetScriptString |
1362 bool ScriptGetScriptString(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1363 {
1364  int index=0;
1365  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0x7f8c98fe,"index"),&index);
1366 
1367  pScript->GetParams()->AddString(CRCD(0x61414d56,"string"),Script::GetScriptString(index));
1368  return true;
1369 }
1370 
1371 // @script | KenTest1 | old test of ken's
1372 bool ScriptKenTest1(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1373 {
1374  static bool s_got_main_heap_free_edit=false;
1375  static uint32 s_main_heap_free_edit=0;
1376 
1377  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x1a4e0ef9,"Clear")))
1378  {
1379  s_got_main_heap_free_edit=false;
1380  s_main_heap_free_edit=0;
1381  }
1382 
1383  if (!s_got_main_heap_free_edit)
1384  {
1385  s_main_heap_free_edit = s_get_bottom_up_free(true);
1386  printf("Stored s_main_heap_free_edit\n");
1387  s_got_main_heap_free_edit=true;
1388  return true;
1389  }
1390 
1391 # if !defined( __PLAT_NGC__ ) || ( defined( __PLAT_NGC__ ) && !defined( __NOPT_FINAL__ ) )
1392  uint32 main_heap_free_play = s_get_bottom_up_free(false);
1393 
1394  printf("main_heap_pad = %d\n", s_main_heap_free_edit - main_heap_free_play + 200000);
1395 #endif // __NOPT_FINAL__
1396 
1397  return true;
1398 }
1399 
1400 // Used when creating default file names in the files menu.
1401 // It appends the passed suffix, but if the result will be a string longer than MaxChars
1402 // then it will move the suffix back so that the total number of chars is never more than
1403 // MaxChars.
1404 bool ScriptAppendSuffix(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1405 {
1406  enum
1407  {
1408  BUFFER_SIZE=100,
1409  };
1410  char p_new_text[BUFFER_SIZE];
1411 
1412  const char *p_text="";
1413  pParams->GetString(CRCD(0xc4745838,"Text"), &p_text);
1414  int original_text_length=strlen(p_text);
1415  Dbg_MsgAssert(original_text_length<BUFFER_SIZE,("Text '%s' too long",p_text));
1416  strcpy(p_new_text,p_text);
1417 
1418  int max_chars=15;
1419  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0xa6931595,"MaxChars"), &max_chars);
1420  Dbg_MsgAssert(max_chars<BUFFER_SIZE,("max_chars too big"));
1421 
1422 
1423  int suffix=1;
1424  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0x4a4f7821,"suffix"),&suffix);
1425 
1426  char p_suffix[20];
1427  sprintf(p_suffix, " %d",suffix);
1428  int suffix_length=strlen(p_suffix);
1429  Dbg_MsgAssert(suffix_length<max_chars,("max_chars of %d too small for suffix '%s'",suffix_length,p_suffix));
1430 
1431  if (original_text_length + suffix_length > max_chars)
1432  {
1433  p_new_text[max_chars-suffix_length]=0;
1434  }
1435  strcat(p_new_text, p_suffix);
1436 
1437 
1438  uint32 new_text_name=0;
1439  pParams->GetChecksum(CRCD(0x50060694,"NewTextName"),&new_text_name);
1440 
1441  pScript->GetParams()->AddString(new_text_name, p_new_text);
1442  return true;
1443 }
1444 
1445 // @script | FindNearestRailPoint |
1446 // Used by the rail editor for snapping the cursor to the nearest rail point.
1447 // Note that for this to work CParkGenerator::GenerateOutRailSet needs to have been called at some point first.
1448 // If it were not called, this would only find the nearest edited-rail point.
1449 bool ScriptFindNearestRailPoint(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1450 {
1451  Mth::Vector pos;
1452  pParams->GetVector(CRCD(0x7f261953,"Pos"),&pos,Script::ASSERT);
1453 
1454  float min_dist=150.0f;
1455  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x213395f1,"MinDist"),&min_dist);
1456  float min_dist2=min_dist*min_dist;
1457 
1458  uint32 ignore_rail_id=0;
1459  pParams->GetChecksum(CRCD(0x288a6efe,"IgnoreRailId"),&ignore_rail_id);
1460 
1461  int ignore_rail_point_index=-1;
1462  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0xe4d305a7,"IgnoreRailPointIndex"),&ignore_rail_point_index);
1463 
1464 
1465  // Find the nearest edited-rail point
1466  Mth::Vector edited_rail_nearest_point;
1467  float edited_rail_nearest_dist2=100000000.0f;
1468  uint32 rail_id=0;
1469  int rail_point_index=0;
1470  Obj::GetRailEditor()->FindNearestRailPoint(pos,
1471  &edited_rail_nearest_point, &edited_rail_nearest_dist2,
1472  &rail_id,&rail_point_index,
1473  ignore_rail_id, ignore_rail_point_index);
1474 
1475  // Then find the nearest rail point on the park editor level geometry.
1476  // CParkGenerator::GenerateOutRailSet needs to have been called at some point first for this to
1477  // find anything.
1478  // Not calling GenerateOutRailSet here because it may take a while to execute.
1479  Mth::Vector level_nearest_point;
1480  float level_nearest_dist2=100000000.0f;
1481  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x9c247a94,"CheckLevelGeometry")))
1482  {
1483  Ed::CParkManager::sInstance()->GetGenerator()->FindNearestRailPoint(pos,&level_nearest_point,&level_nearest_dist2);
1484  }
1485 
1486  if (edited_rail_nearest_dist2 < min_dist2 ||
1487  level_nearest_dist2 < min_dist2)
1488  {
1489  Mth::Vector nearest_point;
1490  if (edited_rail_nearest_dist2 < level_nearest_dist2)
1491  {
1492  nearest_point=edited_rail_nearest_point;
1493 
1494  pScript->GetParams()->AddChecksum(CRCD(0xa61e7cd9,"rail_id"),rail_id);
1495  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(CRCD(0xab3c14,"rail_point_index"),rail_point_index);
1496  }
1497  else
1498  {
1499  nearest_point=level_nearest_point;
1500  }
1501  pScript->GetParams()->AddVector(CRCD(0xdf970a05,"NearestPos"),nearest_point[X],nearest_point[Y],nearest_point[Z]);
1502  return true;
1503  }
1504 
1505  return false;
1506 }
1507 
1508 bool ScriptGetTime(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1509 {
1510 #ifdef __PLAT_NGPS__
1511 /*
1512  sceCdCLOCK rtc;
1513  sceScfGetLocalTimefromRTC(&rtc);
1514 
1515  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger("Hours",rtc.hour);
1516  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger("Minutes",rtc.minute);
1517  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger("Seconds",rtc.second);
1518 */
1519 #endif
1520  return true;
1521 }
1522 
1523 bool ScriptGetDate(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1524 {
1525 #ifdef __PLAT_NGPS__
1526 /*
1527  sceCdCLOCK rtc;
1528  sceScfGetLocalTimefromRTC(&rtc);
1529 
1530  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger("Day",rtc.day);
1531  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger("Month",rtc.month);
1532  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger("Year",rtc.year);
1533 */
1534 #endif
1535 
1536  return true;
1537 }

1545 {
1546  return true;

1554 bool ScriptRandomize(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1555 {
1556  Mth::InitialRand(Tmr::ElapsedTime(0));
1557  return true;
1558 }

1577 static Tmr::Time sStartTime=0;
1578 bool ScriptResetTimer(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1579 {
1580  sStartTime=Tmr::ElapsedTime(0);
1581  return true;
1582 }

1585 /* */
1586 /* */
1587 /******************************************************************/
1588 
1589 bool ScriptTimeGreaterThan(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1590 {
1591  float t=0.0f;
1592  pParams->GetFloat(NONAME,&t);
1593 
1594  if (Tmr::ElapsedTime(sStartTime)>t*1000.0f)
1595  {
1596  return true;
1597  }
1598  return false;
1599 }

1601 /******************************************************************/
1602 /* */
1603 /* */
1604 /******************************************************************/
1605 
1606 bool ScriptGetStartTime(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1607 {
1608  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(CRCD(0xd16b61e6, "StartTime"), Tmr::GetTime());
1609  return true;
1610 }

1612 /******************************************************************/
1613 /* */
1614 /* */
1615 /******************************************************************/
1616 
1617 bool ScriptGetElapsedTime(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1618 {
1619  int start_time;
1620  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0xd16b61e6, "StartTime"), &start_time);
1621  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(CRCD(0x3eb3566b, "ElapsedTime"), Tmr::ElapsedTime(start_time));
1622  return true;
1623 }
1624 
1625 /******************************************************************/
1626 /* */
1627 /* */
1628 /******************************************************************/
1629 
1630 // @script | RemoveParameter | Removes the parameter with the given name. If no such parameter
1631 // exists, it will do nothing.
1632 // @uparmopt name | The name of the parameter to be removed
1633 bool ScriptRemoveParameter(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1634 {
1635  uint32 name=0;
1636  pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME,&name);
1637 
1638  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
1639  const char *p_foo=NULL;
1640  Dbg_MsgAssert(!pParams->GetString(NONAME,&p_foo),("\n%s\nRemoveParameter requires a name, not a string",pScript->GetScriptInfo()));
1641  #endif
1642 
1643  CStruct *p_params=pScript->GetParams();
1644  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_params,("NULL p_params ??"));
1645  p_params->RemoveComponent(name);
1646  p_params->RemoveFlag(name);
1647  return true;
1648 }
1649 
1650 /******************************************************************/
1651 /* */
1652 /* */
1653 /******************************************************************/
1654 
1655 // @script | GetRandomValue | Chooses a random number in a specified range. The returned value can
1656 // be selected to be either an integer or a floating point value.
1657 // @parmopt name | name | 0 | The name to be given to the random value parameter. For example,
1658 // name=foo will make the random number be assigned to a parameter called foo.
1659 // @parmopt float | a | 0.0 | The first value in the range.
1660 // @parmopt float | b | 0.0 | The second value in the range. The first value does not have to be smaller than the second.
1661 // @parmopt int | Resolution | 1000 | The number of possible floating point values that could be returned.
1662 // For example, if the range is a=1, b=2 and the resolution is set to 3, it will return either 1, 1.5 or 2
1663 // @flag Integer | Return an integer value in the given range, inclusive of the end values.
1664 // For example, if the range is a=1, b=3 it will return either 1, 2 or 3. Note that a and b need to be
1665 // integers instead of floats in this case.
1666 bool ScriptGetRandomValue(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1667 {
1668  uint32 param_name=0;
1669  pParams->GetChecksum(CRCD(0xa1dc81f9,"Name"),&param_name);
1670 
1671  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xa5f054f4,"Integer")))
1672  {
1673  int a=0;
1674  int b=0;
1675  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0x174841bc,"a"),&a);
1676  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0x8e411006,"b"),&b);
1677  if (a>b)
1678  {
1679  int t=a;
1680  a=b;
1681  b=t;
1682  }
1683  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(param_name,a+Mth::Rnd(b-a+1));
1684  }
1685  else
1686  {
1687  int resolution=1000;
1688  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0x22cf075,"Resolution"),&resolution);
1689  Dbg_MsgAssert(resolution>=2,("Resolution needs to be at least 2"));
1690 
1691  float a=0.0f;
1692  float b=0.0f;
1693  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x174841bc,"a"),&a);
1694  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x8e411006,"b"),&b);
1695 
1696  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat(param_name,a+Mth::Rnd(resolution)*(b-a)/(resolution-1));
1697  }
1698 
1699  return true;
1700 }
1701 
1702 /******************************************************************/
1703 /* */
1704 /* */
1705 /******************************************************************/
1706 
1707 // @script | SetConfig | Allows various things in the config module to be changed at runtime.
1708 // @parmopt name | Language | | Can be one of English, French or German
1709 // @flag CD | Use CD for file loading
1710 // @flag NotCD | Use host for file loading
1711 // @flag GotExtraMemory | Switch on use of extra memory
1712 // @flag NoExtraMemory | Switch off use of extra memory
1713 // @flag Pal | Be in PAL mode
1714 // @flag NTSC | Be in NTSC mode
1715 // @parmopt int | FrameRate | | Frame rate to use, 50 or 60
1716 bool ScriptSetConfig(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1717 {
1718  uint32 language_checksum=0;
1719  pParams->GetChecksum(CRCD(0x2b248e4a,"Language"),&language_checksum);
1720 
1721  switch (language_checksum)
1722  {
1723  case 0xd37cfdff: // English
1724  Config::gLanguage=Config::LANGUAGE_ENGLISH;
1725  break;
1726  case 0x508a31a1: // French
1727  Config::gLanguage=Config::LANGUAGE_FRENCH;
1728  break;
1729  case 0x5dcbbf5e: // German
1730  Config::gLanguage=Config::LANGUAGE_GERMAN;
1731  break;
1732  case 0xcbe70acb: // Spanish
1733  Config::gLanguage=Config::LANGUAGE_FRENCH;
1734  break;
1735  case 0xa8469630: // Italian
1736  Config::gLanguage=Config::LANGUAGE_GERMAN;
1737  break;
1738  default:
1739  break;
1740  }
1741 
1742  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xba297025,"cd")))
1743  {
1744  if (!Config::gCD)
1745  {
1746  File::InstallFileSystem();
1747  }
1748  Config::gCD=true;
1749  }
1750  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x2b6d7b32,"notcd")))
1751  {
1752  if (Config::gCD)
1753  {
1754  File::UninstallFileSystem();
1755  }
1756  Config::gCD=false;
1757  }
1758 
1759  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x38d23fd4,"GotExtraMemory")))
1760  {
1761  Config::gGotExtraMemory=true;
1762  }
1763  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xaf11b50f,"NoExtraMemory")))
1764  {
1765  Config::gGotExtraMemory=false;
1766  }
1767 
1768  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x6cad3928,"Pal")))
1769  {
1770  Config::gDisplayType=Config::DISPLAY_TYPE_PAL;
1771  }
1772  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x86137a88,"NTSC")))
1773  {
1774  Config::gDisplayType=Config::DISPLAY_TYPE_NTSC;
1775  }
1776 
1777  int frame_rate=60;
1778  if (pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0xee2bc65f,"FrameRate"),&frame_rate))
1779  {
1780  Config::gFPS=frame_rate;
1781  }
1782 
1783  return true;
1784 }
1785 
1786 /******************************************************************/
1787 /* */
1788 /* */
1789 /******************************************************************/
1790 
1791 // @script | PrintConfig | Prints the current system configuration, whether it is CD, PAL, etc.
1792 bool ScriptPrintConfig(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1793 {
1794  printf("\n");
1795  printf("System Configuration:\n\n");
1796  printf("Hardware = %s\n",Config::GetHardwareName());
1797  printf("Display Type = %s, %d fps\n",Config::GetDisplayTypeName(),Config::FPS());
1798  printf("Language = %s\n",Config::GetLanguageName());
1799  printf("Territory = %s\n",Config::GetTerritoryName());
1800  printf("CD = %s\n",Config::CD()?"True":"False");
1801  printf("GotExtraMemory = %s\n",Config::GotExtraMemory()?"True":"False");
1802  printf("\n");
1803 
1804  return true;
1805 }
1806

1814 {
1815  return Config::GetLanguage()==Config::LANGUAGE_GERMAN;
1816 }

1819 bool ScriptFrench(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1820 {
1821  return Config::GetLanguage()==Config::LANGUAGE_FRENCH;
1822 }

1825 bool ScriptSpanish(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1826 {
1827  return Config::GetLanguage()==Config::LANGUAGE_SPANISH;
1828 }

1834 }

1842 /******************************************************************/
1843 /* */
1844 /* */
1845 /******************************************************************/
1846 #ifdef __USE_PROFILER__
1847 static Tmr::CPUCycles sStopwatchStartTime=0;
1848 #endif
1849 
1850 bool ScriptResetStopwatch(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1851 {
1852 #ifdef __USE_PROFILER__
1853  sStopwatchStartTime=Tmr::GetTimeInCPUCycles();
1854 #endif
1855  return true;
1856 }
1857 
1858 /******************************************************************/
1859 /* */
1860 /* */
1861 /******************************************************************/
1862 
1863 bool ScriptPrintStopwatchTime(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1864 {
1865 #ifdef __USE_PROFILER__
1866  Tmr::CPUCycles diff=Tmr::GetTimeInCPUCycles()-sStopwatchStartTime;
1867  printf("Stopwatch time = %.3f seconds\n",(float)diff/150000000.0f);
1868 #endif
1869  return true;
1870 }

1872 /******************************************************************/
1873 /* */
1874 /* */
1875 /******************************************************************/
1876 
1877 // @script | CustomSkaterFilenameDefined | Doesn't appear to be supported
1878 bool ScriptCustomSkaterFilenameDefined(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1879 {
1880 
1881  Mdl::Skate * pSkate = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
1882  Obj::CSkaterProfile* pSkaterProfile=pSkate->GetCurrentProfile();
1883  Dbg_MsgAssert(pSkaterProfile,("NULL pSkaterProfile"));
1884 
1885  if (strcmp(pSkaterProfile->GetCASFileName(),"Unimplemented")==0)
1886  {
1887  return false;
1888  }
1889  else
1890  {
1891  return true;
1892  }
1893 }
1894 
1895 /******************************************************************/
1896 /* */
1897 /* */
1898 /******************************************************************/
1899 
1900 // @script | GetCustomSkaterFilename | Gets the filename for the current CAS
1901 bool ScriptGetCustomSkaterFilename(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1902 {
1903 
1904  Mdl::Skate * pSkate = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
1905  Obj::CSkaterProfile* pSkaterProfile=pSkate->GetCurrentProfile();
1906  Dbg_MsgAssert(pSkaterProfile,("NULL pSkaterProfile"));
1907 
1908  pScript->GetParams()->AddString(CRCD(0xf36c1878,"CASFileName"),pSkaterProfile->GetCASFileName());
1909  return true;
1910 }
1911 
1912 /******************************************************************/
1913 /* */
1914 /* */
1915 /******************************************************************/
1916 
1917 // @script | SetCustomSkaterFilename | Sets the filename for the current CAS
1918 bool ScriptSetCustomSkaterFilename(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1919 {
1920  Mdl::Skate * pSkate = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
1921  Obj::CSkaterProfile* pSkaterProfile=pSkate->GetCurrentProfile();
1922  Dbg_MsgAssert(pSkaterProfile,("NULL pSkaterProfile"));
1923 
1924  const char *p_file_name="Unimplemented";
1925  pParams->GetString(NONAME,&p_file_name);
1926  pSkaterProfile->SetCASFileName(p_file_name);
1927  return true;
1928 }

1937 {
1938 #if 0
1939  Ed::ParkEditor * pParkEd = Ed::ParkEditor::Instance();
1940  if (pParkEd->IsInitialized() && !pParkEd->GameGoingOrOutsideEditor())
1941  {
1942  // We're in the park editor, editing a park.
1943  return true;
1944  }
1945 #endif
1946 
1947  return false;
1948 }

1950 /******************************************************************/
1951 /* */
1952 /* */
1953 /******************************************************************/
1954 
1955 #define PARK_NAME_BUF_SIZE 128
1956 static char spParkName[PARK_NAME_BUF_SIZE]={0};
1957 
1958 // @script | GetParkName | Gets the current park name
1959 bool ScriptGetParkName(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1960 {
1961  pScript->GetParams()->AddString(CRCD(0xcc23bddb,"ParkName"),spParkName);
1962  return false;
1963 }
1964 
1965 /******************************************************************/
1966 /* */
1967 /* */
1968 /******************************************************************/
1969 
1970 // @script | SetParkName | Sets the current park name
1971 bool ScriptSetParkName(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
1972 {
1973  const char *p_name="";
1974  pParams->GetString(NONAME,&p_name);
1975  Dbg_MsgAssert(strlen(p_name)<PARK_NAME_BUF_SIZE,("Park name '%s' too long",p_name));
1976 
1977  strcpy(spParkName,p_name);
1978  return false;
1979 }

1992 #endif
1993  return false;
