1996 /******************************************************************/
1997 /* */
1998 /* */
1999 /******************************************************************/
2000 
2001 static bool MenuIsShown(uint32 id)
2002 {
2003 /*
2004  Front::MenuFactory * pMenuFactory = Front::MenuFactory::Instance();
2005  Front::MenuElement *pMenuElement=pMenuFactory->GetMenuElement(id,false); // false means don't assert
2006 
2007  if (pMenuElement && pMenuElement->m_isShown)
2008  return true;
2009  else
2010  return false;
2011 */
2012 
2013  return false;
2014 }
2015 
2016 /******************************************************************/
2017 /* */
2018 /* */
2019 /******************************************************************/
2020 
2021 // @script | MenuIsShown | Checks array of names (pArray) is shown
2022 bool ScriptMenuIsShown(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
2023 {
2024  // If there is an array of names, check them.
2025  Script::CArray *pArray=NULL;
2026  if (pParams->GetArray(NONAME,&pArray))
2027  {
2028  Dbg_MsgAssert(pArray,("Eh? NULL pArray?"));
2029  for (uint32 i=0; i<pArray->GetSize(); ++i)
2030  {
2031  if (MenuIsShown(pArray->GetNameChecksum(i)))
2032  {
2033  return true;
2034  }
2035  }
2036  }
2037 
2038  uint32 id=0;
2039  if (pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME,&id))
2040  {
2041  if (MenuIsShown(id))
2042  {
2043  return true;
2044  }
2045  }
2046 
2047  return false;
2048 }
2049 
2050 /******************************************************************/
2051 /* */
2052 /* */
2053 /******************************************************************/
2054 
2055 static bool MenuIsSelected(uint32 id)
2056 {
2057 
2058  /*
2059  Front::MenuFactory * pMenuFactory = Front::MenuFactory::Instance();
2060  Front::MenuElement *pMenuElement=pMenuFactory->GetMenuElement(id,false); // false means don't assert
2061 
2062  if (pMenuElement && pMenuElement->m_isSelected)
2063  return true;
2064  else
2065  return false;
2066  */
2067  return false;
2068 }
2069 
2070 /******************************************************************/
2071 /* */
2072 /* */
2073 /******************************************************************/
2074 
2075 // @script | ForEachIn | For each member of the array, run the specified script
2076 // @parm name | Do | The name of the script to run
2077 // @uparm [] | The array on which to run
2078 // @parmopt structure | Params | | any extra parameters that need to be
2079 // merged onto each of those in the array
2080 bool ScriptForEachIn(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
2081 {
2082  uint32 ScriptChecksum=0;
2083  pParams->GetChecksum(CRCD(0x62ba3f6a,"Do"),&ScriptChecksum);
2084  Dbg_MsgAssert(ScriptChecksum,("\n%s\nScript name missing in call to ForEachIn\n(eg, ForEachIn AnArray Do=AScript)",pScript->GetScriptInfo()));
2085 
2086  Script::CArray *pArray=NULL;
2087  pParams->GetArray(NONAME,&pArray);
2088  Dbg_MsgAssert(pArray,("\n%s\nMissing array parameter in call to ForEachIn",pScript->GetScriptInfo()));
2089  Dbg_MsgAssert(pArray->GetSize()==0 || pArray->GetType()==ESYMBOLTYPE_STRUCTURE,("\n%s\nForEachIn only supports arrays of structures at the moment",pScript->GetScriptInfo()));
2090 
2091 
2092  // Get any extra parameters that need to be merged onto each of those in the array.
2093  Script::CStruct *pExtraParams=NULL;
2094  pParams->GetStructure(CRCD(0x7031f10c,"params"),&pExtraParams);
2095 
2096  if (pExtraParams)
2097  {
2098  // Used for holding the merged parameters.
2099  Script::CStruct *pTotalParams=new Script::CStruct;
2100 
2101  for (uint32 i=0; i<pArray->GetSize(); ++i)
2102  {
2103  pTotalParams->Clear();
2104 
2105  CStruct *p_array_struct=pArray->GetStructure(i);
2106 
2107  if (p_array_struct)
2108  {
2109  *pTotalParams+=*p_array_struct;
2110  }
2111 
2112  if (pExtraParams)
2113  {
2114  *pTotalParams+=*pExtraParams;
2115  }
2116 
2117  Script::RunScript(ScriptChecksum,pTotalParams,pScript->mpObject);
2118  }
2119 
2120  // Delete the temporary structure.
2121  delete pTotalParams;
2122  }
2123  else
2124  {
2125  for (uint32 i=0; i<pArray->GetSize(); ++i)
2126  {
2127  Script::RunScript(ScriptChecksum,pArray->GetStructure(i),pScript->mpObject);
2128  }
2129  }
2130 
2131  return true;
2132 }
2133 
2134 /******************************************************************/
2135 /* */
2136 /* */
2137 /******************************************************************/
2138 
2139 // @script | SizeOf |
2140 // Puts the size (num elements in) of the passed array into a parameter called ArraySize
2141 // @uparm [] | The array of which we're finding the size
2142 bool ScriptSizeOf(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
2143 {
2144  Script::CArray *p_array=NULL;
2145  pParams->GetArray(NONAME,&p_array);
2146 
2147  int size=0;
2148  if (p_array)
2149  {
2150  size=p_array->GetSize();
2151  }
2152  pScript->GetParams()->AddComponent(Script::GenerateCRC("ArraySize"),ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER,size);
2153  return true;
2154 }
2155 
2156 /******************************************************************/
2157 /* */
2158 /* */
2159 /******************************************************************/
2160 
2161 // @script | GetElement | Retrieves the array element pointed to by "Index"
2162 // and places it in the param called "Element"
2163 // @uparm [] | the array
2164 // @parmopt int | Index | 0 | The index value of the array element
2165 bool ScriptGetElement(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
2166 {
2167  Script::CArray *p_array=NULL;
2168  pParams->GetArray(NONAME,&p_array);
2169 
2170  int index=0;
2171  pParams->GetInteger("Index",&index);
2172 
2173  pScript->GetParams()->RemoveComponent(0xbebfa1c6/*Element*/);
2174 
2175  if (p_array)
2176  {
2177  if (index<0 || index>=(int)p_array->GetSize())
2178  {
2179  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
2180  printf("\n%s\nWarning ! Index %d out of range. Array has %d elements\n",pScript->GetScriptInfo(),index,p_array->GetSize());
2181  #endif
2182  return false;
2183  }
2184 
2185  switch (p_array->GetType())
2186  {
2187  case ESYMBOLTYPE_STRUCTURE:
2188  {
2189  Script::CStruct *p_new=new Script::CStruct;
2190  p_new->AppendStructure(p_array->GetStructure(index));
2191  pScript->GetParams()->AddComponent(0xbebfa1c6/*Element*/,ESYMBOLTYPE_STRUCTUREPOINTER,(int)p_new);
2192  break;
2193  }
2194  case ESYMBOLTYPE_ARRAY:
2195  pScript->GetParams()->AddComponent(0xbebfa1c6/*Element*/,p_array->GetArray(index));
2196  break;
2197  case ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER:
2198  pScript->GetParams()->AddComponent(0xbebfa1c6/*Element*/,ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER,p_array->GetInt(index));
2199  break;
2200 
2201  default:
2202  printf("GetElement currently only supports arrays of structures, arrays or integers ... \n(Requested type=%d)\n",p_array->GetType());
2203  break;
2204  }
2205  }
2206  return true;
2207 }
2208 
2209 /******************************************************************/
2210 /* */
2211 /* */
2212 /******************************************************************/
2213 
2214 // @script | GetNextArrayElement | Increments the value in Index and uses it to retrieve that
2215 // element from the array, and puts it in Element
2216 // If no Index parameter exists, it will retrieve the first element of the array, and
2217 // create Index and set it to zero.
2218 // If Index goes off the end of the array, it will remove the Index parameter and
2219 // any existing Element parameter, and return false.
2220 // Hence calling GetNextArrayElement repeatedly will cycle through the array elements.
2221 // @uparm [] | the array
2222 bool ScriptGetNextArrayElement(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
2223 {
2224  Script::CArray *p_array=NULL;
2225  pParams->GetArray(NONAME,&p_array);
2226 
2227  int index=-1;
2228  pScript->GetParams()->GetInteger(CRCD(0x7f8c98fe,"Index"),&index);
2229 
2230  pScript->GetParams()->RemoveComponent(0x7f8c98fe/*Index*/);
2231  pScript->GetParams()->RemoveComponent(0xbebfa1c6/*Element*/);
2232 
2233  if (!p_array)
2234  {
2235  return false;
2236  }
2237 
2238  int size=p_array->GetSize();
2239 
2240  if (index<0)
2241  {
2242  // No index parameter existed, so set index to the first element of the array.
2243  index=0;
2244 
2245  if (size==0)
2246  {
2247  // The array is empty though, so add nothing to the params.
2248  return false;
2249  }
2250  }
2251  else
2252  {
2253  // An index existed already, so increment it.
2254  ++index;
2255  if (index>=size)
2256  {
2257  // Run out of array elements!
2258  return false;
2259  }
2260  }
2261 
2262  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(CRCD(0x7f8c98fe,"Index"),index);
2263 
2264  switch (p_array->GetType())
2265  {
2266  case ESYMBOLTYPE_STRUCTURE:
2267  pScript->GetParams()->AddStructure(0xbebfa1c6/*Element*/,p_array->GetStructure(index));
2268  break;
2269  case ESYMBOLTYPE_ARRAY:
2270  pScript->GetParams()->AddArray(0xbebfa1c6/*Element*/,p_array->GetArray(index));
2271  break;
2272  case ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER:
2273  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(0xbebfa1c6/*Element*/,p_array->GetInteger(index));
2274  break;
2275  case ESYMBOLTYPE_FLOAT:
2276  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat(0xbebfa1c6/*Element*/,p_array->GetFloat(index));
2277  break;
2278  case ESYMBOLTYPE_NAME:
2279  pScript->GetParams()->AddChecksum(0xbebfa1c6/*Element*/,p_array->GetChecksum(index));
2280  break;
2281  case ESYMBOLTYPE_STRING:
2282  pScript->GetParams()->AddString(0xbebfa1c6/*Element*/,p_array->GetString(index));
2283  break;
2284  case ESYMBOLTYPE_LOCALSTRING:
2285  pScript->GetParams()->AddLocalString(0xbebfa1c6/*Element*/,p_array->GetLocalString(index));
2286  break;
2287  default:
2288  printf("GetNextArrayElement does not support arrays of type '%s'\n",GetTypeName(p_array->GetType()));
2289  break;
2290  }
2291 
2292  return true;
2293 }
2294 
2295 /******************************************************************/
2296 /* */
2297 /* */
2298 /******************************************************************/
2299 
2300 // @script | GetRandomArrayElement | Chooses a random element of the passed array, and
2301 // puts it in Element. It will put the index of the chosen element into a parameter called Index.
2302 // If the array is empty, it will remove any existing Element and Index parameter and return false.
2303 // @uparm [] | the array
2304 bool ScriptGetRandomArrayElement(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
2305 {
2306  pScript->GetParams()->RemoveComponent(CRCD(0xbebfa1c6,"Element"));
2307  pScript->GetParams()->RemoveComponent(CRCD(0x7f8c98fe,"index"));
2308 
2309  Script::CArray *p_array=NULL;
2310  pParams->GetArray(NONAME,&p_array);
2311 
2312  if (!p_array)
2313  {
2314  return false;
2315  }
2316 
2317  int size=p_array->GetSize();
2318  if (size==0)
2319  {
2320  return false;
2321  }
2322 
2323  int index=Mth::Rnd(size);
2324  // Wack in the index too cos it is handy to know.
2325  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(CRCD(0x7f8c98fe,"index"),index);
2326 
2327  switch (p_array->GetType())
2328  {
2329  case ESYMBOLTYPE_STRUCTURE:
2330  pScript->GetParams()->AddStructure(CRCD(0xbebfa1c6,"Element"),p_array->GetStructure(index));
2331  break;
2332  case ESYMBOLTYPE_ARRAY:
2333  pScript->GetParams()->AddArray(CRCD(0xbebfa1c6,"Element"),p_array->GetArray(index));
2334  break;
2335  case ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER:
2336  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(CRCD(0xbebfa1c6,"Element"),p_array->GetInteger(index));
2337  break;
2338  case ESYMBOLTYPE_FLOAT:
2339  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat(CRCD(0xbebfa1c6,"Element"),p_array->GetFloat(index));
2340  break;
2341  case ESYMBOLTYPE_NAME:
2342  pScript->GetParams()->AddChecksum(CRCD(0xbebfa1c6,"Element"),p_array->GetChecksum(index));
2343  break;
2344  default:
2345  printf("GetRandomArrayElement does not support arrays of type '%s'\n",GetTypeName(p_array->GetType()));
2346  break;
2347  }
2348 
2349  return true;
2350 }
2351 
2352 /******************************************************************/
2353 /* */
2354 /* */
2355 /******************************************************************/
2356 
2357 // @script | PermuteArray | Creates a new array equal to the passed array with its elements
2358 // randomly permuted. The new array is put into a parameter named using the passed NewArrayName.
2359 // @parm array | Array | The source array
2360 // @parm name | NewArrayName | The name to be given to the new array parameter.
2361 // @flag MakeNewFirstDifferFromOldLast | Makes the first element of the new array definitely
2362 // be different from the old last element. This is so that the old permutation can be
2363 // concatenated with the new and no consecutive elements will be the same.
2364 // Could be useful for playing songs in a random order with no repeats.
2365 // @flag PermuteSource | If this flag is specified then it will be the source array itself
2366 // that will get permuted, no new array will get created.
2367 // So the NewArrayName parameter is not required in this case, it will be ignored.
2368 bool ScriptPermuteArray(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
2369 {
2370  Script::CArray *p_source_array=NULL;
2371  pParams->GetArray("Array",&p_source_array);
2372 
2373  if (!p_source_array)
2374  {
2375  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
2376  printf("\n%s\nPermuteArray requires an Array parameter\n",pScript->GetScriptInfo());
2377  #endif
2378  return false;
2379  }
2380 
2381  CArray *p_array_to_be_permuted=p_source_array;
2382  bool create_new_array=!pParams->ContainsFlag("PermuteSource");
2383 
2384  uint32 new_array_name=0;
2385  CArray *p_new_array=NULL;
2386 
2387  if (create_new_array)
2388  {
2389  pParams->GetChecksum("NewArrayName",&new_array_name);
2390  if (!new_array_name)
2391  {
2392  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
2393  printf("\n%s\nPermuteArray requires a NewArrayName parameter\n",pScript->GetScriptInfo());
2394  #endif
2395  return false;
2396  }
2397 
2398  p_new_array=new CArray;
2399  CopyArray(p_new_array,p_source_array);
2400  p_array_to_be_permuted=p_new_array;
2401  }
2402 
2403 
2404 
2405  int size=p_array_to_be_permuted->GetSize();
2406  if (size)
2407  {
2408  uint32 *p_array_data=p_array_to_be_permuted->GetArrayPointer();
2409  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_array_data,("NULL p_array_data ?"));
2410 
2411  int num_swaps=size*10;
2412 
2413  uint32 old_last=p_array_data[size-1];
2414 
2415  for (int i=0; i<num_swaps; ++i)
2416  {
2417  int a=Mth::Rnd(size);
2418  int b=Mth::Rnd(size);
2419 
2420  uint32 temp=p_array_data[a];
2421  p_array_data[a]=p_array_data[b];
2422  p_array_data[b]=temp;
2423  }
2424 
2425  // Ensure that the new first element is not the same as the old last one,
2426  // so that when using the function to jumble up a list of soundtracks say,
2427  // there will never be two consecutive ones the same.
2428  if (pParams->ContainsFlag("MakeNewFirstDifferFromOldLast") && size>1 && p_array_data[0]==old_last)
2429  {
2430  int a=0;
2431  int b=1+Mth::Rnd(size-1);
2432 
2433  uint32 temp=p_array_data[a];
2434  p_array_data[a]=p_array_data[b];
2435  p_array_data[b]=temp;
2436  }
2437  }
2438 
2439  if (create_new_array)
2440  {
2441  pScript->GetParams()->AddArrayPointer(new_array_name,p_new_array);
2442  }
2443 
2444  return true;
2445 }
2446 
2447 
2448 /******************************************************************/
2449 /* */
2450 /* */
2451 /******************************************************************/
2452 
2453 bool ScriptGetGammaValues( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
2454 {
2455 # if defined( __PLAT_XBOX__ )
2456  Gfx::Manager * gfx_man = Gfx::Manager::Instance();
2457  float gamma_r;
2458  float gamma_g;
2459  float gamma_b;
2460  gfx_man->GetGammaNormalized( &gamma_r, &gamma_g, &gamma_b );
2461 
2462  pScript->GetParams()->RemoveComponent( "red" );
2463  pScript->GetParams()->RemoveComponent( "green" );
2464  pScript->GetParams()->RemoveComponent( "blue" );
2465 
2466  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger( "red", ( (int)( gamma_r * 100.0f ) ));
2467  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger( "green", ( (int)( gamma_g * 100.0f ) ));
2468  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger( "blue", ( (int)( gamma_b * 100.0f ) ));
2469 # endif
2470 
2471  return true;
2472 }
2473 
2474 /******************************************************************/
2475 /* */
2476 /* */
2477 /******************************************************************/
2478 
2479 // @script | ApplyChangeGamma | This gets called whenever one of
2480 // the color values in the gamma menu changes.
2481 // Called from script in gamemenu.q
2482 bool ScriptApplyChangeGamma( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
2483 {
2484 
2485 # if defined( __PLAT_XBOX__ )
2486  // get the current values
2487  Gfx::Manager * gfx_man = Gfx::Manager::Instance();
2488  float gamma_r;
2489  float gamma_g;
2490  float gamma_b;
2491  gfx_man->GetGammaNormalized( &gamma_r, &gamma_g, &gamma_b );
2492 
2493  uint32 color;
2494  pParams->GetChecksum( "color", &color, Script::ASSERT );
2495 
2496  float change;
2497  pParams->GetFloat( "change", &change, Script::ASSERT );
2498  switch ( color )
2499  {
2500  case CRCC( 0x59ea070, "red" ):
2501  if (( change > 0.0f && gamma_r < 1.0f ) || ( change < 0.0f && gamma_r > 0.0f ))
2502  gamma_r += change;
2503  break;
2504  case CRCC( 0x2f6511de, "green" ):
2505  if (( change > 0.0f && gamma_g < 1.0f ) || ( change < 0.0f && gamma_g > 0.0f ))
2506  gamma_g += change;
2507  break;
2508  case CRCC( 0x61c9354b, "blue" ):
2509  if (( change > 0.0f && gamma_b < 1.0f ) || ( change < 0.0f && gamma_b > 0.0f ))
2510  gamma_b += change;
2511  break;
2512  default:
2513  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0, ("ApplyChangeGamma called on unknown color") );
2514  }
2515 
2516  gfx_man->SetGammaNormalized( gamma_r, gamma_g, gamma_b );
2517 
2518 /* // grab any new values from the params
2519  int r, g, b;
2520  if ( pParams->GetInteger( "red", &r, Script::NO_ASSERT ) )
2521  gamma_r = (float)(r) / 100.0f;
2522  if ( pParams->GetInteger( "green", &g, Script::NO_ASSERT ) )
2523  gamma_g = (float)(g) / 100.0f;
2524  if ( pParams->GetInteger( "blue", &b, Script::NO_ASSERT ) )
2525  gamma_b = (float)(b) / 100.0f;
2526 */
2527 
2528 # endif
2529  return true;
2530 }
2531 
2532 /******************************************************************/
2533 /* */
2534 /* */
2535 /******************************************************************/
2536 
2537 // @script | GotParam | Checks if the script was passed the specified parameter
2538 // @uparm name | The name of the param to check for
2539 bool ScriptGotParam(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
2540 {
2541 
2542  uint32 FlagChecksum=0;
2543  pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME,&FlagChecksum);
2544  Dbg_MsgAssert(FlagChecksum,("GotParam command requires a flag name"));
2545 
2546  // Get the script's parameters, and see if they contain the aforementioned flag therein.
2547  Script::CStruct *pScriptParams=pScript->GetParams();
2548  Dbg_MsgAssert(pScriptParams,("NULL pScriptParams"));
2549  return pScriptParams->ContainsComponentNamed(FlagChecksum);
2550 }
2551 
2552 Tmr::Time gButtonDebounceTime[PAD_NUMBUTTONS]; // PAD_NUMBUTTONS defined in skater.h for some reason (instead of some controller header)
2553 
2554 /******************************************************************/
2555 /* */
2556 /* */
2557 /******************************************************************/
2558 
2559 // @script | ControllerDeboune |
2560 // For example: <nl>
2561 // Debounce X time = 2.0 <nl>
2562 // This will ignore the X button until either the time has elapsed,
2563 // or the X button has been released and subsequently re-pressed. <nl>
2564 // This prevents the press of X from carrying over from one screen to
2565 // the next, and removes the need to have a delay, whilst still allowing
2566 // the user to actively X past things.
2567 // @uparm name | the button
2568 // @parmopt float | time | 1.0 |
2569 bool ScriptControllerDebounce( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
2570 {
2571 
2572  uint32 Checksum = 0;
2573  float time=1.0f;
2574  pParams->GetFloat(0x906b67ba,&time); // "time"
2575  if ( pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &Checksum ) )
2576  {
2577  int Button = Inp::GetButtonIndex(Checksum);
2578  gButtonDebounceTime[Button] = (Tmr::Time)(Tmr::GetTime() + (time * 1000));
2579  }
2580  return ( true );
2581 }
2582 
2583 /******************************************************************/
2584 /* */
2585 /* */
2586 /******************************************************************/
2587 
2588 void ResetDebounce( void )
2589 {
2590 
2591  int i;
2592  for ( i = 0; i < PAD_NUMBUTTONS; i++ )
2593  {
2594  gButtonDebounceTime[ i ] = 0;
2595  }
2596 }
2597 
2598 /******************************************************************/
2599 /* */
2600 /* */
2601 /******************************************************************/
2602 
2603 bool CheckButton(Inp::Handler< Mdl::FrontEnd >* pHandler, uint32 button)
2604 {
2605 
2606 
2607  if (!pHandler)
2608  {
2609  return false;
2610  }
2611 
2612  if (!pHandler->m_Input)
2613  {
2614  return false;
2615  }
2616 
2617  int whichButton = Inp::GetButtonIndex( button );
2618  if ( gButtonDebounceTime[ whichButton ] > Tmr::GetTime( ) )
2619  {
2620  return ( false );
2621  }
2622  switch ( button )
2623  {
2624  case ( 0xbc6b118f ): // Up
2625  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_UP] )
2626  {
2627  return ( true );
2628  }
2629  break;
2630  case ( 0xe3006fc4 ): // Down
2631  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_DOWN] )
2632  {
2633  return ( true );
2634  }
2635  break;
2636  case ( 0x85981897 ): // Left
2637  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_LEFT] )
2638  {
2639  return ( true );
2640  }
2641  break;
2642  case ( 0x4b358aeb ): // Right
2643  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_RIGHT] )
2644  {
2645  return ( true );
2646  }
2647  break;
2648  case ( 0xb7231a95 ): // UpLeft
2649  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_UP] )
2650  {
2651  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_LEFT] )
2652  {
2653  return ( true );
2654  }
2655  }
2656  break;
2657  case ( 0xa50950c5 ): // UpRight
2658  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_UP] )
2659  {
2660  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_RIGHT] )
2661  {
2662  return ( true );
2663  }
2664  }
2665  break;
2666  case ( 0xd8847efa ): // DownLeft
2667  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_DOWN] )
2668  {
2669  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_LEFT] )
2670  {
2671  return ( true );
2672  }
2673  }
2674  break;
2675  case ( 0x786b8b68 ): // DownRight
2676  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_DOWN] )
2677  {
2678  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_RIGHT] )
2679  {
2680  return ( true );
2681  }
2682  }
2683  break;
2684  case ( 0x2b489a86 ): // Circle
2685  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_CIRCLE] )
2686  {
2687  return ( true );
2688  }
2689  break;
2690  case ( 0x321c9756 ): // Square
2691  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_SQUARE] )
2692  {
2693  return ( true );
2694  }
2695  break;
2696  case ( 0x7323e97c ): // X
2697  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_X] )
2698  {
2699  return ( true );
2700  }
2701  break;
2702  case ( 0x20689278 ): // Triangle
2703  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_TRIANGLE] )
2704  {
2705  return ( true );
2706  }
2707  break;
2708  case ( 0x26b0c991 ): // L1
2709  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_L1] )
2710  {
2711  return ( true );
2712  }
2713  break;
2714  case ( 0xbfb9982b ): // L2
2715  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_L2] )
2716  {
2717  return ( true );
2718  }
2719  break;
2720  case ( 0xf2f1f64e ): // R1
2721  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_R1] )
2722  {
2723  return ( true );
2724  }
2725  break;
2726  case ( 0x6bf8a7f4 ): // R2
2727  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_R2] )
2728  {
2729  return ( true );
2730  }
2731  break;
2732  case ( 0x767a45d7 ): // black
2733  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_BLACK] )
2734  {
2735  return ( true );
2736  }
2737  break;
2738  case ( 0xbd30325b ): // white
2739  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_WHITE] )
2740  {
2741  return ( true );
2742  }
2743  break;
2744  case ( 0x9d2d8850 ): // Z
2745  if ( pHandler->m_Input->m_Event[Inp::Data::vA_Z] )
2746  {
2747  return ( true );
2748  }
2749  break;
2750 
2751  default:
2752  break;
2753  }
2754  return false;
2755 }
2756 
2757 /******************************************************************/
2758 /* */
2759 /* */
2760 /******************************************************************/
2761 
2762 // @script | ControllerPressed | returns true if the specified button is pressed
2763 // @uparm name | the button to check
2764 // @uparmopt 0 | controller index
2765 bool ScriptControllerPressed(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
2766 {
2767  Mdl::FrontEnd* pFront = Mdl::FrontEnd::Instance();
2768 
2769  int controller;
2770  uint32 button = 0;
2771  if ( pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &button ) )
2772  {
2773  if ( pParams->GetInteger( NONAME, &controller, Script::NO_ASSERT ) )
2774  {
2775  Dbg_MsgAssert( controller < SIO::vMAX_DEVICES && controller >= 0, ( "ControllerPressed called with bad controller index" ) );
2776  if ( CheckButton( pFront->GetInputHandler( controller ), button ) )
2777  return true;
2778  else
2779  return false;
2780  }
2781  else
2782  {
2783  for ( int i = 0; i < SIO::vMAX_DEVICES; i++ )
2784  {
2785  if ( CheckButton( pFront->GetInputHandler( i ), button ) )
2786  return true;
2787  }
2788  return false;
2789  }
2790  }
2791  return false;
2792 }
2793 
2794 // @script | GetAnalogueInfo | Reads the analogue sticks, ans returns the floats LeftX, LeftY, RightX and RightY.
2795 // These each range from -1 to 1.
2796 // @parmopt int | Controller | 0 | Controller index
2797 bool ScriptGetAnalogueInfo(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
2798 {
2799  Mdl::FrontEnd* pFront = Mdl::FrontEnd::Instance();
2800 
2801  int controller=0;
2802  pParams->GetInteger( CRCD(0xb30d9965,"Controller"), &controller, Script::NO_ASSERT );
2803 
2804  Dbg_MsgAssert( controller < SIO::vMAX_DEVICES && controller >= 0, ( "ControllerPressed called with bad controller index" ) );
2805  Inp::Handler< Mdl::FrontEnd > *p_handler=pFront->GetInputHandler( controller );
2806  CControlPad pad;
2807  pad.Update(p_handler->m_Input);
2808 
2809  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat(CRCD(0x303067f1,"LeftX"),pad.m_scaled_leftX);
2810  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat(CRCD(0x47375767,"LeftY"),pad.m_scaled_leftY);
2811  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat(CRCD(0x694df774,"RightX"),pad.m_scaled_rightX);
2812  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat(CRCD(0x1e4ac7e2,"RightY"),pad.m_scaled_rightY);
2813  return true;
2814 }
2815 
2816 /******************************************************************/
2817 /* */
2818 /* */
2819 /******************************************************************/
2820 
2821 // @script | SetSfxVolume | SetSfxVolume [100] <nl>
2822 // Param: volumeLevel <nl>
2823 // range: 0 to 100 (the main mixing volume, affecting all soundfx) <nl>
2824 // default: 100 <nl> <nl>
2825 // Notes: the volume is set to 100 on startup, and can only be modified with this command
2826 // @uparmopt 100.0 | volume
2827 bool ScriptSetVolume( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
2828 {
2829 
2830  float Volume = 100.0f;
2831 
2832  pParams->GetFloat( NONAME, &Volume );
2833 
2834  Sfx::CSfxManager * sfx_manager = Sfx::CSfxManager::Instance();
2835  sfx_manager->SetMainVolume( Volume );
2836 
2837  return true;
2838 }
2839

2922 /******************************************************************/
2923 /* */
2924 /* */
2925 /******************************************************************/
2926 
2927 // @script | LoadMusicHeader | parameter is name of header/wad file (minus extension)
2928 // Do this once on startup.
2929 // Example: LoadMusicHeader "music\music"
2930 // @uparm "string" | name of header/wad file
2931 bool ScriptLoadMusicHeader( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
2932 {
2933 
2934  const char *pName = NULL;
2935  pParams->GetText( NONAME, &pName );
2936  if ( pName )
2937  {
2938  // Mick: Moved to BottomUpHeap, as it is a lot bigger now, and only loaded at startup
2939  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PushContext(Mem::Manager::sHandle().BottomUpHeap());
2940  bool done = ( Pcm::LoadMusicHeader( pName ) );
2941  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PopContext();
2942  return done;
2943 
2944  }
2945  return ( false );
2946 }
2947 
2948 /******************************************************************/
2949 /* */
2950 /* */
2951 /******************************************************************/
2952 
2953 // @script | LoadStreamHeader |
2954 // @uparm "string" | name of header/wad file (minus extension)
2955 bool ScriptLoadStreamHeader( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
2956 {
2957 
2958  const char *pName = NULL;
2959  pParams->GetText( NONAME, &pName );
2960  if ( pName )
2961  {
2962  // Mick: Moved to BottomUpHeap, as it is a lot bigger now, and only loaded at startup
2963  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PushContext(Mem::Manager::sHandle().BottomUpHeap());
2964  bool done = ( Pcm::LoadStreamHeader( pName ) );
2965  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PopContext();
2966  return done;
2967  }
2968  return ( false );
2969 }

2971 /******************************************************************/
2972 /* */
2973 /* */
2974 /******************************************************************/
2975 
2976 // @script | StreamIsAvailable | only available in the skateshop
2977 // @parm int | | which stream
2978 bool ScriptStreamIsAvailable( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
2979 {
2980 
2981  Mdl::Skate * skate_mod = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
2982  if ( !skate_mod->GetGameMode()->IsFrontEnd() )
2983  {
2984  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0, ( "StreamIsAvailable script function is only valid in the skateshop." ) );
2985  }
2986  int whichStream;
2987  if ( pParams->GetInteger( NONAME, &whichStream ) )
2988  {
2989  if ( whichStream >= Pcm::GetNumStreamsAvailable( ) )
2990  {
2991  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0, ( "\n%s\nAsking for StreamIsAvailable on stream %d, past valid range ( 0 to %d ).", pScript->GetScriptInfo( ), whichStream, Pcm::GetNumStreamsAvailable( ) - 1 ) );
2992  return ( false );
2993  }
2994  return ( Pcm::StreamAvailable( whichStream ) );
2995  }
2996  else
2997  {
2998  return ( Pcm::StreamAvailable( ) );
2999  }
3000 }
3001 
3002 #define CHECKSUM_FLAG_PERM 0x389129e4 // "FLAG_PERM"
3003 
3004 /******************************************************************/
3005 /* */
3006 /* */
3007 /******************************************************************/
3008 
3009 // @script | AddMusicTrack | adds track to list - plays randomly during game <nl>
3010 // Note: The songs that go into the data/music folder (and are added to the
3011 // CD in them 'music' directory) as well as the ambient tracks in data/ambient
3012 // (and in 'ambient' directory on CD) should have a filename of 8 characters
3013 // or less, as otherwise the names get converted upon building a CD
3014 // @uparmopt "string" | filename in quotes ( .wav file in data/music )
3015 // @uparmopt name | filename
3016 // @flag flag_perm | to add the song to the permanent soundtrack list on startup...
3017 // otherwise track is a level-specific ambient type. <nl>
3018 bool ScriptAddMusicTrack( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3019 {
3020 
3021  const char *pTrackName = NULL;
3022  const char *pTrackTitle = NULL;
3023  // default to ambient tracks...
3024  pParams->GetText( NONAME, &pTrackName );
3025  pParams->GetText( "TrackTitle", &pTrackTitle );
3026  int whichList = Pcm::TRACKLIST_LEVEL_SPECIFIC;
3027  if ( pParams->ContainsFlag( CHECKSUM_FLAG_PERM ) )
3028  {
3029  whichList = Pcm::TRACKLIST_PERM;
3030  }
3031 
3032  if ( pTrackName )
3033  {
3034  Pcm::AddTrackToPlaylist( pTrackName, whichList, pTrackTitle );
3035  }
3036  return ( true );
3037 }
3038 
3039 
3040 // @script | ChangeTrackState | Disables or enables one of the permanent music tracks.
3041 // @uparmopt 0 | The index of the track
3042 // @flag Off | Disable the specified track. If omitted, it will enable the track.
3043 bool ScriptChangeTrackState(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
3044 {
3045  int track_num=0;
3046  pParams->GetInteger(NONAME,&track_num);
3047 
3048  Pcm::SetTrackForbiddenStatus(track_num,pParams->ContainsFlag("Off"),Pcm::TRACKLIST_PERM);
3049  return true;
3050 }
3051 
3052 // @script | TrackEnabled | Returns true if the specified track in the permanent track list is enabled.
3053 // @uparmopt 0 | The index of the track
3054 bool ScriptTrackEnabled(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
3055 {
3056  int track_num=0;
3057  pParams->GetInteger(NONAME,&track_num);
3058 
3059  if (Pcm::GetNumTracks(Pcm::TRACKLIST_PERM) == 0)
3060  {
3061  return false;
3062  }
3063 
3064  Dbg_MsgAssert( track_num>=0 && track_num < Pcm::GetNumTracks(Pcm::TRACKLIST_PERM),( "\n%s\nBad track number of %d sent to TrackEnabled, num tracks = %d", pScript->GetScriptInfo(), track_num, Pcm::GetNumTracks(Pcm::TRACKLIST_PERM) ));
3065 
3066  uint64 list1,list2;
3067  Pcm::GetPlaylist(&list1, &list2);
3068 
3069  if (track_num<64)
3070  {
3071  if (list1 & (((uint64)1) << track_num))
3072  {
3073  return false;
3074  }
3075  }
3076  else
3077  {
3078  if (list2 & (((uint64)1) << (track_num-64)))
3079  {
3080  return false;
3081  }
3082  }
3083 
3084  return true;
3085 }
3086 
3087 bool ScriptMusicIsPaused(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
3088 {
3089  return Pcm::MusicIsPaused();
3090 }
3091

3093 /* */
3094 /* */
3095 /******************************************************************/
3096 
3097 // @script | ClearMusicTrackList |
3098 // @flag FLAG_PERM | optionally add FLAG_PERM to clear
3099 // the permanent list, otherwise clear level specific list
3100 bool ScriptClearMusicTrackList( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3101 {
3102 
3103  int whichList = Pcm::TRACKLIST_LEVEL_SPECIFIC;
3104  if ( pParams->ContainsFlag( CHECKSUM_FLAG_PERM ) )
3105  {
3106  whichList = Pcm::TRACKLIST_PERM;
3107  }
3108  Pcm::ClearPlaylist( whichList );
3109  return ( true );
3110 }

3195 // @script | PlayMovie | Play a movie from data\movies on PC, or \movies on CD
3196 // @uparm "string" | movie name
3197 bool ScriptPlayMovie( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3198 {

3201

3204  {

3210 }
3211 
3212 /******************************************************************/
3213 /* */
3214 /* */
3215 /******************************************************************/
3216 
3217 // @script | UnloadAnim |
3218 // @parm name | descChecksum | asset name
3219 // @parmopt name | refChecksum | 0 | skeleton name
3220 bool ScriptUnloadAnim( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3221 {
3222  // get the assman
3223  Ass::CAssMan * ass_man = Ass::CAssMan::Instance();
3224 
3225  const char* pAnimName = NULL;
3226  pParams->GetText( "name", &pAnimName, Script::ASSERT );
3227 
3228  Ass::CAsset* pAsset = ass_man->GetAssetNode( Script::GenerateCRC(pAnimName), false );
3229 
3230  if ( pAsset )
3231  {
3232  ass_man->DestroyReferences( pAsset );
3233  ass_man->UnloadAsset( pAsset );
3234 
3235 // Dbg_Message( "Unloaded asset %s",
3236 // pAnimName );
3237  }
3238  else
3239  {
3240 // Dbg_Message( "Couldn't find asset %s to unload",
3241 // pAnimName );
3242  }
3243 
3244 
3245 #if 0
3246  // can't do it this way, because it
3247  // deletes the reference,
3248  // not the actual asset itself...
3249 
3250  uint32 animName = 0;
3251  uint32 refChecksum = 0;
3252 
3253  pParams->GetChecksum( "descChecksum", &animName, Script::ASSERT );
3254 
3255  //printf("Called UnloadAnim on %s\n",Script::FindChecksumName(animName));
3256 
3257  if ( !pParams->GetChecksum( "refChecksum", &refChecksum, Script::NO_ASSERT ) )
3258  {
3259  refChecksum = ass_man->GetReferenceChecksum();
3260  }
3261 
3262  // make sure the reference checksum is not 0,
3263  // if a reference checksum was not specified
3264  Dbg_MsgAssert( refChecksum != 0, ( "No ref checksum" ) );
3265 
3266  // kills the original asset
3267  Ass::CAsset* pAsset = ass_man->GetAssetNode( refChecksum + animName, false );
3268  if ( pAsset )
3269  {
3270  ass_man->DestroyReferences( pAsset );
3271  ass_man->UnloadAsset( pAsset );
3272 #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
3273  Dbg_Message( "Unloaded asset %s %s",
3274  Script::FindChecksumName( refChecksum ),
3275  Script::FindChecksumName( animName ) );
3276 #endif
3277  }
3278  else
3279  {
3280 #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
3281  Dbg_Message( "Couldn't find asset %s %s to unload",
3282  Script::FindChecksumName( refChecksum ),
3283  Script::FindChecksumName( animName ) );
3284 #endif
3285  }
3286 #endif
3287 
3288  return true;
3289 }
3290 
3291 /******************************************************************/
3292 /* */
3293 /* */
3294 /******************************************************************/
3295 
3296 // @script | LoadAsset |
3297 // @parm string | name | asset name
3298 bool ScriptLoadAsset( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3299 {
3300  Ass::CAssMan * ass_man = Ass::CAssMan::Instance();
3301 
3302  const char* p_asset_filename;
3303  if ( pParams->GetText( (const char*)"name", &p_asset_filename, false )
3304  || pParams->GetText( NONAME, &p_asset_filename, true ) )
3305  {
3306  // either (name="XXX") or ("XXX") is required
3307  }
3308 
3309 #ifdef __USER_GARY__
3310 // Dbg_Message( "*** Loading asset %s, perm=%d\n", p_asset_filename, ass_man->GetDefaultPermanent() );
3311 #endif
3312 
3313 // if( !ass_man->LoadOrGetAsset( p_asset_filename, false, ass_man->GetDefaultPermanent() ) )
3314  if( !ass_man->LoadOrGetAsset( p_asset_filename, false, false, ass_man->GetDefaultPermanent(), 0, NULL, pParams ) )
3315  {
3316  if ( Script::GetInteger( CRCD(0x25dc7904,"AssertOnMissingAssets") ) )
3317  {
3318  Dbg_MsgAssert( false,( "Could not load asset %s", p_asset_filename ));
3319  }
3320  else
3321  {
3322  return true;
3323  }
3324  }
3325 
3326  uint32 descChecksum = 0;
3327  if ( pParams->GetChecksum( (const char*)"desc", &descChecksum, false )
3328  || pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &descChecksum, false ) )
3329  {
3330  // either (desc=nnn) or (nnn) is required
3331  ass_man->AddRef(p_asset_filename, descChecksum, 0);
3332  }
3333 
3334  return true;
3335 }
3336 
3337 /******************************************************************/
3338 /* */
3339 /* */
3340 /******************************************************************/
3341 
3342 // @script | LoadAnim | loads the specified animation
3343 // @parm string | name | the file name of the animation
3344 // @parm string | desc | description
3345 // @flag async | load animation asynchronously
3346 // returns true if a reference is generated. false if a reference already exists
3347 bool ScriptLoadAnim( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3348 {
3349  Ass::CAssMan * ass_man = Ass::CAssMan::Instance();
3350 
3351  // an anim is just like an asset, except it has a reference added to it
3352 
3353  const char* p_asset_filename;
3354  uint32 descChecksum = 0;
3355  pParams->GetText( CRCD(0xa1dc81f9,"name"), &p_asset_filename );
3356 
3357  pParams->GetChecksum( CRCD(0x4d20d794,"descChecksum"), &descChecksum, true );
3358 
3359  bool async = false;
3360  if( pParams->ContainsFlag( CRCD(0x90e07c79,"async") ))
3361  {
3362  async = true;
3363  }
3364 
3365  bool use_pip = false;
3366  if( pParams->ContainsFlag( CRCD(0x23028e29,"use_pip") ))
3367  {
3368  use_pip = true;
3369  }
3370 
3371  return ass_man->LoadAnim( p_asset_filename, descChecksum, ass_man->GetReferenceChecksum(), async, use_pip );
3372 }
3373 
3374 /******************************************************************/
3375 /* */
3376 /* */
3377 /******************************************************************/
3378 
3379 // @script | LoadSkeleton | loads the specified skeleton
3380 // @parm string | name | the file name of the skeleton
3381 // @parm string | desc | description
3382 bool ScriptLoadSkeleton( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3383 {
3384  Ass::CAssMan* ass_man = Ass::CAssMan::Instance();
3385 
3386  const char* nameBuf;
3387  pParams->GetText( (const char*)"name", &nameBuf, Script::ASSERT );
3388 
3389  uint32 skeletonName;
3390  pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &skeletonName, Script::ASSERT );
3391 
3392 // Gfx::CSkeletonData* pSkeletonData = (Gfx::CSkeletonData*)ass_man->LoadOrGetAsset(nameBuf, false, ass_man->GetDefaultPermanent());
3393  Gfx::CSkeletonData* pSkeletonData = (Gfx::CSkeletonData*)ass_man->LoadOrGetAsset(nameBuf, false, false, ass_man->GetDefaultPermanent(), 0);
3394  if ( !pSkeletonData )
3395  {
3396  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("Failed to load skeleton %s",nameBuf));
3397  }
3398 
3399  // Now add the reference to it, if one was requested
3400  // this gets combined with the "reference checksum"
3401  if (!ass_man->AssetLoaded(skeletonName))
3402  {
3403  ass_man->AddRef(nameBuf, skeletonName, 0);
3404  }
3405 
3406  return true;
3407 }
3408 
3409 /******************************************************************/
3410 /* */
3411 /* */
3412 /******************************************************************/
3413 
3414 bool ScriptAssManSetReferenceChecksum( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3415 {
3416  Ass::CAssMan * ass_man = Ass::CAssMan::Instance();
3417 
3418  uint32 checksum;
3419  if ( !pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &checksum ) )
3420  {
3421  pParams->GetInteger( NONAME, (int*)&checksum, true );
3422  }
3423 
3424  ass_man->SetReferenceChecksum( checksum );
3425 
3426  return true;
3427 }
3428 
3429 /******************************************************************/
3430 /* */
3431 /* */
3432 /******************************************************************/
3433 
3434 bool ScriptAssManSetDefaultPermanent( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3435 {
3436  Ass::CAssMan * ass_man = Ass::CAssMan::Instance();
3437 
3438  int permanent;
3439  pParams->GetInteger( NONAME, &permanent, true );
3440 
3441  ass_man->SetDefaultPermanent( permanent );
3442 
3443  return true;
3444 }
3445 
3446 /******************************************************************/
3447 /* */
3448 /* */
3449 /******************************************************************/
3450 
3451 #define CHECKSUM_PITCH 0xd8604126 // "pitch"
3452 #define CHECKSUM_DROPOFF 0xff2020ec // "dropoff"
3453 #define CHECKSUM_VOLUME 0xf6a36814 // "vol"
3454 
3455 /******************************************************************/
3456 /* */
3457 /* */
3458 /******************************************************************/
3459 
3460 // @script | LoadSound |
3461 // @uparm "string" | The name of the sound file
3462 // @parmopt float | pitch | 100.0 |
3463 // @parmopt float | volume | 100.0 |
3464 // @parmopt float | dropoff | 0.0 |
3465 // @flag PosUpdateWithDoppler | positional update with doppler
3466 // @flag NoReverb | reverb effect disabled for this sound
3467 bool ScriptLoadSound( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3468 {
3469  const char *pSfxName;
3470  if ( pParams->GetText( NONAME, &pSfxName, true ) )
3471  {
3472  float volume = 100.0f;
3473  float pitch = 100.0f;
3474  float dropoff = 0.0f;
3475  int flags = 0;
3476  pParams->GetFloat( CHECKSUM_PITCH, &pitch );
3477  if ( pParams->GetFloat( CHECKSUM_DROPOFF, &dropoff ) )
3478  {
3479  dropoff = FEET_TO_INCHES( dropoff );
3480  }
3481  pParams->GetFloat( CHECKSUM_VOLUME, &volume );
3482 
3483  if ( pParams->ContainsFlag( CHECKSUM_FLAG_PERM ) )
3484  {
3485  flags |= SFX_FLAG_LOAD_PERM;
3486  }
3487  if ( pParams->ContainsFlag( 0xcf15c120 ) ) //"PosUpdateWithDoppler"
3488  {
3489  flags |= SFX_FLAG_POSITIONAL_UPDATE_WITH_DOPPLER;
3490  }
3491  else if ( pParams->ContainsFlag( CRCD(0x8b87176f,"NoReverb") ) )
3492  {
3493  flags |= SFX_FLAG_NO_REVERB;
3494  }
3495  //else if ( pParams->ContainsFlag( 0x14f9c4fe ) ) // "PosUpdate"
3496  //{
3497  // flags |= SFX_FLAG_POSITIONAL_UPDATE;
3498  //}
3499 
3500  Sfx::CSfxManager * sfx_manager = Sfx::CSfxManager::Instance();
3501  if ( !sfx_manager->LoadSound( pSfxName, flags, dropoff, pitch, volume ) )
3502  {
3503 // printf( "sound %s couldn't load\n", pSfxName );
3504  }
3505  }
3506  return ( true );
3507 }
3508 
3509 /******************************************************************/
3510 /* */
3511 /* */
3512 /******************************************************************/
3513 
3514 // @script | PlayStream |
3515 // @uparm name | stream name
3516 // @parmopt float | volume | 100.0 | volume of both left and right channel in percent (overrides volL and volR)
3517 // @parmopt float | volL | 100.0 | volume of left channel
3518 // @parmopt float | volR | 100.0 | volume of right channel
3519 // @parmopt float | pitch | 100.0 | pitch value
3520 // @parmopt int | priority | 50 | priority; higher priority streams can stop lower priority streams.
3521 // @parmopt name | id | 0 | control ID (used instead of stream name for script control purposes)
3522 // @parmopt int | lipsync | 0 | set to 1 to load lipsync data
3523 bool ScriptPlayStream( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3524 {
3525 
3526  uint32 streamNameChecksum = 0;
3527  if ( pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &streamNameChecksum ) )
3528  {
3529  float volume = 100.0f;
3530  float volL = 100.0f;
3531  float volR = 100.0f;
3532  float pitch = 100.0f;
3533  int priority = STREAM_DEFAULT_PRIORITY;
3534  uint32 id = 0;
3535  int lipsync = 0;
3536  pParams->GetFloat( "volL", &volL );
3537  pParams->GetFloat( "volR", &volR );
3538  if (pParams->GetFloat( CHECKSUM_VOLUME, &volume ))
3539  {
3540  volL = volume;
3541  volR = volume;
3542  }
3543  pParams->GetFloat( CHECKSUM_PITCH, &pitch );
3544  pParams->GetInteger( 0x9d5923d8, &priority ); // priority
3545  pParams->GetChecksum( 0x40c698af, &id ); // id
3546  pParams->GetInteger( CRCD(0xf5c3922b,"lipsync") , &lipsync );
3547 
3548  if (lipsync == 1)
3549  {
3550  bool loaded = Pcm::CStreamFrameAmpManager::sLoadFrameAmp(streamNameChecksum);
3551  if (!loaded)
3552  {
3553  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0,( "Couldn't load lipsync data for stream %s", Script::FindChecksumName(streamNameChecksum)));
3554  return false;
3555  }
3556  }
3557 
3558  Sfx::sVolume vol( Sfx::VOLUME_TYPE_BASIC_2_CHANNEL );
3559  vol.SetChannelVolume( 0, volL );
3560  vol.SetChannelVolume( 1, volR );
3561  Pcm::PlayStream( streamNameChecksum, &vol, pitch, priority, id );
3562 
3563  return ( true );
3564  }
3565  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0,( "\n%s\nMust specify stream name.", pScript->GetScriptInfo( ) ));
3566  return ( false );
3567 }
3568 
3569 /******************************************************************/
3570 /* */
3571 /* */
3572 /******************************************************************/
3573 
3574 // @script | StopStream | stops current stream from playing
3575 // @uparm name | stream name (or control ID, if one was supplied with PlayStream)
3576 bool ScriptStopStream( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3577 {
3578 
3579  uint32 id;
3580  if (pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &id ))
3581  {
3582  Pcm::StopStreamFromID( id );
3583  }
3584  else
3585  {
3586  Pcm::StopStreams( -1 ); // Stop all streams
3587  }
3588 
3589  return ( true );
3590 }
3591 
3592 /******************************************************************/
3593 /* */
3594 /* */
3595 /******************************************************************/
3596 
3597 // @script | IsStreamPlaying | Returns true if the named stream is currently playing
3598 // @uparm name | stream name (or control ID, if one was supplied with PlayStream)
3599 bool ScriptIsStreamPlaying( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3600 {
3601  uint32 id = 0;
3602 
3603  if (pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &id ))
3604  {
3605  return Pcm::StreamPlaying(id);
3606  }
3607  else
3608  {
3609  Dbg_MsgAssert(0, ("No stream specified"));
3610  }
3611 
3612  return false;
3613 }
3614 
3615 /******************************************************************/
3616 /* */
3617 /* */
3618 /******************************************************************/
3619 
3620 // @script | SetStreamParams | Set the volume or pitch of a playing stream
3621 // @uparm name | stream name (or control ID, if one was supplied with PlayStream)
3622 // @parmopt float | vol | 100.0 | volume of both left and right channel (overrides volL and volR)
3623 // @parmopt float | volL | 100.0 | volume of left channel
3624 // @parmopt float | volR | 100.0 | volume of right channel
3625 // @parmopt float | pitch | 100.0 | pitch
3626 bool ScriptSetStreamParams( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3627 {
3628  uint32 id = 0;
3629 
3630  if (pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &id ))
3631  {
3632  float Volume;
3633  float VolL;
3634  float VolR;
3635  float Pitch;
3636 
3637  bool adjust_vol;
3638 
3639  adjust_vol = pParams->GetFloat( CRCD(0x5e285a66,"VolL"), &VolL );
3640  adjust_vol = pParams->GetFloat( CRCD(0xa4276705,"VolR"), &VolR ) || adjust_vol;
3641  if (pParams->GetFloat( CRCD(0xf6a36814,"Vol"), &Volume ))
3642  {
3643  VolL = Volume;
3644  VolR = Volume;
3645  adjust_vol = true;
3646  }
3647 
3648  bool result = true;
3649 
3650  if (adjust_vol)
3651  {
3652  Sfx::sVolume vol;
3653  vol.SetSilent();
3654  vol.SetChannelVolume( 0, VolL );
3655  vol.SetChannelVolume( 1, VolR );
3656 
3657  result = Pcm::SetStreamVolumeFromID(id, &vol);
3658  }
3659 
3660  if (pParams->GetFloat( CRCD(0xd8604126,"Pitch"), &Pitch ))
3661  {
3662  result = Pcm::SetStreamPitchFromID(id, Pitch) && result;
3663  }
3664 
3665  if (!result)
3666  {
3667  Dbg_MsgAssert(0, ("Can't find stream %s", Script::FindChecksumName(id)));
3668  }
3669 
3670  return result;
3671  }
3672  else
3673  {
3674  Dbg_MsgAssert(0, ("No stream specified"));
3675  }
3676 
3677  return false;
3678 }
3679 
3680 /******************************************************************/
3681 /* */
3682 /* */
3683 /******************************************************************/
3684 
3685 // @script | PlayTrack |
3686 // @uparm "string" | filename in quotes (no extension, file should be a
3687 // .wav file in data/music)
3688 // @uparmopt 0 | The index of the track. For use if the name is not known.
3689 // @parmopt int | loop | 0 | continuously play the track if set to non-zero
3690 bool ScriptPlayTrack( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3691 {
3692 
3693  const char *songName = NULL;
3694  char p_calculated_track_name[MAX_TRACKNAME_STRING_LENGTH];
3695  int track_num=999;
3696  int loop = 0;
3697 
3698  if (!pParams->GetText( NONAME, &songName ))
3699  {
3700  pParams->GetInteger(NONAME,&track_num);
3701  songName=Pcm::GetTrackName(track_num,Pcm::TRACKLIST_PERM);
3702 
3703  Dbg_MsgAssert(strlen("MUSIC\\VAG\\SONGS\\")+strlen(songName)<MAX_TRACKNAME_STRING_LENGTH,("Track name '%s' too long",songName));
3704  sprintf(p_calculated_track_name,"MUSIC\\VAG\\SONGS\\%s",songName);
3705  songName=p_calculated_track_name;
3706  }
3707 
3708  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0x5ea0e211,"loop"), &loop);
3709 
3710  if ( songName )
3711  {
3712  printf("PlayTrack songName ===================== %s\n", songName);
3713  Pcm::StopMusic( );
3714  Pcm::PlayTrack( songName, loop );
3715  Pcm::SetCurrentTrack( track_num );
3716  }
3717  return ( true );
3718 }
3719 
3720 /******************************************************************/
3721 /* */
3722 /* */
3723 /******************************************************************/
3724 
3725 // @script | PlayMusicStream | Plays a stereo stream through the music channel
3726 // @uparm name | music stream name (in music.wad file)
3727 // @parmopt float | volume | -1.0 | volume in percent; negative value uses music volume
3728 bool ScriptPlayMusicStream( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3729 {
3730 
3731  uint32 streamNameChecksum = 0;
3732  if ( pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &streamNameChecksum ) )
3733  {
3734  float volume = -1.0f;
3735  pParams->GetFloat( CHECKSUM_VOLUME, &volume );
3736  Pcm::PlayMusicStream( streamNameChecksum, volume );
3737  return ( true );
3738  }
3739  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0,( "\n%s\nMust specify stream name.", pScript->GetScriptInfo( ) ));
3740  return ( false );
3741 }
3742 
3743 /******************************************************************/
3744 /* */
3745 /* */
3746 /******************************************************************/
3747 
3748 // @script | LoadStreamFrameAmp | Loads stream frame amplitude data for lipsync
3749 // @uparm name | stream name
3750 bool ScriptLoadStreamFrameAmp( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3751 {
3752  uint32 streamNameChecksum = 0;
3753  if ( pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &streamNameChecksum ) )
3754  {
3755  return Pcm::CStreamFrameAmpManager::sLoadFrameAmp(streamNameChecksum);
3756  }
3757  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0,( "\n%s\nMust specify stream name.", pScript->GetScriptInfo( ) ));
3758  return false;
3759 }
3760 
3761 /******************************************************************/
3762 /* */
3763 /* */
3764 /******************************************************************/
3765 
3766 // @script | FreeStreamFrameAmp | Frees stream frame amplitude data for lipsync
3767 // @uparm name | stream name
3768 bool ScriptFreeStreamFrameAmp( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3769 {
3770  uint32 streamNameChecksum = 0;
3771  if ( pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &streamNameChecksum ) )
3772  {
3773  return Pcm::CStreamFrameAmpManager::sFreeFrameAmp(streamNameChecksum);
3774  }
3775  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0,( "\n%s\nMust specify stream name.", pScript->GetScriptInfo( ) ));
3776  return false;
3777 }
3778 
3779 
3780 /******************************************************************/
3781 /* */
3782 /* */
3783 /******************************************************************/
3784 
3785 // @script | PlaySound |
3786 // @uparm name | sound name
3787 // @parmopt float | vol | 100.0 | volume of both left and right channel (overrides volL and volR)
3788 // @parmopt float | volL | 100.0 | volume of left channel
3789 // @parmopt float | volR | 100.0 | volume of right channel
3790 // @parmopt float | pitch | 100.0 |
3791 // @parmopt name | id | 0 | control ID (used instead of sound name for script control purposes)
3792 bool ScriptPlaySound(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
3793 {
3794  uint32 SoundChecksum = 0;
3795  uint32 id = 0;
3796  float Volume = 100.0f;
3797  float VolL = 100.0f;
3798  float VolR = 100.0f;
3799  float Pitch = 100.0f;
3800 
3801  pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &SoundChecksum );
3802  pParams->GetFloat( "VolL", &VolL );
3803  pParams->GetFloat( "VolR", &VolR );
3804  if (pParams->GetFloat( "Vol", &Volume ))
3805  {
3806  VolL = Volume;
3807  VolR = Volume;
3808  }
3809  pParams->GetFloat( "Pitch", &Pitch );
3810  pParams->GetChecksum( CRCD(0x40c698af,"id"), &id );
3811 
3812  Dbg_MsgAssert( SoundChecksum,( "PlaySound requires the name of the sound" ));
3813 
3814  Sfx::sVolume vol;
3815  vol.SetSilent();
3816  vol.SetChannelVolume( 0, VolL );
3817  vol.SetChannelVolume( 1, VolR );
3818 
3819  Sfx::CSfxManager * sfx_manager = Sfx::CSfxManager::Instance();
3820  if( !sfx_manager->PlaySound( SoundChecksum, &vol, Pitch, id ))
3821  {
3822 #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
3823  printf( "failed to play sound %s", Script::FindChecksumName( SoundChecksum ) );
3824 #endif
3825  }
3826  return true;
3827 }
3828 
3829 /******************************************************************/
3830 /* */
3831 /* */
3832 /******************************************************************/
3833 
3834 // @script | StopSound |
3835 // @uparm name | sound name (or control ID, if one was supplied with PlaySound)
3836 bool ScriptStopSound( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3837 {
3838  uint32 id;
3839  if (pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &id ))
3840  {
3841  Sfx::CSfxManager* sfx_manager = Sfx::CSfxManager::Instance();
3842  bool result = sfx_manager->StopSound(id);
3843 
3844  if (!result)
3845  {
3846  Dbg_Message( "Couldn't find sound %s to stop", Script::FindChecksumName( id ) );
3847  }
3848 
3849  return result;
3850  }
3851  else
3852  {
3853  Dbg_MsgAssert(0, ("No sound specified"));
3854  }
3855 
3856  return false;
3857 }
3858 
3859 /******************************************************************/
3860 /* */
3861 /* */
3862 /******************************************************************/
3863 
3864 // @script | StopAllSounds |
3865 bool ScriptStopAllSounds(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
3866 {
3867  Sfx::CSfxManager* sfx_manager = Sfx::CSfxManager::Instance();
3868  sfx_manager->StopAllSounds();
3869 
3870  return true;
3871 }
3872 
3873 /******************************************************************/
3874 /* */
3875 /* */
3876 /******************************************************************/
3877 
3878 // @script | SetSoundParams | Set the volume and pitch of a playing sound
3879 // @uparm name | sound name (or control ID, if one was supplied with PlaySound)
3880 // @parmopt float | vol | 100.0 | volume of both left and right channel (overrides volL and volR)
3881 // @parmopt float | volL | 100.0 | volume of left channel
3882 // @parmopt float | volR | 100.0 | volume of right channel
3883 // @parmopt float | pitch | 100.0 | pitch of sound
3884 bool ScriptSetSoundParams( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3885 {
3886  uint32 id = 0;
3887 
3888  if (pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &id ))
3889  {
3890  float Volume;
3891  float VolL = 100.0f;
3892  float VolR = 100.0f;
3893  float Pitch = 100.0f;
3894 
3895  bool adjust_vol;
3896 
3897  adjust_vol = pParams->GetFloat( CRCD(0x5e285a66,"VolL"), &VolL );
3898  adjust_vol = pParams->GetFloat( CRCD(0xa4276705,"VolR"), &VolR ) || adjust_vol;
3899  if (pParams->GetFloat( CRCD(0xf6a36814,"Vol"), &Volume ))
3900  {
3901  VolL = Volume;
3902  VolR = Volume;
3903  adjust_vol = true;
3904  }
3905 
3906  if (pParams->GetFloat( CRCD(0xd8604126,"Pitch"), &Pitch ) && !adjust_vol)
3907  {
3908  Dbg_MsgAssert(0, ("Must set volume when setting pitch"));
3909 
3910  }
3911 
3912  Sfx::sVolume vol;
3913  vol.SetSilent();
3914  vol.SetChannelVolume( 0, VolL );
3915  vol.SetChannelVolume( 1, VolR );
3916 
3917  Sfx::CSfxManager * sfx_manager = Sfx::CSfxManager::Instance();
3918  if( !sfx_manager->SetSoundParams( id, &vol, Pitch ))
3919  {
3920  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
3921  Dbg_MsgAssert(0, ("Can't find sound %s", Script::FindChecksumName(id)));
3922  #endif // __NOPT_ASSERT__
3923  }
3924  }
3925  else
3926  {
3927  Dbg_MsgAssert(0, ("No sound specified"));
3928  }
3929 
3930  return true;
3931 }
3932 
3933 /******************************************************************/
3934 /* */
3935 /* */
3936 /******************************************************************/
3937 
3938 // @script | IsSoundPlaying | Returns true if the named sound is currently playing
3939 // @uparm name | sound name (or control ID, if one was supplied with PlaySound)
3940 bool ScriptIsSoundPlaying( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3941 {
3942  uint32 id = 0;
3943 
3944  if (pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &id ))
3945  {
3946  Sfx::CSfxManager * sfx_manager = Sfx::CSfxManager::Instance();
3947  return sfx_manager->SoundIsPlaying(id);
3948  }
3949  else
3950  {
3951  Dbg_MsgAssert(0, ("No sound specified"));
3952  }
3953 
3954  return false;
3955 }
3956 
3957 /******************************************************************/
3958 /* */
3959 /* */
3960 /******************************************************************/
3961 
3962 // @script | SetSfxReverb | 1st param: reverbLevel <nl>
3963 // default 0 (will turn reverb off) <nl>
3964 // range: 0 to 100 percent <nl>
3965 // 2nd param: mode (see possible values in reverb.q) <nl>
3966 // default is 0 (first value in reverb.q) <nl> <nl>
3967 // Notes: 2nd param (mode) only matters if 1st param (reverbLevel) is
3968 // above 0. On a script Cleanup command, the global reverb is turned off.
3969 // @uparmopt 0.0 | Reverb (cannot be greater than 100)
3970 // @uparmopt name | reverb mode
3971 bool ScriptSetReverb( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
3972 {
3973 
3974  float reverb = 0.0f;
3975  int reverbMode = 0;
3976 
3977  // if the parameter isn't found, it should default to zero!
3978  pParams->GetFloat( NONAME, &reverb );
3979  if ( reverb > 100.0f )
3980  {
3981  reverb = 100.0f;
3982  Dbg_Message( "Reverb greater than 100. Clipping." );
3983  }
3984 
3985  // if the parameter isn't found, it should default to zero!
3986  pParams->GetInteger( CRCD(0x6835b854,"mode"), &reverbMode );
3987 
3988  Sfx::CSfxManager * sfx_manager = Sfx::CSfxManager::Instance();
3989  sfx_manager->SetReverb( reverb, reverbMode, pParams->ContainsFlag( "instant" ) );
3990 
3991  return ( true );
3992 }
3993 
3994 /******************************************************************/
3995 /* */
3996 /* */
3997 /******************************************************************/
3998 
3999 // @script | SetSfxDropoff | SetSfxDropoff [100] <nl>
4000 // Param: dropoff distance (in feet) <nl>
4001 // range: anything above zero <nl>
4002 // default is 100 <nl> <nl>
4003 // Notes: only affects positional soundfx. Also, the global
4004 // dropoff distance is set back to 100 (or whatever you want me
4005 // to set it to) on a script Cleanup command. That way, if somebody
4006 // forgets to call SetSfxDropoff at the beginning of their level, it
4007 // will always be this default instead of staying at whatever level
4008 // the previously loaded level had it set to
4009 // @uparm 1.0 | Dropoff distance
4010 bool ScriptSetDropoff( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
4011 {
4012 
4013  float dropoffDist = DEFAULT_DROPOFF_DIST;
4014 
4015  pParams->GetFloat( NONAME, &dropoffDist );
4016  if ( dropoffDist <= 0.0f )
4017  {
4018  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0.0f,( "Can't have dropoff zero or less." ));
4019  return ( false );
4020  }
4021 
4022  Sfx::CSfxManager * sfx_manager = Sfx::CSfxManager::Instance();
4023  sfx_manager->SetDefaultDropoffDist( FEET_TO_INCHES( dropoffDist ) );
4024 
4025  return ( true );
4026 }
4027 
4028 /******************************************************************/
4029 /* */
4030 /* */
4031 /******************************************************************/
4032 
4033 
4034 
4035 void set_all_colors(Nx::CScene * p_scene, Image::RGBA rgb, uint32 light_group)
4036 {
4037  Lst::HashTable< Nx::CSector > * p_sector_list = p_scene->GetSectorList();
4038 
4039 
4040 
4041  if (p_sector_list)
4042  {
4043  p_sector_list->IterateStart();
4044  Nx::CSector *p_sector = p_sector_list->IterateNext();
4045  if (light_group)
4046  {
4047  while(p_sector)
4048  {
4049  if (p_sector->GetLightGroup() == light_group)
4050  {
4051  p_sector->SetColor(rgb);
4052  }
4053  p_sector = p_sector_list->IterateNext();
4054  }
4055  }
4056  else
4057  {
4058  while(p_sector)
4059  {
4060  p_sector->SetColor(rgb);
4061  p_sector = p_sector_list->IterateNext();
4062  }
4063  }
4064  }
4065 }
4066 
4067 
4068 // Given a value, a target and a range, then scale the distance from the target by the amount
4069 // so,
4070 float compress_value(float value, float target, float amount)
4071 {
4072  float v = target + (value-target) * amount;
4073  if (v<0.0f) v = 0.0f;
4074  if (v>255.0f) v = 255.0f;
4075  return v;
4076 }
4077 
4078 void compress_all_vertex_colors(Nx::CScene * p_scene, float target, float amount, uint32 light_group)
4079 {
4080  Lst::HashTable< Nx::CSector > * p_sector_list = p_scene->GetSectorList();
4081 
4082  Image::RGBA rgb;
4083 
4084 
4085  if (p_sector_list)
4086  {
4087  p_sector_list->IterateStart();
4088  Nx::CSector *p_sector = p_sector_list->IterateNext();
4089  while(p_sector)
4090  {
4091 
4092  Nx::CGeom *p_geom = p_sector->GetGeom();
4093 // Dbg_MsgAssert(p_geom,("sector does not have geometry"))
4094 
4095  if (p_geom && (!light_group || light_group == p_sector->GetLightGroup()))
4096  {
4097  //
4098  // Do renderable geometry
4099  int verts = p_geom->GetNumRenderVerts();
4100 
4101  if (verts)
4102  {
4103  // Mth::Vector *p_verts = new Mth::Vector[verts];
4104  Image::RGBA *p_colors = new Image::RGBA[verts];
4105  // p_geom->GetRenderVerts(p_verts);
4106  //p_source_geom->GetRenderColors(p_colors);
4107 
4108  // Note: getting the original render colors will allocate lots of memory
4109  // to store all the origianl colors the firs tiem it is called
4110  p_geom->GetOrigRenderColors(p_colors);
4111 
4112  Image::RGBA *p_color = p_colors;
4113  if (target != 0.0 || amount != 0.0)
4114  {
4115  for (int i = 0; i < verts; i++)
4116  {
4117  rgb.a = p_color->a;
4118  rgb.r = (uint8) compress_value((float) p_color->r,target,amount);
4119  rgb.g = (uint8) compress_value((float) p_color->g,target,amount);
4120  rgb.b = (uint8) compress_value((float) p_color->b,target,amount);
4121  *p_color = rgb; //(*p_color & 0xff000000) | color;
4122  p_color++;
4123  } // end for
4124  }
4125 
4126  // Set the colors on the actual new geom, not on the source...
4127  p_geom->SetRenderColors(p_colors);
4128 
4129  // delete [] p_verts;
4130  delete [] p_colors;
4131  } // end if
4132  else
4133  {
4134  // debuggery
4135  //p_geom->SetColor(Image::RGBA(0,0,100,0));
4136  }
4137  }
4138  p_sector = p_sector_list->IterateNext();
4139  }
4140  }
4141 }
4142 
4143 
4144 
4145 void nudge_vertex_colors(Nx::CScene * p_scene, float amount)
4146 {
4147  Lst::HashTable< Nx::CSector > * p_sector_list = p_scene->GetSectorList();
4148 
4149  Image::RGBA rgb;
4150 
4151  if (p_sector_list)
4152  {
4153  p_sector_list->IterateStart();
4154  Nx::CSector *p_sector = p_sector_list->IterateNext();
4155  while(p_sector)
4156  {
4157 
4158  Nx::CGeom *p_geom = p_sector->GetGeom();
4159 // Dbg_MsgAssert(p_geom,("sector does not have geometry"))
4160 
4161  if (p_geom)
4162  {
4163  //
4164  // Do renderable geometry
4165  int verts = p_geom->GetNumRenderVerts();
4166 
4167  if (verts)
4168  {
4169  Mth::Vector *p_verts = new Mth::Vector[verts];
4170  Image::RGBA *p_colors = new Image::RGBA[verts];
4171  p_geom->GetRenderVerts(p_verts);
4172  //p_source_geom->GetRenderColors(p_colors);
4173 
4174  // Note: getting the original render colors will allocate lots of memory
4175  // to store all the origianl colors the firs tiem it is called
4176  p_geom->GetOrigRenderColors(p_colors);
4177 
4178  Image::RGBA *p_color = p_colors;
4179  Mth::Vector *p_vert = p_verts;
4180  for (int i = 0; i < verts; i++)
4181  {
4182  // CalculateVertexLighting(*p_vert, *p_color);
4183 
4184  rgb.a = p_color->a;
4185 
4186  Mth::Vector col;
4187  col.Set(p_color->r, p_color->g, p_color->b);
4188 
4189 
4190  // create a pseudo random number based on the vertex position
4191  // so non-common verts in the same position will get the same result
4192  // which is the only way you can get a smooth result
4193  int i_random = (int)((*p_vert)[X]*16.0f) * (int)((*p_vert)[Y]*16.0f) ^ (int)((*p_vert)[Z]*16.0f);
4194  float r1 = (float)(i_random & 0x7fff) / 32768.0f;
4195 
4196  float nudge = 1.0f + ( 2.0f * r1 * amount ) - amount;
4197 
4198  col *= nudge;
4199  if (col[X] < 0.0f) col[X] = 0.0f;
4200  if (col[X] > 255.0f) col[X] = 255.0f;
4201  if (col[Y] < 0.0f) col[Y] = 0.0f;
4202  if (col[Y] > 255.0f) col[Y] = 255.0f;
4203  if (col[Z] < 0.0f) col[Z] = 0.0f;
4204  if (col[Z] > 255.0f) col[Z] = 255.0f;
4205 
4206  rgb.r = (uint8)col[X];
4207  rgb.g = (uint8)col[Y];
4208  rgb.b = (uint8)col[Z];
4209 
4210  *p_color = rgb; //(*p_color & 0xff000000) | color;
4211  //*(uint32*)p_color = Mth::Rnd(32767); //(*p_color & 0xff000000) | color;
4212 
4213  p_color++;
4214  p_vert++;
4215  } // end for
4216 
4217  // Set the colors on the actual new geom, not on the source...
4218  p_geom->SetRenderColors(p_colors);
4219 
4220  delete [] p_verts;
4221  delete [] p_colors;
4222  } // end if
4223  else
4224  {
4225  // debuggery
4226  //p_geom->SetColor(Image::RGBA(0,0,100,0));
4227  }
4228  }
4229  p_sector = p_sector_list->IterateNext();
4230  }
4231  }
4232 }
4233 
4234 
4235 
4236 
4237 bool ScriptSetSceneColor( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
4238 {
4239 
4240  uint32 color;
4241 
4242  pParams->GetInteger( "color", (int*)&color, TRUE );
4243  uint32 sky = color;
4244  pParams->GetInteger( "sky", (int*)&sky );
4245  uint32 light_group =0;
4246  pParams->GetChecksum( "lightgroup", (uint32*)&light_group );
4247  Nx::CScene *p_scene = Nx::CEngine::sGetMainScene();
4248 
4249  Image::RGBA rgb;
4250  rgb.r = (uint8)((color)&0xff);
4251  rgb.g = (uint8)((color>>8)&0xff);
4252  rgb.b = (uint8)((color>>16)&0xff);
4253  rgb.a = 0x80;
4254 
4255  Image::RGBA sky_rgb;
4256  sky_rgb.r = (uint8)((sky)&0xff);
4257  sky_rgb.g = (uint8)((sky>>8)&0xff);
4258  sky_rgb.b = (uint8)((sky>>16)&0xff);
4259  sky_rgb.a = 0x80;
4260 
4261 
4262  if (p_scene)
4263  {
4264  // For main scene, just set the root color
4265  #ifdef __PLAT_NGPS__
4266 
4267  // if doing a global or outdoor change to some color
4268  // then reset all the colors first
4269  // to reset things that were set by individual SetObjectColor commands
4270  // like the Chris's best line goal in NJ
4271  if (color != 0x808080 && (light_group == CRCD(0xe3714dc1,"outdoor") || light_group == 0))
4272  {
4273  Image::RGBA clear_rgb(0x80,0x80,0x80,0x80);
4274  set_all_colors(p_scene, clear_rgb, light_group);
4275  }
4276 
4277  // if not the outdoor or default group, or if we are turing lighting off with 0x808080
4278  // then set it on all nodes
4279  // otherwise we just set the root color
4280  if ((light_group != CRCD(0xe3714dc1,"outdoor") && light_group != 0 ) || color == 0x808080
4281  /*|| p_scene->GetID() ==CRCD(0xefc68238,"cloned")*/)
4282  #endif
4283  {
4284  set_all_colors(p_scene, rgb, light_group);
4285  }
4286 
4287  // Set the root color of the scene. A PS2 specific optimization
4288  // which can be ignored by other platforms.
4289  if (light_group == CRCD(0xe3714dc1,"outdoor") || light_group == 0)
4290  {
4291  p_scene->SetMajorityColor(rgb);
4292  }
4293  }
4294 
4295  // K: If the park editor shell scene exists, update its colours too.
4296  p_scene=Nx::CEngine::sGetScene(Ed::CParkManager::Instance()->GetShellSceneID());
4297  if (p_scene)
4298  {
4299  // Note, cut and paste from above
4300  #ifdef __PLAT_NGPS__
4301  // if not the outdoor or default group, or if we are turing lighting off with 0x808080
4302  // then set it on all nodes
4303  // otherwise we just set the root color
4304  if ((light_group != CRCD(0xe3714dc1,"outdoor") && light_group != 0 ) || color == 0x808080)
4305  #endif
4306  {
4307  set_all_colors(p_scene, rgb, light_group);
4308  }
4309 
4310  // Set the root color of the scene. A PS2 specific optimization
4311  // which can be ignored by other platforms.
4312  if (light_group == CRCD(0xe3714dc1,"outdoor") || light_group == 0)
4313  {
4314  p_scene->SetMajorityColor(rgb);
4315  }
4316  }
4317 
4318 
4319  p_scene = Nx::CEngine::sGetSkyScene();
4320 
4321  if (p_scene)
4322  {
4323  set_all_colors(p_scene, sky_rgb, light_group);
4324  }
4325 
4326  // we also need to set the color of all the level objects
4327  // assume they are all "outdoors"
4328  if (light_group == CRCD(0xe3714dc1,"outdoor") || light_group == 0)
4329  {
4330  Obj::CModelComponent *p_component = static_cast<Obj::CModelComponent*>( Obj::CCompositeObjectManager::Instance()->GetFirstComponentByType( CRC_MODEL ));
4331  while( p_component )
4332  {
4333  p_component->ApplySceneLighting(rgb);
4334  p_component = static_cast<Obj::CModelComponent*>( p_component->GetNextSameType());
4335  }
4336  }
4337 
4338  return true;
4339 }
4340 
4341 
4342 
4343 
4344 
4345 /******************************************************************/
4346 /* */
4347 /* */
4348 /******************************************************************/
4349 bool ScriptCompressVC( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
4350 {
4351 
4352  float target = 0.0f;
4353  pParams->GetFloat( "target", (float*)&target, TRUE );
4354  float amount = 0.0f;
4355  pParams->GetFloat( "percent", (float*)&amount );
4356  amount = (100.0f - amount)/100.0f;
4357  uint32 light_group =0;
4358  pParams->GetChecksum( "lightgroup", (uint32*)&light_group );
4359 
4360  Nx::CScene *p_scene = Nx::CEngine::sGetMainScene();
4361  if (p_scene)
4362  {
4363  compress_all_vertex_colors(p_scene, target, amount, light_group);
4364  }
4365  p_scene = Nx::CEngine::sGetSkyScene();
4366  if (p_scene)
4367  {
4368  compress_all_vertex_colors(p_scene, target, amount, light_group);
4369  }
4370  return true;
4371 }
4372 
4373 // @script bool | FakeLights | Adjust lighting for a node-based SceneLight.
4374 // @parm name | id | The name of the node, if only one needs adjusting.
4375 // @parm name | Prefix | The prefix of a set of nodes, if lots need adjusting.
4376 // @parmopt integer | Time | 0 | The time period, in frames, over which the execution of the command
4377 // will be spread so as not to use up too much CPU time in one frame.
4378 // @parmopt float | inner_radius | none | The new radius of the light in inches
4379 // @parmopt float | outer_radius | none | The new radius of the light in inches
4380 // @parmopt float | percent | none | The new intensity percentage
4381 // @parmopt integer | red | none | The new red component of the light color (also green, blue)
4382 bool ScriptFakeLights( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
4383 {
4384  // If an id is supplied, we want to apply the effect to just one light.
4385  uint32 id = 0;
4386  if( pParams->GetChecksum( CRCD(0x40c698af,"id"), &id ))
4387  {
4388  Nx::CLightManager::sFakeLight(id,pParams);
4389  return true;
4390  }
4391 
4392  // Get the period in frames over which the command will execute.
4393  int time_period=0;
4394  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0x906b67ba,"time"),&time_period);
4395 
4396  // K: Added this bit to allow a set of nodes with a given prefix to be adjusted.
4397  uint32 prefix=0;
4398  if ( pParams->GetChecksumOrStringChecksum( CRCD(0x6c4e7971,"Prefix"), &prefix ) )
4399  {
4400  uint16 num_nodes = 0;
4401  const uint16 *p_nodes = SkateScript::GetPrefixedNodes( prefix, &num_nodes );
4402 
4403  Nx::CLightManager::sFakeLights(p_nodes,num_nodes,time_period,pParams);
4404  return true;
4405  }
4406 
4407  return false;
4408 }
4409 
4410 /******************************************************************/
4411 /* */
4412 /* */
4413 /******************************************************************/
4414 bool ScriptNudgeVC( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
4415 {
4416 
4417  float amount = 0.0f;
4418  pParams->GetFloat( "percent", (float*)&amount, true );
4419  amount = (amount)/100.0f;
4420  Nx::CScene *p_scene = Nx::CEngine::sGetMainScene();
4421  if (p_scene)
4422  {
4423  nudge_vertex_colors(p_scene,amount);
4424  }
4425  return true;
4426 }
4427 
4428 // Center the viewer camera on the scene
4429 // (Previously this would center the current camera on the scene, which had unintended results)
4430 void center_camera_on_scene(Nx::CScene * p_scene, float scale, float x_rot, float y_rot, float z_rot, uint32 id=0)
4431 {
4432 
4433  // get a bounding box of the world, and center the camera on that
4434  Mth::CBBox bbox;
4435 
4436  Lst::HashTable< Nx::CSector > * p_sector_list = p_scene->GetSectorList();
4437  if (p_sector_list)
4438  {
4439  p_sector_list->IterateStart();
4440  Nx::CSector *p_sector = p_sector_list->IterateNext();
4441  while(p_sector)
4442  {
4443 
4444  if ((!id || id == p_sector->GetChecksum()) && p_sector->IsActive())
4445  {
4446 
4447  Nx::CGeom *p_geom = p_sector->GetGeom();
4448  if (p_geom)
4449  {
4450  //
4451  // Do renderable geometry
4452  int verts = p_geom->GetNumRenderVerts();
4453  if (verts)
4454  {
4455  Mth::Vector *p_verts = new Mth::Vector[verts];
4456  p_geom->GetRenderVerts(p_verts);
4457  Mth::Vector *p_vert = p_verts;
4458  for (int i = 0; i < verts; i++)
4459  {
4460  bbox.AddPoint(*p_vert);
4461  //printf ("%f,%f,%f,%f\n",p_vert[0][X],p_vert[0][Y],p_vert[0][Z],p_vert[0][W]);
4462 // if (i>0)
4463 // {
4464 // Gfx::AddDebugLine(p_vert[0],p_vert[-1],0xffffff,100);
4465 // }
4466  p_vert++;
4467  } // end for
4468 
4469  delete [] p_verts;
4470  } // end if
4471  }
4472  }
4473  p_sector = p_sector_list->IterateNext();
4474  }
4475  }
4476 
4477 
4478 
4479 
4480  // Move the camera to the object, and move it back by the width of the object (min 100 ft)
4481 // Gfx::Camera* pCam = Nx::CViewportManager::sGetCamera( 0 );
4482 
4483 // Mick: Now we attempt to get the viewer camera object
4484 
4485  Obj::CCompositeObject *p_obj = (Obj::CCompositeObject *)Obj::CCompositeObjectManager::Instance()->GetObjectByID(CRCD(0xeb17151b,"viewer_cam"));
4486  if (!p_obj)
4487  {
4488  return;
4489  }
4490 
4491 
4492  Dbg_MsgAssert(GetCameraComponentFromObject(p_obj),("Viewer Camera Object Missing camera component"));
4493 
4494 
4495  Mth::Vector min = bbox.GetMin();
4496  Mth::Vector max = bbox.GetMax();
4497  Mth::Vector mid = (min + max)/2.0f;
4498  float diagonal = (max - min).Length();
4499  if (diagonal < 1000)
4500  {
4501  diagonal = 1000;
4502  }
4503 
4504 
4505  diagonal *= scale;
4506 
4507  // Note we are moving the parent object, the camera component takes its pos from this
4508  p_obj->GetMatrix().Ident();
4509  p_obj->GetMatrix().RotateX(Mth::DegToRad(x_rot));
4510  p_obj->GetMatrix().RotateY(Mth::DegToRad(y_rot));
4511  p_obj->GetMatrix().RotateZ(Mth::DegToRad(z_rot));
4512 
4513  // printf ("diagonal = %f, mid = [%f,%f,%f]\nbox = [%f,%f,%f] - [%f,%f,%f]\n",diagonal,mid[X],mid[Y],mid[Z],min[X],min[Y],min[Z],max[X],max[Y],max[Z] );
4514 
4515  p_obj->SetPos(mid + scale * diagonal * p_obj->GetMatrix().GetAt());
4516 
4517 
4518 }
4519 
4520 
4521 // @script | CenterCamera | Center the camera on the rendered geometry, or an individual object
4522 // @parmopt float | scale | 0.9 |
4523 // @parmopt float | X | -45 | Angle to rotate about X
4524 // @parmopt float | Y | 45 | Angle to rotate about Y
4525 // @parmopt float | Z | 0 | Angle to rotate about X
4526 // @parmopt checksum | id | 0 | checksum of and individual object to center on
4527 // Notes: The Camera will be centered on the center of the bounding box
4528 // of all exported geometry. It will be moved back by the size of the diagonal
4529 // of the bounding box, and rotated by the X,Y,Z angles
4530 
4531 bool ScriptCenterCamera( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
4532 {
4533  // This is only interend to be used in the fly around modes
4534  // so kill it during menus
4535 
4536  if (!Mdl::CViewer::sGetViewMode())
4537  {
4538  return false;
4539  }
4540 
4541 
4542  float scale = 0.9f;
4543  pParams->GetFloat( "scale", &scale );
4544  float X = -45.0f;;
4545  pParams->GetFloat( "x", &X );
4546  float Y = 45.0f;
4547  pParams->GetFloat( "y", &Y );
4548  float Z = 0.0f;
4549  pParams->GetFloat( "z", &Z );
4550  uint32 id = 0;
4551  pParams->GetChecksum( "id", &id );
4552 
4553 
4554 
4555 
4556  Nx::CScene *p_scene = Nx::CEngine::sGetMainScene();
4557  if (p_scene)
4558  {
4559  center_camera_on_scene(p_scene, scale, X, Y, Z, id);
4560  }
4561  return true;
4562 }
4563 
4564 
4565 
4566 
4567 
4568 #define CHECKSUM_MAXPITCH 0xfa3e14c5 // maxpitch
4569 #define CHECKSUM_MINPITCH 0x1c5ebb24 // minpitch
4570 #define CHECKSUM_MAXVOL 0x0693daaf // maxvol
4571 #define CHECKSUM_MINVOL 0x4391992d // minvol
4572 #define CHECKSUM_TERRAIN 0x3789ac4e // terrain
4573 #define CHECKSUM_TABLE 0x09d670b9 // table
4574 
4575 /******************************************************************/
4576 /* */
4577 /* */
4578 /******************************************************************/
4579 
4580 // @script | LoadTerrainSounds | Loads all the associated sounds for a terrain type of a level.
