4581 // @parm name | terrain | Name of terrain
4582 
4583 bool ScriptLoadTerrainSounds( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
4584 {
4585  uint32 terrain_checksum;
4586 
4587  if (!pParams->GetChecksum(CHECKSUM_TERRAIN, &terrain_checksum))
4588  {
4589  printf("Expected terrain checksum\n");
4590  return false;
4591  }
4592 
4593  ETerrainType terrain = Env::CTerrainManager::sGetTerrainFromChecksum(terrain_checksum);
4594  Env::CTerrainManager::sLoadTerrainSounds(terrain);
4595 
4596  return true;
4597 }
4598 
4599 /******************************************************************/
4600 /* */
4601 /* */
4602 /******************************************************************/
4603 
4604 // @script | Goto | jumps to the specified script
4605 // @Uparm name | The name of the script
4606 // @parmopt structure | Params | | parameter list to pass to the new script
4607 bool ScriptGoto(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
4608 {
4609 
4610  uint32 ScriptChecksum=0;
4611  pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME,&ScriptChecksum);
4612  Dbg_MsgAssert(ScriptChecksum,("Goto command requires a script name"));
4613 
4614  Script::CStruct *pArgs=NULL;
4615  pParams->GetStructure(CRCD(0x7031f10c,"Params"),&pArgs);
4616  pScript->SetScript(ScriptChecksum,pArgs,pScript->mpObject);
4617  return true;
4618 }
4619 
4620 /******************************************************************/
4621 /* */
4622 /* */
4623 /******************************************************************/
4624 
4625 // @script | GotoPreserveParams | This has the same effect as goto,
4626 // except all the parameters that were passed to the current script
4627 // will get passed to the new script
4628 // @Uparm name | The name of the script to goto
4629 // @parmopt structure | Params | | additional parameters to pass to script
4630 bool ScriptGotoPreserveParams(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
4631 {
4632 
4633  uint32 ScriptChecksum=0;
4634  pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME,&ScriptChecksum);
4635  Dbg_MsgAssert(ScriptChecksum,("GotoPreserveParams command requires a script name"));
4636 
4637  // Extract the old script parameters.
4638  // Note: Need to do it this way rather than pass pScript->GetParams() to pScript->SetScript,
4639  // because SetScript will clear the pScript's params before using the passed params, but
4640  // since the passed params ARE the pScript's params, this will mean they will get zeroed.
4641  Script::CStruct *pTemp=new Script::CStruct;
4642  pTemp->AppendStructure(pScript->GetParams());
4643 
4644  // If any more params are specified, merge them on too.
4645  Script::CStruct *pMoreParams=NULL;
4646  pParams->GetStructure(CRCD(0x7031f10c,"Params"),&pMoreParams);
4647  pTemp->AppendStructure(pMoreParams);
4648 
4649 
4650  pScript->SetScript(ScriptChecksum,pTemp,pScript->mpObject);
4651  delete pTemp;
4652 
4653  return true;
4654 }
4655 
4656 /******************************************************************/
4657 /* */
4658 /* */
4659 /******************************************************************/
4660 
4661 // @script | GotoRandomScript | This will abort the current script
4662 // and jump to a random one of the scripts specified in an array. <nl>
4663 // For example: <nl>
4664 // GotoRandomScript [ScriptA ScriptB ScriptC]
4665 // @uparm [] | Array of scripts to choose from
4666 
4667 bool ScriptGotoRandomScript(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
4668 {
4669 
4670 
4671  Script::CArray *pArray=NULL;
4672  pParams->GetArray(NONAME,&pArray);
4673  if (pArray && pArray->GetSize())
4674  {
4675  switch (pArray->GetType())
4676  {
4677  case ESYMBOLTYPE_NAME:
4678  pScript->SetScript(pArray->GetNameChecksum(Mth::Rnd(pArray->GetSize())),NULL,pScript->mpObject);
4679  break;
4680  default:
4681  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("GotoRandomScript requires an array of script names."));
4682  break;
4683  }
4684  }
4685  return true;
4686 }
4687 
4688 /******************************************************************/
4689 /* */
4690 /* */
4691 /******************************************************************/
4692 
4693 // @script | PrintStruct | Prints the contents of the passed structure
4694 // @uparm structure | The structure to print
4695 bool ScriptPrintStruct(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
4696 {
4697  Script::PrintContents(pParams);
4698  return true;
4699 }
4700 
4701 /******************************************************************/
4702 /* */
4703 /* */
4704 /******************************************************************/
4705 
4706 static CComponent sTempComponent;
4707 
4708 static int sFormatText(CStruct *p_dest_struct, CStruct *p_format)
4709 {
4710  #define FORMATTED_TEXT_MAX_LEN 1000
4711  static char s_printf_buffer[FORMATTED_TEXT_MAX_LEN+1];
4712 
4713  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_format,("NULL p_format"));
4714 
4715  uint32 string_name_checksum=0;
4716  p_format->GetChecksum(CRCD(0xff0db407,"TextName"),&string_name_checksum);
4717 
4718  // If passed a ChecksumName, the checksum of the formatted text will
4719  // be calculated and put into a parameter with that name.
4720  uint32 checksum_name_checksum=0;
4721  p_format->GetChecksum(CRCD(0x76fa7a8f,"ChecksumName"),&checksum_name_checksum);
4722 
4723  int result = 1;
4724 
4725  const char *p_format_text="";
4726  if (!p_format->GetString(NONAME,&p_format_text))
4727  {
4728  printf("Expected text format parameters to contain a format string\n");
4729  return 0;
4730  }
4731 
4732  char *p_dest=s_printf_buffer;
4733  const char *p_scan=p_format_text;
4734  int space_left=FORMATTED_TEXT_MAX_LEN;
4735  while (*p_scan)
4736  {
4737  Dbg_MsgAssert(space_left,("Overflowed formatted text buffer"));
4738 
4739  if (p_scan[0]=='\\' && p_scan[1]=='%')
4740  {
4741  // Make \% equate to %, so that we can have % chars in the string.
4742  ++p_scan;
4743  *p_dest++=*p_scan++;
4744  --space_left;
4745  }
4746  else if (*p_scan=='%')
4747  {
4748  ++p_scan; // Skip over the %
4749 
4750  // Find the component in p_format which has the same name as the name following
4751  // the % sign.
4752  #define PARAM_NAME_MAX_LEN 50
4753  char p_param_name[PARAM_NAME_MAX_LEN+1];
4754  int c=0;
4755  char *p_param_name_dest=p_param_name;
4756 
4757  if (*p_scan=='%')
4758  {
4759  // Two percents mean that what follows is a name longer than one char.
4760  ++p_scan;
4761 
4762  while ((*p_scan>='a' && *p_scan<='z') ||
4763  (*p_scan>='A' && *p_scan<='Z') ||
4764  (*p_scan>='0' && *p_scan<='9') ||
4765  *p_scan=='_')
4766  {
4767  Dbg_MsgAssert(c<PARAM_NAME_MAX_LEN,("Text formatting param name too long in '%s'",p_format_text));
4768  *p_param_name_dest++=*p_scan++;
4769  ++c;
4770  }
4771  }
4772  else
4773  {
4774  // One percent means that the name is defined by just one char.
4775  // This is to allow formatting to be used to append strings, for example
4776  // "%sBlaa"
4777  *p_param_name_dest++=*p_scan++;
4778  }
4779 
4780  *p_param_name_dest=0;
4781  // Got the param name, so look it up in the p_format structure.
4782  CComponent *p_unresolved_comp=p_format->FindNamedComponentRecurse(GenerateCRC(p_param_name));
4783 
4784  if (!p_unresolved_comp)
4785  {
4786  printf("Missing text formatting parameter '%s'\n",p_param_name);
4787  return 0;
4788  }
4789 
4790  // p_unresolved_comp may have type Name, which may resolve to some global. So use
4791  // the ResolveNameComponent to resolve it.
4792  // Using sTempComponent because ResolveNameComponent may modify the component by
4793  // perhaps setting it's mpStructure or mpArray to equal that of some global symbol.
4794  // It would be bad to modify the contents of p_unresolved_comp because it is
4795  // in the passed structure, which will get cleaned up later, resulting in the deletion
4796  // of the global symbol's pointer, causing horrible crashes.
4797  sTempComponent.mType=p_unresolved_comp->mType;
4798  sTempComponent.mUnion=p_unresolved_comp->mUnion;
4799  ResolveNameComponent(&sTempComponent);
4800 
4801  char p_temp[100];
4802  switch (sTempComponent.mType)
4803  {
4804  case ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER:
4805  {
4806  if (p_format->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xf138085f,"UseCommas")))
4807  {
4808  strcpy(p_temp,Str::PrintThousands(sTempComponent.mIntegerValue));
4809  }
4810  else
4811  {
4812  sprintf(p_temp,"%d",sTempComponent.mIntegerValue);
4813  }
4814  int len=strlen(p_temp);
4815  Dbg_MsgAssert(len<=space_left,("Overflowed formatted text buffer"));
4816  strcpy(p_dest,p_temp);
4817  p_dest+=len;
4818  space_left-=len;
4819  break;
4820  }
4821  case ESYMBOLTYPE_FLOAT:
4822  {
4823  int decimal_places=3;
4824  char format_string[16];
4825  p_format->GetInteger(CRCD(0xd8e2e09f,"DecimalPlaces"),&decimal_places);
4826  Dbg_MsgAssert(decimal_places>=0 && decimal_places<10,("decimal_places must be less than 10"));
4827  sprintf( format_string, "%%.%df", decimal_places );
4828  sprintf(p_temp,format_string,sTempComponent.mFloatValue);
4829  int len=strlen(p_temp);
4830  Dbg_MsgAssert(len<=space_left,("Overflowed formatted text buffer"));
4831  strcpy(p_dest,p_temp);
4832  p_dest+=len;
4833  space_left-=len;
4834  break;
4835  }
4836  case ESYMBOLTYPE_PAIR:
4837  {
4838  CPair *p_pair=sTempComponent.mpPair;
4839  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_pair,("NULL p_pair"));
4840 
4841  sprintf(p_temp,"(%.3f,%.3f)",p_pair->mX,p_pair->mY);
4842  int len=strlen(p_temp);
4843  Dbg_MsgAssert(len<=space_left,("Overflowed formatted text buffer"));
4844  strcpy(p_dest,p_temp);
4845  p_dest+=len;
4846  space_left-=len;
4847  break;
4848  }
4849  case ESYMBOLTYPE_VECTOR:
4850  {
4851  CVector *p_vector=sTempComponent.mpVector;
4852  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_vector,("NULL p_vector"));
4853 
4854  sprintf(p_temp,"(%.3f,%.3f,%.3f)",p_vector->mX,p_vector->mY,p_vector->mZ);
4855  int len=strlen(p_temp);
4856  Dbg_MsgAssert(len<=space_left,("Overflowed formatted text buffer"));
4857  strcpy(p_dest,p_temp);
4858  p_dest+=len;
4859  space_left-=len;
4860  break;
4861  }
4862  case ESYMBOLTYPE_NAME:
4863  {
4864  // we set the return result to 2, so we can assert in ScriptFormatText
4865  // so we can see where in the script we are
4866  result = 2;
4867  sprintf(p_temp,"%s",FindChecksumName(sTempComponent.mChecksum));
4868  int len=strlen(p_temp);
4869  Dbg_MsgAssert(len<=space_left,("Overflowed formatted text buffer"));
4870  strcpy(p_dest,p_temp);
4871  p_dest+=len;
4872  space_left-=len;
4873  break;
4874  }
4875  case ESYMBOLTYPE_STRING:
4876  case ESYMBOLTYPE_LOCALSTRING:
4877  {
4878  const char *p_source="";
4879  if (sTempComponent.mType==ESYMBOLTYPE_STRING)
4880  {
4881  p_source=sTempComponent.mpString;
4882  }
4883  else
4884  {
4885  p_source=sTempComponent.mpLocalString;
4886  }
4887 
4888  while (*p_source)
4889  {
4890  Dbg_MsgAssert(space_left,("Overflowed formatted text buffer"));
4891  *p_dest++=*p_source++;
4892  --space_left;
4893  }
4894  break;
4895  }
4896  default:
4897  {
4898  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("Error when formatting '%s'\n'%s' has data type '%s' which is not supported yet.\n",p_format_text,p_param_name,Script::GetTypeName(sTempComponent.mType)));
4899  break;
4900  }
4901  }
4902  }
4903  else
4904  {
4905  *p_dest++=*p_scan++;
4906  --space_left;
4907  }
4908  }
4909  *p_dest=0;
4910 
4911  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_dest_struct,("NULL p_dest_struct"));
4912  if (string_name_checksum)
4913  {
4914  p_dest_struct->AddString(string_name_checksum,s_printf_buffer);
4915  }
4916  if (checksum_name_checksum)
4917  {
4918  p_dest_struct->AddChecksum(checksum_name_checksum,Script::GenerateCRC(s_printf_buffer));
4919  }
4920  return result;
4921 }
4922 
4923 /******************************************************************/
4924 /* */
4925 /* */
4926 /******************************************************************/
4927 
4928 // @script | FormatText | Fills in any % characters in the passed format string with the passed
4929 // parameters, and assigns the new string to a parameter with the given name.
4930 // For example:
4931 // FormatText TextName=Line1 "Hello %f %b" f="Mum" b=23
4932 // will create the string "Hello Mum 23" and assign it to Line1
4933 // The name following the % must consist of a single character. This is to allow formatting to
4934 // be used to append strings, eg "%sBlaa"
4935 // If two % signs are used, then the name that follows may consist of more than one char,
4936 // eg "%%foo blaa"
4937 //
4938 // Currently supported data types are integer, float, string, local string, vector and pair.
4939 // If any of the parameters are missing it will give an error message and will not create the
4940 // final string. It will not assert though.
4941 //
4942 // @parmopt name | TextName | | The name to be given to the new formatted string
4943 // @parmopt name | ChecksumName | | If this is specified, the checksum of the formatted text
4944 // will be calculated and added using ChecksumName as its name.
4945 // @uparm string | The source format string
4946 // @flag UseCommas | This will make it print any integer using commas to separate thousands for clarity.
4947 bool ScriptFormatText(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
4948 {
4949  if (sFormatText(pScript->GetParams(),pParams) == 2)
4950  {
4951  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
4952 // Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("%s\nCannot use checksum names in FormatText",pScript->GetScriptInfo()));
4953  printf ("%s\n### WARNING ### - Cannot use checksum names in FormatText",pScript->GetScriptInfo());
4954  #endif
4955  }
4956  return true;
4957 }
4958 
4959 /******************************************************************/
4960 /* */
4961 /* */
4962 /******************************************************************/
4963 
4964 bool s_get_string_from_params(char* p_buffer, Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript* pScript)
4965 {
4966  Dbg_Assert( p_buffer );
4967 
4968  const char *p_text="Default printf text";
4969  if (pParams->GetText(NONAME,&p_text))
4970  {
4971  CStruct *p_format=new CStruct;
4972  p_format->AddChecksum(GenerateCRC("TextName"),GenerateCRC("PrintfText"));
4973  p_format->AppendStructure(pParams);
4974 
4975  if (sFormatText(p_format,p_format))
4976  {
4977  p_format->GetString("PrintfText",&p_text);
4978  }
4979  else
4980  {
4981  Dbg_Warning("\n%s\nError formatting text for printf",pScript->GetScriptInfo());
4982  p_text="";
4983  }
4984 
4985  sprintf(p_buffer, "%s\n",p_text);
4986 
4987  delete p_format; // p_format actually contains the string we are printing, so delete it AFTER the printf
4988 
4989  return true;
4990  }
4991 
4992  int IntVal=0;
4993  if (pParams->GetInteger(NONAME,&IntVal))
4994  {
4995  sprintf(p_buffer, "%d\n",IntVal);
4996 
4997  return true;
4998  }
4999 
5000  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
5001  uint32 Checksum=0;
5002  if (pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME,&Checksum))
5003  {
5004  sprintf(p_buffer, "[Checksum] %s\n",Script::FindChecksumName(Checksum));
5005 
5006  return true;
5007  }
5008 
5009  sprintf(p_buffer, "Empty printf at %s", pScript->GetScriptInfo());
5010  #endif
5011 
5012  return true;
5013 }
5014 
5015 /******************************************************************/
5016 /* */
5017 /* */
5018 /******************************************************************/
5019 
5020 // @script | Printf | Printf "Default printf text" Prints the passed
5021 // text onto the EE0 output on the target manager.
5022 // Printf can will also print the checksum name of any passed checksum, for example:
5023 // printf blaa // Will print: [Checksum] blaa
5024 // @uparmopt "text" | some text to print
5025 // @uparmopt 1 | an int to print
5026 // @uparmopt name | checksum to print
5027 // @flag UseCommas | This will make it print any integer using commas to separate thousands for clarity.
5028 bool ScriptPrintf(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
5029 {
5030  char buffer[1024];
5031 
5032  s_get_string_from_params(buffer, pParams, pScript);
5033 
5034  printf( buffer );
5035 
5036  return true;
5037 }
5038 
5039 /******************************************************************/
5040 /* */
5041 /* */
5042 /******************************************************************/
5043 
5044 // @script | ScriptAssert |
5045 bool ScriptScriptAssert(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
5046 {
5047  char buffer[1024];
5048 
5049  s_get_string_from_params(buffer, pParams, pScript);
5050 
5051  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0, ( "%s\nSCRIPT ASSERT: %s", pScript->GetScriptInfo(), buffer ) );
5052 
5053  return true;
5054 }
5055 
5056 /******************************************************************/
5057 /* */
5058 /* */
5059 /******************************************************************/
5060 
5061 // @script | PrintScriptInfo |
5062 bool ScriptPrintScriptInfo(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
5063 {
5064  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
5065  printf("+++ScriptInfo+++++++++++++++++++++++++\n");
5066 
5067  // firsts prints out the associated string,
5068  // using the "printf" script function
5069  ScriptPrintf(pParams, pScript);
5070 
5071  // then it asserts
5072  printf("%s",pScript->GetScriptInfo());
5073 
5074  printf("++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++\n");
5075  #endif
5076  return true;
5077 }
5078 
5079 /******************************************************************/
5080 /* */
5081 /* */
5082 /******************************************************************/
5083 
5084 // @script | SetHackFlag | Sets special hackflag
5085 // @uparmopt 1 | integer flag (1 or 0)
5086 static bool HackFlag=false;
5087 bool ScriptSetHackFlag(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
5088 {
5089 
5090  int v=1;
5091  pParams->GetInteger(NONAME,&v);
5092  HackFlag=v?true:false;
5093 
5094  return true;
5095 }
5096 
5097 /******************************************************************/
5098 /* */
5099 /* */
5100 /******************************************************************/
5101 
5102 // @script | HackFlagIsSet | Returns current value of hackflag
5103 bool ScriptHackFlagIsSet(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
5104 {
5105 
5106  return HackFlag;
5107 }
5108 
5109 /******************************************************************/
5110 /* */
5111 /* */
5112 /******************************************************************/
5113 
5114 // @script | PreloadModel | Preloads model
5115 // Example: PreloadModel name="ModelName" or name="levels/skateshop/thps4board_01/thps4board_01.mdl"
5116 // @parm string | name | The model name
5117 bool ScriptPreloadModel(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
5118 {
5119  const char* pModelName;
5120  pParams->GetText( "name", &pModelName, Script::ASSERT );
5121 
5122  // now preload any programmatically-loaded peds
5123  Nx::CModel* pDummy = Nx::CEngine::sInitModel();
5124  Dbg_Assert( pDummy );
5125 
5126  bool forceTexDictLookup = pParams->ContainsFlag( CRCD(0x6c37fdc7,"AllowReplaceTex") );
5127 
5128  Str::String fullModelName;
5129  fullModelName = Gfx::GetModelFileName(pModelName, ".mdl");
5130  pDummy->AddGeom( fullModelName.getString(), 0, true, 0, forceTexDictLookup );
5131 
5132  Nx::CEngine::sUninitModel( pDummy );
5133 
5134  return true;
5135 }
5136 
5137 /******************************************************************/
5138 /* */
5139 /* */
5140 /******************************************************************/
5141 
5142 /*
5143 // @script | LoadLevelGeometry | Loads a bsp file. Assumes the current
5144 // directory is \skate3\data, so a valid string would be "levels\aus\aus.bsp".
5145 // Can also have an optional "Sky="xxx.bsp" parameter for loading the
5146 // sky dome with a level file. The Level and Sky parameters are optional,
5147 // but you must have at least one of them (So you can load just a sky,
5148 // or just a level, if you want).
5149 // @parmopt string | Sky | | .bsp file for sky dome
5150 // @parmopt string | Level | | .bsp file for level
5151 // @parmopt string | Pre_set | | load assets from PRE file
5152 bool ScriptLoadLevelGeometry(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
5153 {
5154 
5155  File::PreMgr * pre_mgr = File::PreMgr::Instance();
5156 
5157  const char* p_level = NULL;
5158  const char* p_sky = NULL;
5159 
5160  pParams->GetText( "Level",&p_level );
5161  pParams->GetText( "Sky", &p_sky );
5162 
5163  Nx::CTexDict *p_tex_dict, *p_sky_tex_dict;
5164  Nx::CScene *p_scene, *p_sky_scene;
5165 
5166  if (p_sky)
5167  {
5168  p_sky_tex_dict = Nx::CTexDictManager::sLoadTextureDictionary(p_sky);
5169  Dbg_Assert(p_sky_tex_dict);
5170  p_sky_scene = Nx::CEngine::sLoadScene(p_sky, p_sky_tex_dict, false, true); // mark as sky that doesn't go in SuperSectors
5171  Dbg_Assert(p_sky_scene);
5172  }
5173 
5174  if (p_level)
5175  {
5176  //p_tex_dict = Nx::CEngine::sLoadTextures(p_level);
5177  p_tex_dict = Nx::CTexDictManager::sLoadTextureDictionary(p_level);
5178  Dbg_Assert(p_tex_dict);
5179  p_scene = Nx::CEngine::sLoadScene(p_level, p_tex_dict);
5180  Dbg_Assert(p_scene);
5181  p_scene->LoadCollision(p_level);
5182  }
5183 
5184  return true;
5185 }
5186 
5187 */
5188 
5189 /******************************************************************/
5190 /* */
5191 /* */
5192 /******************************************************************/
5193 
5194 bool ScriptUnloadAllLevelGeometry(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
5195 {
5196  Nx::CEngine::sUnloadAllScenesAndTexDicts();
5197  return true;
5198 }
5199 
5200 /******************************************************************/
5201 /* */
5202 /* */
5203 /******************************************************************/
5204 
5205 bool ScriptLoadScene(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
5206 {
5207  bool is_dictionary = pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x3d559e7d,"is_dictionary")); // piece dictionary, like the park editor
5208  bool is_sky = pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xb5bd28d8,"is_sky")); // a sky dome
5209  bool is_net = pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x417149c8,"is_net")); // the _net version
5210  bool add_super_sectors = ! pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x8943dbd8,"no_supersectors")); // optionally ignore supersectors
5211 
5212  const char *p_scene_name = NULL;
5213  pParams->GetText( CRCD(0x26861025,"scene"),&p_scene_name,true );
5214  Dbg_MsgLog(("Loading Scene %s ...",p_scene_name));
5215  printf ("Loading Scene %s ...",p_scene_name);
5216 
5217 
5218  // First load the texture dictionary
5219  char texture_dict_name[128];
5220  sprintf(texture_dict_name,"levels\\%s\\%s%s.tex",p_scene_name,p_scene_name,is_net?"_net":"");
5221 
5222 
5223 
5224  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
5225  const char *p_fallback = "nj_sky";
5226  // Some debug code to load the NJ sky if default_sky does not exists
5227  if (stricmp(texture_dict_name,"levels\\default_sky\\default_sky.tex")==0)
5228  {
5229  printf ("TRYING TO LAOD DEFUALT SKY\n");
5230  printf ("TRYING TO LAOD DEFUALT SKY\n");
5231  printf ("TRYING TO LAOD DEFUALT SKY\n");
5232  printf ("TRYING TO LAOD DEFUALT SKY\n");
5233  // it's the default sky, so check if it exists
5234  if (!File::Exist(texture_dict_name))
5235  {
5236  printf ("NO EXIST\n");
5237 
5238  p_scene_name = p_fallback;
5239  sprintf(texture_dict_name,"levels\\%s\\%s.tex",p_scene_name,p_scene_name);
5240  }
5241  }
5242  #endif
5243 
5244 
5245  Nx::CTexDict * p_tex_dict = Nx::CTexDictManager::sLoadTextureDictionary(texture_dict_name,true);
5246  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_tex_dict,("ERROR loading tex dict for %s\n",texture_dict_name));
5247 
5248  // a level ending in _sky is automatically a sky dome
5249  if (Str::StrStr(p_scene_name,"_sky"))
5250  {
5251  is_sky = true;
5252  }
5253 
5254  // Skys always have no supersectors
5255  if (is_sky)
5256  {
5257  add_super_sectors = false;
5258  }
5259 
5260  // and dictionaries always have no supersectors
5261  if (is_dictionary)
5262  {
5263  add_super_sectors = false;
5264  }
5265 
5266  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
5267  Nx::CScene * p_scene =
5268  #endif
5269  Nx::CEngine::sLoadScene(p_scene_name, p_tex_dict, add_super_sectors,is_sky,is_dictionary,is_net); // mark as sky that doesn't go in SuperSectors
5270  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_scene,("ERROR loading scene for %s\n",p_scene_name));
5271  printf ("... done\n");
5272  return true;
5273 }
5274 
5275 /******************************************************************/
5276 /* */
5277 /* */
5278 /******************************************************************/
5279 
5280 bool ScriptAddScene(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
5281 {
5282  const char *p_scene_name = NULL;
5283  const char *p_add_name = NULL;
5284  pParams->GetText( "scene",&p_scene_name );
5285  pParams->GetText( "add",&p_add_name );
5286  if (p_scene_name && p_add_name)
5287  {
5288  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PushContext(Mem::Manager::sHandle().DebugHeap());
5289 
5290  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
5291  Nx::CScene * p_scene =
5292  #endif
5293  Nx::CEngine::sAddScene(p_scene_name, p_add_name);
5294  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_scene,("ERROR adding scene for %s\n",p_scene_name));
5295 
5296  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PopContext();
5297  }
5298 
5299  return true;
5300 }
5301 
5302 /******************************************************************/
5303 /* */
5304 /* */
5305 /******************************************************************/
5306 
5307 // we have a seperate script command for loading collision
5308 // so we can control the loading of pre files
5309 bool ScriptLoadCollision(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
5310 {
5311 
5312  const char *p_scene_name = NULL;
5313  pParams->GetText( "scene",&p_scene_name );
5314  bool is_net = pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x417149c8,"is_net")); // the _net version
5315  if (p_scene_name)
5316  {
5317  Nx::CScene * p_scene = Nx::CEngine::sGetScene(p_scene_name);
5318  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_scene,("Trying to load collision for scene: %s\n",p_scene_name));
5319  Dbg_MsgLog(("Trying to load collision for scene: %s\n",p_scene_name));
5320  p_scene->LoadCollision(p_scene_name, is_net);
5321  }
5322  return true;
5323 
5324 }
5325 
5326 /******************************************************************/
5327 /* */
5328 /* */
5329 /******************************************************************/
5330 
5331 bool ScriptAddCollision(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
5332 {
5333  const char *p_scene_name = NULL;
5334  const char *p_add_name = NULL;
5335  pParams->GetText( "scene",&p_scene_name );
5336  pParams->GetText( "add",&p_add_name );
5337  if (p_scene_name && p_add_name)
5338  {
5339  Nx::CScene * p_scene = Nx::CEngine::sGetScene(p_scene_name);
5340  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_scene,("Trying to add collision file %s to scene: %s\n", p_add_name, p_scene_name));
5341  p_scene->AddCollision(p_add_name);
5342  }
5343  return true;
5344 
5345 }
5346 
5347 /******************************************************************/
5348 /* */
5349 /* */
5350 /******************************************************************/
5351 
5352 bool ScriptUnloadScene(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
5353 {
5354  const char *p_scene_name = NULL;
5355  bool matching_names;
5356  pParams->GetText( "scene",&p_scene_name );
5357 
5358  matching_names = false;
5359  if (p_scene_name)
5360  {
5361  Nx::CScene *p_scene = Nx::CEngine::sGetScene(p_scene_name);
5362  if (p_scene)
5363  {
5364  matching_names = true;
5365  }
5366  else
5367  {
5368  p_scene = Nx::CEngine::sGetMainScene();
5369  }
5370 
5371  if (p_scene)
5372  {
5373  Nx::CTexDict *p_tex_dict = p_scene->GetTexDict();
5374 
5375  Nx::CEngine::sUnloadScene(p_scene);
5376  // must unload dictionary after scene
5377  if (p_tex_dict)
5378  {
5379  Nx::CTexDictManager::sUnloadTextureDictionary(p_tex_dict);
5380  }
5381  }
5382  }
5383 
5384  return matching_names;
5385 }
5386 
5387 /******************************************************************/
5388 /* */
5389 /* */
5390 /******************************************************************/
5391 
5392 bool ScriptQuickReload(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
5393 {
5394  const char *p_scene_name = NULL;
5395  pParams->GetText( "scene",&p_scene_name );
5396  if (p_scene_name)
5397  {
5398  Nx::CEngine::sQuickReloadGeometry(p_scene_name);
5399  }
5400  return true;
5401 }
5402 
5403 /******************************************************************/
5404 /* */
5405 /* */
5406 /******************************************************************/
5407 
5408 bool ScriptCreateFromNode( Script::CStruct *pNode )
5409 {
5410 // Dbg_MsgLog(("CreateFromNodeIndex nodeIndex=%d",nodeIndex));
5411 
5412  Mdl::Skate* skate_mod = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
5413  Obj::CRailManager *p_rail_man = skate_mod->GetRailManager();
5414  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_rail_man,("Missing rail manager"));
5415 
5416 // Script::CArray *pNodeArray = Script::GetArray( CRCD(0xc472ecc5,"NodeArray") );
5417 // Dbg_MsgAssert( pNodeArray,( "No NodeArray found" ));
5418 
5419  // We still need the node index for some things (rails, proxim)
5420  // nut now we get it from the node
5421  int nodeIndex = 0;
5422  pNode->GetInteger(CRCD(0xe50d6573,"NodeIndex"), &nodeIndex);
5423 
5424 // Script::CStruct *pNode=pNodeArray->GetStructure( nodeIndex );
5425  Dbg_MsgAssert( pNode,( "NULL pNode" ));
5426 
5427  // If this is a net game, don't load objects that were meant to be left out for
5428  // performance/bandwidth/gameplay reasons
5429  if ( skate_mod->ShouldBeAbsentNode( pNode ) )
5430  {
5431  return true;
5432  }
5433 
5434 #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
5435  Mem::Allocator* pCurrentHeapContext = Mem::Manager::sHandle().GetContextAllocator();
5436  if ( !( pCurrentHeapContext == Mem::Manager::sHandle().CutsceneBottomUpHeap()
5437  || pCurrentHeapContext == Mem::Manager::sHandle().BottomUpHeap() ) )
5438  {
5439  // GJ: this function used to push the bottom up heap context explicitly,
5440  // but it was causing problems with the cutscene code, which
5441  // wants to put stuff on the cutscene heap. however, there's
5442  // no reason to push the bottom up heap, since the bottom up heap
5443  // was always the default context anyway... i think.
5444  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0, ( "Was expecting bottomupheap context" ) );
5445  }
5446 #endif
5447 
5448  /*
5449  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PushContext(Mem::Manager::sHandle().BottomUpHeap());
5450  */
5451 
5452  uint32 ClassChecksum = 0;
5453  pNode->GetChecksum( 0x12b4e660 /*"Class"*/, &ClassChecksum );
5454 
5455  // check for obsolete trigger objects first
5456  if ( ClassChecksum == 0xe594f0a2 ) // trigger
5457  {
5458  uint32 checksumName = 0;
5459  if ( pNode->GetChecksum( 0xa1dc81f9, &checksumName ) ) // checksum 'name'
5460  {
5461 #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
5462  printf("WARNING: Trigger objects are obsolete %s\n", Script::FindChecksumName(checksumName) );
5463 #endif
5464  }
5465  }
5466 
5467  bool success = true;
5468 
5469  switch (ClassChecksum)
5470  {
5471  case 0xe47f1b79: //vehicle
5472  Dbg_MsgLog(("Vehicle"));
5473  Mem::PushMemProfile("Vehicles");
5474  Obj::CreateCar( skate_mod->GetObjectManager(), pNode );
5475  Mem::PopMemProfile();
5476  break;
5477 
5478  case 0xa0dfac98: //pedestrian
5479  case 0x061a741e: //ped
5480  {
5481  Dbg_MsgLog(("Pedestrian"));
5482  Mem::PushMemProfile("Pedestrians");
5483  Obj::CreatePed( skate_mod->GetObjectManager(), pNode );
5484  Mem::PopMemProfile();
5485  }
5486  break;
5487 
5488  case 0xef59c100: //gameobject
5489  {
5490  Dbg_MsgLog(("gameobject"));
5491  Mem::PushMemProfile("Game Objects");
5492  Obj::CreateGameObj( skate_mod->GetObjectManager(), pNode );
5493  Mem::PopMemProfile();
5494  }
5495  break;
5496 
5497  case 0x19b1e241: // ParticleEmitter
5498  {
5499  Dbg_MsgLog(("ParticleEmitter"));
5500  Mem::PushMemProfile("Particle Systems");
5501  Obj::CreateParticleEmitter( skate_mod->GetObjectManager(), pNode );
5502  Mem::PopMemProfile();
5503  }
5504  break;
5505  case 0x9e7d469e: // ParticleObject
5506  {
5507  Dbg_MsgLog(("ParticleObject"));
5508  Mem::PushMemProfile("Particle Systems");
5509  Obj::CreateParticleObject( skate_mod->GetObjectManager(), pNode );
5510  Mem::PopMemProfile();
5511  }
5512  break;
5513 
5514  case 0xb7b3bd86: // LevelObject
5515  {
5516  Dbg_MsgLog(("LevelObject"));
5517  // create a level object here
5518  Mem::PushMemProfile("LevelObjects");
5519  Obj::CreateLevelObj( skate_mod->GetObjectManager(), pNode );
5520  Mem::PopMemProfile();
5521  // Note, we used to turn off the original sector here
5522  // this is now done to all LevelObjects in ParseNodeArray
5523  }
5524  break;
5525 
5526 // case 0xe594f0a2: // Trigger (geometry containing triggers...)
5527  case 0xbf4d3536: // LevelGeometry
5528  {
5529  Dbg_MsgLog(("LevelGeometry"));
5530  uint32 checksumName = 0;
5531  if ( pNode->GetChecksum( 0xa1dc81f9, &checksumName ) ) // checksum 'name'
5532  {
5533 // Nx::CSector *p_sector = Nx::CEngine::sGetSector(checksumName);
5534  // We only want to get sectors from the main scene, as that is what the node array applies to
5535  Nx::CScene * p_main_scene = Nx::CEngine::sGetMainScene();
5536  Nx::CSector *p_sector = p_main_scene->GetSector(checksumName);
5537  if (p_sector)
5538  {
5539  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_sector,("sGetSector(0x%x) returned NULL (%s)",checksumName,Script::FindChecksumName(checksumName)));
5540  p_sector->SetVisibility(0xffffffff);
5541  p_sector->SetActive(true);
5542  p_sector->SetCollidable(true);
5543 
5544  // If this node is an occluder, let the occlusion code know that this occluder is now enabled.
5545  if( pNode->ContainsFlag( 0x4e549fe1 /*"Occluder"*/ ))
5546  {
5547  Nx::CEngine::sEnableOcclusionPoly( checksumName, true );
5548  }
5549  }
5550  else
5551  {
5552  printf(" WARNING: sGetSector(0x%x) returned NULL (%s)\n",checksumName,Script::FindChecksumName(checksumName));
5553  }
5554  //Bsp::ClearWorldSectorFlag( checksumName, mSD_KILLED | mSD_NON_COLLIDABLE | mSD_INVISIBLE | mSD_INVISIBLE2);
5555  }
5556  break;
5557  }
5558 
5559  case 0x8e6b02ad: // railnode
5560  Dbg_MsgLog(("railnode"));
5561  p_rail_man->SetActive( nodeIndex, true, pNode->ContainsFlag( "FLAG_WHOLE_RAIL" ) );
5562  break;
5563  case CRCC(0x30c19600, "ClimbingNode"):
5564  Dbg_MsgLog(("climbingnode"));
5565  p_rail_man->SetActive( nodeIndex, true, pNode->ContainsFlag( "FLAG_WHOLE_RAIL" ) );
5566  break;
5567  case 0x8470f2e: // proximnode
5568  Dbg_MsgLog(("proximnode"));
5569  Obj::Proxim_SetActive( nodeIndex, true );
5570  break;
5571  case 0xd64dc7c2: // emitterobject
5572  Dbg_MsgLog(("emitterobject"));
5573  Obj::CEmitterManager::sSetEmitterActive( nodeIndex, true );
5574  break;
5575  default:
5576  Dbg_MsgLog(("default"));
5577  success = false;
5578  break;
5579  }
5580 // Mem::Manager::sHandle().PopContext();
5581  return success;
5582 }
5583 
5584 
5585 bool ScriptCreateFromNodeIndex( int nodeIndex )
5586 {
5587  return ScriptCreateFromNode(SkateScript::GetNode(nodeIndex));
5588 }
5589 
5590 
5591 struct MaybeKillObjectInfo
5592 {
5593  uint32 nodeNum;
5594  Obj::CObject *forbiddenObject;
5595 };
5596 
5597 /******************************************************************/
5598 /* */
5599 /* */
5600 /******************************************************************/
5601 
5602 static void MaybeKillObject( Obj::CObject *pOb, void *pVoidData )
5603 {
5604 
5605  Dbg_MsgAssert(pOb,("NULL pOb"));
5606  Dbg_MsgAssert(pVoidData,("NULL pVoidData"));
5607 
5608  MaybeKillObjectInfo *pInfo;
5609  pInfo = ( MaybeKillObjectInfo * )pVoidData;
5610 
5611  uint32 nodeNum = pInfo->nodeNum;
5612  uint32 nodeName = SkateScript::GetNodeNameChecksum(nodeNum);
5613 
5614  if ( pOb->GetID() == nodeName )
5615  {
5616  Dbg_MsgAssert( pOb != pInfo->forbiddenObject,( "Can't issue a kill command from within the script of the object you're killing: Use Die command." ));
5617  pOb->DestroyIfUnlocked( );
5618 // pOb->MarkAsDead();
5619  }
5620 }
5621 
5622 /******************************************************************/
5623 /* */
5624 /* */
5625 /******************************************************************/
5626 
5627 bool ScriptKillFromNodeIndex( int nodeIndex, Script::CScript *pScript )
5628 {
5629  Mdl::Skate * skate_mod = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
5630 
5631  Obj::CRailManager *p_rail_man = skate_mod->GetRailManager();
5632  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_rail_man,("Missing rail manager"));
5633 
5634  Script::CArray *pNodeArray = Script::GetArray( CRCD(0xc472ecc5,"NodeArray") );
5635  Dbg_MsgAssert( pNodeArray,( "No NodeArray found" ));
5636 
5637  Script::CStruct *pNode=pNodeArray->GetStructure( nodeIndex );
5638  Dbg_MsgAssert( pNode,( "NULL pNode" ));
5639 
5640  uint32 ClassChecksum = 0;
5641  pNode->GetChecksum( 0x12b4e660 /*"Class"*/, &ClassChecksum );
5642 
5643 
5644 
5645  switch (ClassChecksum)
5646  {
5647  case 0xe47f1b79: // vechicle
5648  case 0xa0dfac98: // pedestrian
5649  case 0x061a741e: // ped
5650  case 0xef59c100: // gameobject
5651  case 0x19b1e241: // ParticleEmitter
5652  case 0x9e7d469e: // ParticleObject
5653  case 0xb7b3bd86: // LevelObject
5654  case 0x5b8ab877: // skater
5655  {
5656  MaybeKillObjectInfo info;
5657  info.forbiddenObject = pScript->mpObject;
5658  info.nodeNum = nodeIndex;
5659 
5660  skate_mod->GetObjectManager()->ProcessAllObjects( MaybeKillObject, &info );
5661  break;
5662  }
5663 
5664  case CRCC(0x30c19600, "ClimbingNode"):
5665  p_rail_man->SetActive( nodeIndex, false, pNode->ContainsFlag( "FLAG_WHOLE_RAIL" ) );
5666  break;
5667 
5668  case 0x8e6b02ad: // railnode
5669  p_rail_man->SetActive( nodeIndex, false, pNode->ContainsFlag( "FLAG_WHOLE_RAIL" ) );
5670  break;
5671 
5672  case 0x8470f2e: // proximnode
5673  Obj::Proxim_SetActive( nodeIndex, false );
5674  break;
5675 
5676  case 0xd64dc7c2: // emitterobject
5677  Obj::CEmitterManager::sSetEmitterActive( nodeIndex, false );
5678  break;
5679 
5680 // case 0xe594f0a2: // Trigger (geometry containing triggers...)
5681  case 0xbf4d3536: // LevelGeometry
5682  {
5683  uint32 checksumName = 0;
5684  if ( pNode->GetChecksum( 0xa1dc81f9, &checksumName ) ) // checksum 'name'
5685  {
5686 // Nx::CSector *p_sector = Nx::CEngine::sGetSector(checksumName);
5687  // We only want to get sectors from the main scene, as that is what the node array applies to
5688  Nx::CScene * p_main_scene = Nx::CEngine::sGetMainScene();
5689  Nx::CSector *p_sector = p_main_scene->GetSector(checksumName);
5690  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_sector,("sGetSector(0x%x) returned NULL (%s)",checksumName,Script::FindChecksumName(checksumName)));
5691  p_sector->SetActive(false);
5692  //Bsp::SetWorldSectorFlag( checksumName, mSD_KILLED );
5693 
5694  // If this node is an occluder, let the occlusion code know that this occluder is no longer enabled.
5695  if( pNode->ContainsFlag( 0x4e549fe1 /*"Occluder"*/ ))
5696  {
5697  Dbg_MsgAssert(!ScriptInSplitScreenGame(NULL, NULL),
5698  ("Can't turn occlusion polys on or off during a 2 player game"));
5699  Nx::CEngine::sEnableOcclusionPoly( checksumName, false );
5700  }
5701  }
5702  break;
5703  }
5704 
5705  default:
5706  return ( false );
5707  break;
5708  }
5709  return ( true );
5710 }
5711 
5712 /******************************************************************/
5713 /* */
5714 /* */
5715 /******************************************************************/
5716 
5717 bool ScriptKillFromNodeNameChecksum( uint32 nodeNameChecksum, Script::CScript *pScript )
5718 {
5719 
5720  return ( ScriptKillFromNodeIndex( SkateScript::FindNamedNode( nodeNameChecksum ), pScript ) );
5721 }
5722 
5723 
5724 /******************************************************************/
5725 /* */
5726 /* */
5727 /******************************************************************/
5728 
5729 bool DoNodeActionFromNodeNum( int nodeNum, int action, Script::CScript *pScript, Script::CStruct *pParams )
5730 {
5731  GameNet::Manager * gamenet_man = GameNet::Manager::Instance();
5732  Mdl::Skate * skate_mod = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
5733 
5734 // In net games, check if the node is flagged to be absent
5735 // and just ignore the command it fo
5736  if( gamenet_man->InNetMode())
5737  {
5738  // Rather inefficient. We should get away from refering to nodes by index
5739  if (skate_mod->ShouldBeAbsentNode( SkateScript::GetNode(nodeNum) ) )
5740  {
5741  // just ignore the action
5742  return false;
5743  }
5744  }
5745 
5746  // note rather dodgy way of determining the viewport of a script
5747  // if it has an object, and tht object is the second skater,
5748  // and we have two viewports
5749  // use viewport 1, otherwise default to viewport 0
5750  int viewport_number = 0;
5751  if (pScript->mpObject && !gamenet_man->InNetGame() && Nx::CViewportManager::sGetNumActiveViewports() == 2)
5752  {
5753  Obj::CSkater *pSkater = skate_mod->GetSkater(1);
5754  if (pScript->mpObject == pSkater )
5755  {
5756  viewport_number = 1;
5757  }
5758  }
5759 
5760 
5761  switch ( action )
5762  {
5763  case ( NODE_ACTION_CREATE ):
5764  return ( ScriptCreateFromNodeIndex( nodeNum ) );
5765  case ( NODE_ACTION_KILL ):
5766  return ( ScriptKillFromNodeIndex( nodeNum, pScript ) );
5767  case ( NODE_ACTION_SET_VISIBLE ):
5768  return ( ScriptSetVisibilityFromNodeIndex( nodeNum, false, viewport_number ) );
5769  case ( NODE_ACTION_SET_INVISIBLE ):
5770  return ( ScriptSetVisibilityFromNodeIndex( nodeNum, true, viewport_number ) );
5771  case ( NODE_ACTION_SET_COLOR ):
5772  return ( ScriptSetColorFromNodeIndex( nodeNum, pParams ) );
5773  case NODE_ACTION_SHATTER:
5774  {
5775  ScriptSetVisibilityFromNodeIndex( nodeNum, false, viewport_number );
5776  return ScriptShatterFromNodeIndex( nodeNum );
5777  }
5778  case NODE_ACTION_CHECK_IF_ALIVE:
5779  {
5780  return ( ScriptCheckExistenceFromNodeIndex( nodeNum ) );
5781  }
5782  default:
5783  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0,( "Fire Matt." ));
5784  return ( false );
5785  break;
5786  }
5787 }
5788 
5789 /******************************************************************/
5790 /* */
5791 /* */
5792 /******************************************************************/
5793 
5794 // Used to perform actions to nodes by prefix, name checksum, or links... General version
5795 // (applicable to nodes that create Environmental Objects, Rails, and all types of CMovingObjects.
5796 bool DoNodeAction( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript, int action )
5797 {
5798 
5799  uint32 nameChecksum;
5800  uint32 prefixChecksum;
5801  //const char *pPrefix;
5802  int i;
5803  bool useCurrentLinks = false;
5804  if ( pParams->ContainsFlag( 0x2e7d5ee7 ) || // checksum 'links'
5805  ( useCurrentLinks = pParams->ContainsFlag( 0xbceb479a ) ) ) // checksum 'currentlinks'
5806  {
5807  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("%s: DoNodeAction with links or currentlinks is deprecated",pScript->GetScriptInfo()));
5808 
5809  /*
5810  int numLinks;
5811  Script::CStruct *pNode = NULL;
5812  if ( pParams->GetChecksumOrStringChecksum( 0xa1dc81f9, &nameChecksum ) ) // checksum 'name'
5813  {
5814  if ( useCurrentLinks )
5815  {
5816  Dbg_Message( "\n%s\nWarning: The 'currentLinks' flag only works in an object script on the calling object.", pScript->GetScriptInfo( ) );
5817  }
5818  pNode = SkateScript::GetNode( SkateScript::FindNamedNode( nameChecksum ) );
5819  Dbg_MsgAssert( pNode,( "\n%s\nNo node named %s found", pScript->GetScriptInfo( ), Script::FindChecksumName( nameChecksum ) ));
5820  }
5821  else
5822  {
5823  if ( pScript->mNode != -1 )
5824  {
5825  pNode = SkateScript::GetNode( pScript->mNode );
5826  Dbg_MsgAssert( pNode,( "\n%s\nnode %d not found", pScript->GetScriptInfo( ), pScript->mNode ));
5827  }
5828  else
5829  {
5830  if ( pScript->mpObject )
5831  {
5832  if ( useCurrentLinks )
5833  {
5834  pNode = SkateScript::GetNode( ((Obj::CMovingObject *) pScript->mpObject.Convert())->m_current_node );
5835  Dbg_MsgAssert( pNode,( "\n%s\n object's node %d is invalid", pScript->GetScriptInfo( ), ((Obj::CMovingObject *) pScript->mpObject.Convert())->m_start_node ));
5836  }
5837  else
5838  {
5839  pNode = SkateScript::GetNode( ((Obj::CMovingObject *) pScript->mpObject.Convert())->m_start_node );
5840  Dbg_MsgAssert( pNode,( "\n%s\n object's node %d is invalid", pScript->GetScriptInfo( ), ((Obj::CMovingObject *) pScript->mpObject.Convert())->m_start_node ));
5841  }
5842  }
5843  else
5844  {
5845  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0,( "\n%s\nNo valid nodes to be found anywherest, dumass.", pScript->GetScriptInfo( ) ));
5846  return ( false );
5847  }
5848  }
5849  }
5850  Dbg_MsgAssert( pNode,( "What the fuck? How did this motherfuckin' happen?" ));
5851  numLinks = SkateScript::GetNumLinks( pNode );
5852  for ( i = 0; i < numLinks; i++ )
5853  {
5854  if ( DoNodeActionFromNodeNum( SkateScript::GetLink( pNode, i ), action, pScript ) )
5855  {
5856  if ( action == NODE_ACTION_CHECK_IF_ALIVE )
5857  {
5858  return ( true );
5859  }
5860  }
5861  }
5862  */
5863 
5864  return ( true );
5865  }
5866  //if ( pParams->GetText( 0x6c4e7971, &pPrefix ) ) // checksum 'prefix'
5867  if ( pParams->GetChecksumOrStringChecksum( 0x6c4e7971, &prefixChecksum ) ) // checksum 'prefix'
5868  {
5869  // Create with a prefix specified:
5870  uint16 numNodes = 0;
5871  // const uint16 *pMatchingNodes = SkateScript::GetPrefixedNodes( pPrefix, &numNodes );
5872  const uint16 *pMatchingNodes = SkateScript::GetPrefixedNodes( prefixChecksum, &numNodes );
5873  for ( i = 0; i < numNodes; i++ )
5874  {
5875  if ( DoNodeActionFromNodeNum( pMatchingNodes[ i ], action, pScript, pParams ) )
5876  {
5877  if ( action == NODE_ACTION_CHECK_IF_ALIVE )
5878  {
5879  return ( true );
5880  }
5881  }
5882  }
5883  return ( true );
5884  }
5885  if ( pParams->GetChecksumOrStringChecksum( 0xa1dc81f9, &nameChecksum ) ) // checksum 'name'
5886  {
5887  // Create with a name specified:
5888  return ( DoNodeActionFromNodeNum( SkateScript::FindNamedNode( nameChecksum ), action, pScript, pParams ) );
5889  }
5890 
5891  // if they're calling "Invisible" with no parameters, intending to turn
5892  // visibility off on an object from within the object's script, they should
5893  // be calling "Obj_Invisible" (or Obj_Visible, or Die, create not applicable
5894  // since the object would have to have already been created to be calling
5895  // something.)
5896  Dbg_Message( "\n%s\nSyntax not recognized... object script may need to call Obj_ version. (Ask Matt).", pScript->GetScriptInfo( ) );
5897  return ( false );
5898 }
5899 
5900 /******************************************************************/
5901 /* */
5902 /* */
5903 /******************************************************************/
5904 
5905 bool ScriptNodeExists( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
5906 {
5907  uint32 node_checksum=0;
5908  pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME,&node_checksum,true);
5909 
5910  return SkateScript::NodeExists(node_checksum);
5911 }
5912 
5913 /******************************************************************/
5914 /* */
5915 /* */
5916 /******************************************************************/
5917 
5918 bool ScriptCreateFromStructure( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
5919 {
5920  return ScriptCreateFromNode( pParams );
5921 }
5922 
5923 /******************************************************************/
5924 /* */
5925 /* */
5926 /******************************************************************/
5927 
5928 // @script | Create | creates an object node
5929 // @flag links | pass in to perform action to nodes by links
5930 // @flag currentlinks | pass in to perform action to nodes by links
5931 // @parmopt name | name | | The name of the node
5932 // @parmopt name | prefix | | Create with a prefix specified
5933 bool ScriptCreate( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
5934 {
5935 
5936  #ifdef __PLAT_NGPS__
5937 // snProfSetRange( -1, (void*)0, (void*)-1);
5938 // snProfSetFlagValue(0x01);
5939  #endif
5940 
5941 
5942  // Flush dead objects before we create any new ones
5943  ScriptFlushDeadObjects(NULL,NULL);
5944 
5945  bool result = ( DoNodeAction( pParams, pScript, NODE_ACTION_CREATE ) );
5946 
5947  #ifdef __PLAT_NGPS__
5948 // snProfSetRange( 4, (void*)NULL, (void*)-1);
5949  #endif
5950 
5951  return result;
5952 
5953 }
5954 
5955 /******************************************************************/
5956 /* */
5957 /* */
5958 /******************************************************************/
5959 
5960 // @script | SetObjectColor | color the object a particular color
5961 // @parm name | name | The name of the piece of level geometry to change color
5962 // @parm int | color | The color to set the object to (as a hexadecimal ABGR value)
5963 bool ScriptSetObjectColor( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
5964 {
5965 
5966  bool result = ( DoNodeAction( pParams, pScript, NODE_ACTION_SET_COLOR ) );
5967 
5968  return result;
5969 }
5970 
5971 
5972 /******************************************************************/
5973 /* */
5974 /* */
5975 /******************************************************************/
5976 
5977 // @script | Kill | kills an object node
5978 // @flag links | pass in to perform action to nodes by links
5979 // @flag currentlinks | pass in to perform action to nodes by links
5980 // @parmopt name | name | | The name of the node
5981 // @parmopt name | prefix | | kill with a prefix specified
5982 bool ScriptKill( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
5983 {
5984 
5985  return ( DoNodeAction( pParams, pScript, NODE_ACTION_KILL ) );
5986 }
5987 
5988 /******************************************************************/
5989 /* */
5990 /* */
5991 /******************************************************************/
5992 
5993 // @script | Visible | make object visible
5994 // @flag links | pass in to perform action to nodes by links
5995 // @flag currentlinks | pass in to perform action to nodes by links
5996 // @parmopt name | name | | The name of the node
5997 // @parmopt name | prefix | | act on objects with specified prefix
5998 bool ScriptVisible( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
5999 {
6000  return ( DoNodeAction( pParams, pScript, NODE_ACTION_SET_VISIBLE ) );
6001 }
6002 
6003 /******************************************************************/
6004 /* */
6005 /* */
6006 /******************************************************************/
6007 
6008 // @script | Invisible | make object invisible
6009 // @flag links | pass in to perform action to nodes by links
6010 // @flag currentlinks | pass in to perform action to nodes by links
6011 // @parmopt name | name | | The name of the node
6012 // @parmopt name | prefix | | act on objects with specified prefix
6013 bool ScriptInvisible( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
6014 {
6015  return ( DoNodeAction( pParams, pScript, NODE_ACTION_SET_INVISIBLE ) );
6016 }
6017 
6018 /******************************************************************/
6019 /* */
6020 /* */
6021 /******************************************************************/
6022 
6023 // @script | Shatter | Shatter an object
6024 // @parmopt float | area | 288.0 | the subdivision area above which
6025 // polys will be recursively subdivided. Be careful with this
6026 // parameter - making it too small will cause the buffer to
6027 // overflow and assert. The units are square inches <nl>
6028 // The default value may change
6029 // @parmopt float | variance | 0.0 | the amount the velocity
6030 // of each shard can be (randomly) above the supplied velocity.
6031 // So a value of 1.0 would mean a shard could travel at twice the supplied <nl>
6032 // velocity <nl> The default value may change.
6033 // @parmopt float | spread | 1.0 | determines the degree to which the
6034 // shards will fly apart. The way I figure this is to take the center
6035 // of the bounding box for the object, and then move backwards (spread
6036 // * velocity). This position is then used to figure the start velocity
6037 // for each shard. So the lower the spread value, the less the start
6038 // point moves back, and the more the shards will fly apart. (I can
6039 // draw a diagram if this isn't clear). <nl>
6040 // The default value may change
6041 // @parmopt float | life | 4.0 | how long the shatter atomic will exist for
6042 // (seconds) <nl> The default value may change
6043 // @parmopt | bounce | -10,000 | Default value may change
6044 // @parmopt | scale | 1.0 | Scaling factor for the shards
6045 // @flag use_skater_vel | Use skater velocity to determine
6046 // if object should shatter
6047 // @parm | vel_x | default velocity of shard on x-axis (in inches per second)
6048 // @parm | vel_y | default velocity of shard on y-axis (in inches per second)
6049 // @parm | vel_z | default velocity of shard on z-axis (in inches per second)
6050 bool ScriptShatter( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
6051 {
6052  // Need to read some params from the script here.
6053  float area = 0.0f;
6054  float variance = 0.0f;
6055  float spread = 0.0f;
6056  float life = 0.0f;
6057  float bounce = 0.0f;
6058  float bounce_amp = 0.0f;
6059  float scale = 1.0f;
6060  Mth::Vector velocity;
6061 
6062  if( pParams->ContainsFlag( 0x9f98989e /*"use_skater_vel"*/ ))
6063  {
6064  pParams->GetFloat( "scale", &scale );
6065 
6066  Obj::CSkater* p_skater = static_cast <Obj::CSkater*>( pScript->mpObject.Convert() );
6067  Dbg_Assert( p_skater );
6068 
6069  velocity = p_skater->GetVel() * scale;
6070  }
6071  else
6072  {
6073  // Have to supply vel_x, y, and z.
6074  pParams->GetFloat( "vel_x", &velocity[X], true );
6075  pParams->GetFloat( "vel_y", &velocity[Y], true );
6076  pParams->GetFloat( "vel_z", &velocity[Z], true );
6077  velocity[W] = 0.0f; // To prevent assert on using unitialized vectors
6078  }
6079 
6080  pParams->GetFloat( "area", &area );
6081  pParams->GetFloat( "variance", &variance );
6082  pParams->GetFloat( "spread", &spread );
6083  pParams->GetFloat( "life", &life );
6084  pParams->GetFloat( "bounce", &bounce );
6085  pParams->GetFloat( "bounce_amp", &bounce_amp );
6086 
6088  // Mick 09/18/02: PATCH
6089  // setting the shatter area too low (generally to 1000) generates an excessive amount
6090  // of polygons in the form of immediate mode primitive, which eat up the DMA buffer on the PS2
6091  // So I'm going to limit the area to 2000 in the general case, and to 5000 in multi player games
6092  float min_area = 2000.0f; // single player limit
6093  if (Mdl::Skate::Instance()->IsMultiplayerGame())
6094  {
6095  min_area = 5000.0f;
6096  }
6097 
6098  if (area < min_area)
6099  {
6100  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
6101  printf("WARNING: area %.1f too small for THPS4 PS2 engine, clamping to %.1f\n",area,min_area);
6102  #endif
6103  area = min_area;
6104  }
6105  // END PATCH
6107 
6108  // Set up values for this shatter.
6109  Nx::ShatterSetParams( velocity, area, variance, spread, life, bounce, bounce_amp );
6110 
6111  return DoNodeAction( pParams, pScript, NODE_ACTION_SHATTER );
6112 }
6113 
6114 /******************************************************************/
6115 /* */
6116 /* */
6117 /******************************************************************/
6118 
6119 void CleanupBeforeParseNodeArray()
6120 {
6121  Mdl::Skate * skate_mod = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
6122 
6123  Obj::Proxim_Init();
6124  Obj::CEmitterManager::sInit();
6125  skate_mod->GetRailManager()->Cleanup(); // probably not needed, as will be done in ScriptCleanup
6126  skate_mod->GetTrickObjectManager()->DeleteAllTrickObjects();
6127 
6128  // Scene lights are created during the node array parse, so clear them up here ready.
6129  Nx::CLightManager::sClearSceneLights();
6130  Nx::CLightManager::sClearVCLights();
6131 }
6132 
6133 /******************************************************************/
6134 /* */
6135 /* */
6136 /******************************************************************/
6137 
6138 // @script | ParseNodeArray | Parses the loaded node array
6139 bool ScriptParseNodeArray( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
6140 {
6141  Mem::PushMemProfile("ParseNodeArray");
6142 
6143  CleanupBeforeParseNodeArray();
6144 
6145  Mdl::Skate * skate_mod = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
6146 
6147  // Scan through the node array creating all things that need to be created.
6148  Script::CArray *pNodeArray=Script::GetArray(CRCD(0xc472ecc5,"NodeArray"));
6149  Dbg_MsgAssert(pNodeArray,("No NodeArray found in ParseNodeArray"));
6150 
6151  // Rails are now added seperately
6152  Mem::PushMemProfile("Rail Nodes");
6153  Obj::CRailManager *p_rail_man = skate_mod->GetRailManager();
6154  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_rail_man,("Missing rail manager"));
6155  p_rail_man->AddRailsFromNodeArray(pNodeArray );
6156  Mem::PopMemProfile();
6157 
6158  // Nav nodes are added separately.
6159 # ifdef TESTING_GUNSLINGER
6160  Mem::PushMemProfile( "Nav Nodes" );
6161  Obj::CNavManager* p_nav_man = skate_mod->GetNavManager();
6162  Dbg_MsgAssert( p_nav_man, ( "Missing Nav Manager" ));
6163  p_nav_man->AddNavsFromNodeArray( pNodeArray );
6164  Mem::PopMemProfile();
6165 # endif
6166 
6167  // We only want to get sectors from the main scene, as that is what the node array applies to
6168  Nx::CScene * p_main_scene = Nx::CEngine::sGetMainScene();
6169 
6170  bool fail = false;
6171  uint32 i;
6172  for (i=0; i<pNodeArray->GetSize(); ++i)
6173  {
6174  Script::CStruct *pNode=pNodeArray->GetStructure(i);
6175  Dbg_MsgAssert(pNode,("NULL pNode"));
6176 
6177  uint32 ClassChecksum = 0;
6178  pNode->GetChecksum( 0x12b4e660 /*"Class"*/, &ClassChecksum );
6179 
6180 
6181  // First the nodes that need some special processing
6182  // for the "net game" state
6183  switch (ClassChecksum)
6184  {
6185  // Note - Rails are no longer added here, but in the AddRailsFromNodeArray, above
6186 
6187  case 0xb7b3bd86: // LevelObject
6188  {
6189  // A "LevelObject" is like "LevelGeometry", in that it is a 3DStudio Max object
6190  // which is part of the scene (like, a wall or a house)
6191  // However, it's going to be movable, so it has to exist in "local" coordinate
6192  // space, centered around the origin.
6193  // When it is exported, the original geometry is just tranlated to the origin, and left there
6194  // later we will create a clone of this object, which will be be movable instance
6195  // but the original is left alone. So, we always turn off the original instance
6196  // of a LevelObject, before we create any instances. The creation is done via
6197  // ScriptCreateFromNodeIndex, either below (if createdAtStart),
6198  // or via a script command at some indeterminate time in the future.
6199  uint32 checksumName = 0;
6200  pNode->GetChecksum( 0xa1dc81f9 /*Name*/, &checksumName);
6201 // Nx::CSector *p_sector = Nx::CEngine::sGetSector(checksumName);
6202  Nx::CSector *p_sector = p_main_scene->GetSector(checksumName);
6203  if (p_sector)
6204  {
6205  p_sector->SetActive(false);
6206  }
6207 
6208 
6209  break;
6210  }
6211 
6212  case 0x8e6b02ad: // railnode
6213  {
6214  pNode->RemoveComponent(CRCD(0x9d2d0915,"angles"));
6215  pNode->RemoveComponent(CRCD(0x7321a8d6,"type")); // Type is no longer used, as "TerrainType" suffices
6216  break;
6217  }
6218 
6219  case CRCC(0x30c19600, "ClimbingNode"):
6220  {
6221  break;
6222  }
6223 
6224  case 0xbf4d3536: // LevelGeometry
6225  {
6226 
6228  // Test: if it's a level object, then remove the angles, collisionmode and position
6229  pNode->RemoveComponent(CRCD(0x2d7e583b,"collisionmode"));
6230 // pNode->RemoveComponent(CRCD(0xb9d31b0a,"position"));
6231 // pNode->RemoveComponent(CRCD(0x9d2d0915,"angles"));
6233 
6234 
6235  // first get the sector indicated by this level geometry
6236  uint32 checksumName = 0;
6237  pNode->GetChecksum( 0xa1dc81f9 /*Name*/, &checksumName);
6238  if (checksumName == 0)
6239  {
6240  Script::PrintContents(pNode);
6241  printf("FAILED BECAUSE Node %d is LevelGeometry, but has no Name=....\n",i);
6242  fail = true;
6243  }
6244  //Nx::CSector *p_sector = Nx::CEngine::sGetSector(checksumName);
6245  Nx::CSector *p_sector = p_main_scene->GetSector(checksumName);
6246 
6247  //Dbg_MsgAssert(p_sector,("sGetSector(0x%x) returned NULL (%s)",checksumName,Script::FindChecksumName(checksumName)));
6248 
6249  if (p_sector)
6250  {
6251 
6252  // The park editor takes care of it's own visibility
6253  //
6254 
6255 
6256  if (Ed::CParkEditor::Instance()->UsingCustomPark()) // is it a custom park???
6257  {
6258  if ( !( pNode->ContainsFlag( 0x7c2552b9/*"CreatedAtStart"*/ ) ) || skate_mod->ShouldBeAbsentNode( pNode ) )
6259  {
6260  // if this assertion fires, you are probably try to extend the park
6261  // editor to have some sectors be not "createdatstart"
6262  // which is not currently supported, as the park editor sets up it;s
6263  // own visibility and "active" state for things like:
6264  // - restart nodes
6265  // - the cursor
6266  // - gap pieces
6267  // so you would need to re-work it so they were correctly flagged
6268  // as no created at start, and then remove this whole "UsingCustomPark" special case
6269  // This is also done in the logic around the call to ScriptCreateFromNodeIndex, below, in this function.
6270  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("Park ed levelgeom not set created at start"));
6271  }
6272  }
6273  else
6274  {
6275  // The sector will already be active and visible, since no flags will be set...
6276  // but if we're not created at start, set the non-collide and invisible flags:
6277  if ( !( pNode->ContainsFlag( 0x7c2552b9/*"CreatedAtStart"*/ ) ) || skate_mod->ShouldBeAbsentNode( pNode )
6278  )
6279  {
6280  p_sector->SetActive(false);
6281  }
6282  else
6283  {
6284  // Mick: as ParseNodeArray can get called multiple times
6285  // on the same node array
6286  // we need to clear any KILLED and INVIVIBLE flags
6287  // that might have been set in the previous session
6288  p_sector->SetVisibility(0xffffffff);
6289  p_sector->SetActive(true);
6290  p_sector->SetCollidable(true);
6291  }
6292  }
6293 
6294  // If it's an occluder, then we need to flag it as such
6295  if ( pNode->ContainsFlag( 0x4e549fe1/*"Occluder"*/ ) )
6296  {
6297 // printf ("Occluding node %d, <%s>\n",i,Script::FindChecksumName(checksumName));
6298  // This object is an occluder
6299  // so need to flag it as so
6300  p_sector->SetOccluder(true);
6301 
6302  // For now, we make all occluders invisble, so we can see through them
6303  //printf ("WARNING: Occluders are being made invisible!!!!!!!\n");
6304  //printf ("WARNING: Occluders are being made invisible!!!!!!!\n");
6305  //printf ("WARNING: Occluders are being made invisible!!!!!!!\n");
6306  p_sector->SetActive(false);
6307 
6308  // If this occluder is not created at start, disable it.
6309  if( !pNode->ContainsFlag( 0x7c2552b9 /*"CreatedAtStart"*/ ))
6310  {
6311  Nx::CEngine::sEnableOcclusionPoly( checksumName, false );
6312  }
6313  }
6314 
6315  // Set the light group (usually will be "outdoor")
6316  uint32 light_group = CRCD(0xe3714dc1,"outdoor"); // default to OutDoors
6317  pNode->GetChecksum(CRCD(0x7e4813a7,"lightgroup"),&light_group);
6318  p_sector->SetLightGroup(light_group);
6319  }
6320  else
6321  {
6322  // Only fail in non-multiplayer games
6323  // as it's quite valid for a sector to not exist in a network game
6324  // as they are stripped out at SceneConv time
6325  if (!skate_mod->IsMultiplayerGame())
6326  {
6327  //printf("sGetSector(0x%x) returned NULL (%s)",checksumName,Script::FindChecksumName(checksumName));
6328  printf("FAILED BECAUSE: Cannot find level geometry or collision for node %d \nMaybe there are spaces in or after the name of the Max object (%s)?\nOr maybe the .QN file does not match the .SCN file checked into Perforce?\n"
6329  ,i,Script::FindChecksumName(checksumName));
6330  fail = true;
6331  }
6332  }
6333 
6334  bool is_trick_object = pNode->ContainsComponentNamed( "TrickObject" );
6335 
6336  if (!Config::CD())
6337  {
6338  bool debug_graffiti = Script::GetInt( "create_all_trick_objects", false );
6339  if ( debug_graffiti )
6340  is_trick_object = true;
6341  }
6342 
6343  // Only add trick objects is they are not flagged as absentinnetgames
6344  if ( !skate_mod->ShouldBeAbsentNode( pNode ) && is_trick_object )
6345  {
6346  Mem::PushMemProfile("Trick Object Clusters");
6347  // get the node name
6348  uint32 checksumName;
6349  pNode->GetChecksum( "name", &checksumName, true );
6350 
6351  uint32 clusterName = checksumName;
6352  pNode->GetChecksum( "Cluster", &clusterName, false );
6353  skate_mod->GetTrickObjectManager()->AddTrickCluster( clusterName );
6354 
6355  // add the environment object to this cluster
6356  skate_mod->GetTrickObjectManager()->AddTrickObjectToCluster( checksumName, clusterName );
6357  Mem::PopMemProfile();
6358  }
6359  break;
6360  }
6361  default:
6362  break;
6363  }
6364 
6365  // The following nodes are capable of being ignored in net games
6366 
6367  if ( skate_mod->ShouldBeAbsentNode( pNode ) )
6368  {
6369  // Don't load, as it's a net game
6370  }
6371  else
6372  {
6373 
6374  if (ClassChecksum == 0xbf4d3536 && Ed::CParkEditor::Instance()->UsingCustomPark()) // LevelGeometry
6375  {
6376  // Level geometry in park editor is ignored, see above.
6377  }
6378  else
6379  {
6380 
6381  if (ClassChecksum == 0x8470f2e) // checksum 'ProximNode'
6382  {
6383  Mem::PushMemProfile("Proximity Nodes");
6384  Obj::Proxim_AddNode( i, pNode->ContainsFlag( 0x7c2552b9/*"CreatedAtStart"*/ ) );
6385  Mem::PopMemProfile();
6386  }
6387 
6388  if (ClassChecksum == 0xd64dc7c2) // checksum 'EmitterObject'
6389  {
6390  Mem::PushMemProfile("Emitter Objects");
6391  Obj::CEmitterManager::sAddEmitter( i, pNode->ContainsFlag( 0x7c2552b9/*"CreatedAtStart"*/ ) );
6392  Mem::PopMemProfile();
6393  }
6394 
6395  if ( pNode->ContainsFlag( 0x7c2552b9 /*"CreatedAtStart"*/ ) )
6396  {
6397  ScriptCreateFromNodeIndex( i );
6398  }
6399  }
6400  }
6401  }
6402 
6403  Dbg_MsgAssert(!fail, ("ParseNodeArray FAILED, see above for reasons labled FAILED BECAUSE \n"));
6404 
6405  Obj::Proxim_AddedAll();
6406  p_rail_man->AddedAll();
6407  Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetGapChecklist()->FindGaps();
6408 
6409  /*
6410  // STUPID HACK
6411  Ed::ParkEditor* park_ed = Ed::ParkEditor::Instance();
6412  if (park_ed->IsInitialized() && park_ed->GameGoingOrOutsideEditor())
6413  park_ed->MakeStuffInvisibleForGameplay();
6414  */
6415 
6416 // Mick:
6417 // Level lights need to be created AFTER the node array is parsed, so that the
6418 // lightgroups are set on the level geometry
6419 // otherwise geometry nodes that occur after this one will default to "outdoor"
6420 
6421  for (i=0; i<pNodeArray->GetSize(); ++i)
6422  {
6423  Script::CStruct *pNode=pNodeArray->GetStructure(i);
6424  Dbg_MsgAssert(pNode,("NULL pNode"));
6425 
6426  uint32 ClassChecksum = 0;
6427  pNode->GetChecksum( 0x12b4e660 /*"Class"*/, &ClassChecksum );
6428 
6429 
6430  // First the nodes that need some special processing
6431  // for the "net game" state
6432  if (ClassChecksum == CRCD(0xa0e52802,"LevelLight"))
6433  {
6434  // Will need to check a parameter here to see if the light is flagged to affect objects.
6435  bool affects_objects = !pNode->ContainsFlag( CRCD( 0xe1509e4f, "ExcludeSkater" ));
6436  bool affects_geometry = !pNode->ContainsFlag( CRCD( 0x6f050e18, "ExcludeLevel" ));
6437 
6438  // Get the name checksum of this node, since this will be used as the link between the node and the Scene Light.
6439  uint32 name_checksum = SkateScript::GetNodeNameChecksum( i );
6440 
6441  Mth::Vector pos;
6442  SkateScript::GetPosition( pNode, &pos );
6443 
6444  // Default values.
6445  float intensity = 100.0f;
6446  float inner_radius = 300.0f;
6447  float outer_radius = 300.0f;
6448 
6449  pNode->GetFloat( CRCD( 0x2689291c, "Brightness" ), &intensity );
6450  pNode->GetFloat( CRCD( 0x8d2c287f, "InnerRadius" ), &inner_radius );
6451  pNode->GetFloat( CRCD( 0x833950cc, "OuterRadius" ), &outer_radius );
6452 
6453  if( !pNode->ContainsFlag( CRCD( 0x7c2552b9, "CreatedAtStart" )))
6454  {
6455  // This light is not supposed to be active at startup.
6456  }
6457 
6458  // Lights default to pure white in the absence of any color information.
6459  Image::RGBA col( 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x00 );
6460 
6461  Script::CArray *p_array;
6462  pNode->GetArray( CRCD( 0x99a9b716, "Color" ), &p_array );
6463  if( p_array )
6464  {
6465  col.r = p_array->GetInteger( 0 );
6466  col.g = p_array->GetInteger( 1 );
6467  col.b = p_array->GetInteger( 2 );
6468  }
6469 
6470  if( affects_objects )
6471  {
6472  Nx::CSceneLight *p_new_light = Nx::CLightManager::sAddSceneLight();
6473  if( p_new_light )
6474  {
6475  p_new_light->SetNameChecksum( name_checksum );
6476  p_new_light->SetLightPosition( pos );
6477 
6478  // Set the color, radius and intensity.
6479  p_new_light->SetLightIntensity( intensity * 0.01f );
6480  p_new_light->SetLightColor( col );
6481  p_new_light->SetLightRadius( outer_radius );
6482  }
6483  else
6484  {
6485  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("Too many Scene lights"));
6486  }
6487  }
6488 
6489  if( affects_geometry )
6490  {
6491  Nx::CLightManager::sAddVCLight(name_checksum,pos,intensity,col,outer_radius);
6492  }
6493  }
6494  }
6495 
6496 
6497  Mem::PopMemProfile(/*"ParseNodeArray"*/);
6498 
6499  return true;
6500 }
6501 
6502 static char LastNodeArrayLoaded[128];
6503 
6504 /******************************************************************/
6505 /* */
6506 /* */
6507 /******************************************************************/
6508 
6509 // @script | LoadNodeArray | Will load node array from the file specified
6510 // @uparm "string" | File name to load
6511 bool ScriptLoadNodeArray(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
6512 {
6513  Mem::PushMemProfile("LoadNodeArray");
6514 
6515  // Remove any spawned scripts that might have been left over from the previous level.
6516  Script::DeleteSpawnedScripts();
6517 
6518 
6519  const char *pFileName=NULL;
6520  pParams->GetText(NONAME,&pFileName);
6521  Dbg_MsgAssert(pFileName,("LoadNodeArray requires a file name."));
6522 
6523  strcpy(LastNodeArrayLoaded,pFileName);
6524 
6525  // Load the QB
6526  SkateScript::LoadQB(pFileName);
6527 
6528  // Ensure it has a node array in it
6529  Script::CArray* pNodeArray=Script::GetArray(CRCD(0xc472ecc5,"NodeArray"));
6530  Dbg_MsgAssert(pNodeArray,("No NodeArray found in %s",pFileName));
6531 
6532  for ( uint32 i = 0; i < pNodeArray->GetSize(); i++ )
6533  {
6534  Script::CStruct* pStructure = pNodeArray->GetStructure(i);
6535  pStructure->AddInteger("nodeIndex", i);
6536  }
6537 
6538  if (pParams->ContainsFlag("park_editor"))
6539  {
6540  // PARKED4:
6541  // Nothing needs doing here, we don't preload any models in the park editor
6542  }
6543  else
6544  {
6545  // not a park editor QB, parse as normal
6546 // ScriptPreloadModels( NULL, NULL );
6547  }
6548  Mem::PopMemProfile(/*"LoadNodeArray"*/);
6549 
6550  return true;
6551 }
6552 
6553 /******************************************************************/
6554 /* */
6555 /* */
6556 /******************************************************************/
6557 
6558 // @script | ReLoadNodeArray | Will reload the last node array you loaded,
6559 // without parsing it, and without deleting anything.
6560 // Note, this will load directly from the .qb, so there is NO NEED to rebuild the .pre files.
6561 // Using this command by itself could be used if you are just altering
6562 // stuff like trigger scripts. However, as it does not respawn anything,
6563 // you have the potential to mess things up. Give it a go though, you can
6564 // always just do a Select+Circle to make sure.
6565 bool ScriptReLoadNodeArray(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
6566 {
6567 
6568  // We try to use the Debug heap, as we assume we will be fragmenting memory like a jackass
6569  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PushContext(Mem::Manager::sHandle().DebugHeap());
6570 
6571  const char *pFileName=LastNodeArrayLoaded;
6572  // Load the QB
6573  SkateScript::LoadQB(pFileName);
6574 
6575  // Ensure it has a node array in it
6576  Script::CArray *pNodeArray=Script::GetArray(CRCD(0xc472ecc5,"NodeArray"));
6577 
6578  Dbg_MsgAssert(pNodeArray,("No NodeArray found in %s",pFileName));
6579 
6580  // renumber node indices
6581  for ( uint32 i = 0; i < pNodeArray->GetSize(); i++ )
6582  {
6583  Script::CStruct* pStructure = pNodeArray->GetStructure(i);
6584  pStructure->AddInteger("nodeIndex", i);
6585  }
6586 
6587  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PopContext();
6588 
6589  return true;
6590 }
6591 
6592 /******************************************************************/
6593 /* */
6594 /* */
6595 /******************************************************************/
6596 
6597 // @script | SetBackgroundColor | Sets the background color. Each component
6598 // is in the range 0-255. The alpha value currently is not used.
6599 // @parmopt int | r | 0 | Red component
6600 // @parmopt int | g | 0 | Green component
6601 // @parmopt int | b | 0 | Blue component
6602 // @parmopt int | alpha | 0 | Alpha value
6603 bool ScriptSetBackgroundColor(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
6604 {
6605 
6606  int Red=0;
6607  int Green=0;
6608  int Blue=0;
6609  int Alpha=0;
6610  pParams->GetInteger("r",&Red);
6611  pParams->GetInteger("g",&Green);
6612  pParams->GetInteger("b",&Blue);
6613  pParams->GetInteger("alpha",&Alpha);
6614 
6615 /*
6616  gfx_man->sBackgroundColor.r = Red;
6617  gfx_man->sBackgroundColor.g = Green;
6618  gfx_man->sBackgroundColor.b = Blue;
6619  gfx_man->sBackgroundColor.a = Alpha;
6620 */
6621  printf ("STUBBED ScriptSetBackgroundColor\n");
6622  return true;
6623 }
6624 
6625 /******************************************************************/
6626 /* */
6627 /* */
6628 /******************************************************************/
6629 
6630 // @script | SetBSPAmbientColor | Sets the ambient color for the BSP
6631 // (The environment, or the non-moving objects).
6632 // NOTE: This should be set to 0,0,0, as any other setting will result
6633 // in much slowdown. However, you can set it temporarily if you
6634 // want to try out effects quickly.
6635 // @parmopt int | r | 0 | Red component
6636 // @parmopt int | g | 0 | Green component
6637 // @parmopt int | b | 0 | Blue component
6638 // @parmopt int | alpha | 0 | Alpha value
6639 bool ScriptSetBSPAmbientColor(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
6640 {
6641  Dbg_Message( "SetBSPAmbientColor is obsolete" );
6642 
6643  return true;
6644 }

6647 /* */
6648 /* */
6649 /******************************************************************/
6650

6652 // (The skater, cars and suchlike.).
6653 // @parmopt int | r | 0 | Red component
6654 // @parmopt int | g | 0 | Green component
6655 // @parmopt int | b | 0 | Blue component
6656 // @parmopt int | alpha | 0 | Alpha value
6657 bool ScriptSetDFFAmbientColor(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
6658 {

6660  return true;
6661 }
6662 /******************************************************************/
6663 /* */
6664 /* */
6665 /******************************************************************/
6666 
6667 // @script | SetDFFDirectColor | Sets the directional light color
6668 // for the DFFs (The skater, cars and suchlike.). (Note: temporary,
6669 // until we get a better lighting setup).
6670 // @parmopt int | r | 0 | Red component
6671 // @parmopt int | g | 0 | Green component
6672 // @parmopt int | b | 0 | Blue component
6673 // @parmopt int | alpha | 0 | Alpha value
