6680 
6681 /******************************************************************/
6682 /* */
6683 /* */
6684 /******************************************************************/
6685 
6686 // @script | SetDynamicLightModulationFactor | A value of 0.0 means no
6687 // effect (light/dark polys have no effect).
6688 // A value of 1.0 means the maximum possible effect from light/dark polys
6689 // These values will stay set until changed, so designers will want to
6690 // put these in their level startup scripts.
6691 // @parm float | value |
6692 // @parmopt flag | ambient | |
6693 // @parmopt bool | directional | |
6694 bool ScriptSetDynamicLightModulationFactor( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
6695 {
6696 
6697 
6698  bool ok;
6699  int index = 0;
6700  float value = 0.0f;
6701  if( pParams->GetFloat( "value", &value ))
6702  {
6703  if( pParams->ContainsFlag( "ambient" ))
6704  {
6705  Nx::CLightManager::sSetAmbientLightModulationFactor(value);
6706  }
6707  else
6708  {
6709  ok = pParams->GetInteger( "directional", &index );
6710  Nx::CLightManager::sSetDiffuseLightModulationFactor(index, value);
6711  }
6712  }
6713  return true;
6714 }
6715 
6716 /******************************************************************/
6717 /* */
6718 /* */
6719 /******************************************************************/
6720 
6721 // @script | SetClippingDistances | Sets the clipping distances in inches.
6722 // Near should generally be left at 12, Far should be whatever is
6723 // appropriate for your level. Example:
6724 // SetClippingDistances Near=12 Far=8000
6725 // @parm float | Near |
6726 // @parm float | Far |
6727 bool ScriptSetClippingDistances(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
6728 {
6729 
6730  float Near=Gfx::Camera::vDEFAULT_FARZ;
6731  float Far=Gfx::Camera::vDEFAULT_NEARZ;
6732  pParams->GetFloat("Near",&Near);
6733  pParams->GetFloat("Far",&Far);
6734 
6735  // This is a bit of a patch,
6736  // cycle over the two possible cameras, and set the clipping dist
6737  for (int cam = 0; cam < 2; cam ++)
6738  {
6739 
6740  Gfx::Camera *p_cam = Nx::CViewportManager::sGetCamera(cam);
6741  if (p_cam)
6742  {
6743  p_cam->SetNearFarClipPlanes(Near,Far);
6744  }
6745  }
6746  //Gfx::Camera::SetNearFarClipPlanes(Near,Far);
6747 
6748 
6749  // Also Gamecube uses different near and far z clip planes, and has a fog far plane independent of the
6750  // camera far plane. So indicate here what the fog far plane for Gamecube should be.
6751 //# ifdef __PLAT_NGC__
6752 // NsRender::setFogFar( Far );
6753 //# endif // __PLAT_NGC__
6754 
6755 
6756 
6757  return true;
6758 }
6759 
6760 /******************************************************************/
6761 /* */
6762 /* */
6763 /******************************************************************/
6764 
6765 // @script | SetTrivialFarZClip | Sets the Z clipping distance
6766 // SetTrivialFarZClip on --- to turn it on
6767 // SetTrivialFarZClip off --- to turn it off
6768 // @flag on | Pass this in to set the trivial Z clipping
6769 // distance to true or false
6770 bool ScriptSetTrivialFarZClip(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
6771 {
6772 
6773 
6774  bool on = false;
6775 
6776  if( pParams->ContainsFlag( "on" ))
6777  {
6778  on = true;
6779  }
6780 
6781  Gfx::Manager * gfx_manager = Gfx::Manager::Instance();
6782  gfx_manager->SetTrivialFarZClip( on );
6783 
6784  return true;
6785 }
6786 
6787 /******************************************************************/
6788 /* */
6789 /* */
6790 /******************************************************************/
6791 
6792 // @script | EnableFog |
6793 bool ScriptEnableFog( Script::CStruct *pParams,
6794  Script::CScript *pScript )
6795 {
6796  Nx::CFog::sEnableFog(true);
6797 
6798  return true;
6799 }
6800 
6801 /******************************************************************/
6802 /* */
6803 /* */
6804 /******************************************************************/
6805 
6806 // @script | DisableFog |
6807 bool ScriptDisableFog( Script::CStruct *pParams,
6808  Script::CScript *pScript )
6809 {
6810  Nx::CFog::sEnableFog(false);
6811 
6812  return true;
6813 }
6814 
6815 
6816 /******************************************************************/
6817 /* */
6818 /* */
6819 /******************************************************************/
6820 
6821 // @script | SetFogDistance | Sets the "near" distance (in inches)
6822 // at which fogging will begin. (Polys closer than the near distance
6823 // will not be fogged. Beyond the near distance, they will become
6824 // increasingly fogged until they reach maximum fogging at the far
6825 // clip distance -- see SetClippingDistances).
6826 // @parm float | distance | distance in inches
6827 bool ScriptSetFogDistance( Script::CStruct *pParams,
6828  Script::CScript *pScript )
6829 {
6830 
6831  float fog_dist = 0.0f;
6832  pParams->GetFloat( "distance", &fog_dist );
6833 
6834  Nx::CFog::sSetFogNearDistance(fog_dist);
6835 
6836  // Garrett: Not sure if this is needed anymore, but leaving it there
6837  // in case some other platforms need it.
6838  // This is a bit of a patch,
6839  // cycle over the two possible cameras, and set the clipping dist
6840  for ( int cam = 0; cam < 2; cam++ )
6841  {
6842  Gfx::Camera *p_cam = Nx::CViewportManager::sGetCamera(cam);
6843  if ( NULL != p_cam )
6844  {
6845  p_cam->SetFogNearPlane( fog_dist );
6846  }
6847  }
6848 
6849  return true;
6850 }
6851 
6852 /******************************************************************/
6853 /* */
6854 /* */
6855 /******************************************************************/
6856 
6857 // @script | SetFogExponent | Sets the fog exponent. The exponent
6858 // value determines the "spread" of the fog, or how far out you
6859 // must go before you reach maximum fog. This component of fog
6860 // will probably change in the near future.
6861 // @parm float | exponent | fog exponent
6862 bool ScriptSetFogExponent( Script::CStruct *pParams,
6863  Script::CScript *pScript )
6864 {
6865  float exponent;
6866  if (!pParams->GetFloat( "exponent", &exponent ))
6867  {
6868  Dbg_MsgAssert(0, ("Can't find parameter 'exponent'"));
6869  }
6870 
6871  Nx::CFog::sSetFogExponent(exponent);
6872 
6873  return true;
6874 }
6875 
6876 /******************************************************************/
6877 /* */
6878 /* */
6879 /******************************************************************/
6880 
6881 // @script | SetFogColor | Sets the color that will be used for
6882 // atmospheric fogging. Color components are in the range 0-255.
6883 // The alpha component is in the range of 0-128.
6884 // @parmopt int | r | 255 | red component
6885 // @parmopt int | g | 255 | green component
6886 // @parmopt int | b | 255 | blue component
6887 // @parmopt int | a | 128 | alpha component (opacity of fog)
6888 bool ScriptSetFogColor( Script::CStruct *pParams,
6889  Script::CScript *pScript )
6890 {
6891 
6892  int red = 255;
6893  int green = 255;
6894  int blue = 255;
6895  int alpha = 128;
6896  pParams->GetInteger( "r", &red );
6897  pParams->GetInteger( "g", &green );
6898  pParams->GetInteger( "b", &blue );
6899  pParams->GetInteger( "a", &alpha );
6900 
6901  Image::RGBA rgba(red, green, blue, alpha);
6902 
6903  Nx::CFog::sSetFogRGBA( rgba );
6904 
6905  return true;
6906 }
6907 
6908 // @script | SetUVWibbleParams | Sets the UV wibble parameters of a sector
6909 // @parm name | sector | name of sector
6910 // @parm float | u_vel | u velocity
6911 // @parm float | u_amp | u amplitude
6912 // @parm float | u_freq | u frequency
6913 // @parm float | u_phase | u phase
6914 // @parm float | v_vel | v velocity
6915 // @parm float | v_amp | v amplitude
6916 // @parm float | v_freq | v frequency
6917 // @parm float | v_phase | v phase
6918 bool ScriptSetUVWibbleParams(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
6919 {
6920  // Get sector checksum
6921  uint32 checksum;
6922  if (!pParams->GetChecksum("sector", &checksum))
6923  {
6924  Dbg_MsgAssert(0, ("Can't find parameter sector"));
6925  }
6926 
6927  // Find sector
6928  Nx::CSector *p_sector = Nx::CEngine::sGetSector(checksum);
6929  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_sector, ("Can't find sector %x in world", checksum));
6930 
6931  // Extract all the parameters
6932  float u_velocity;
6933  float u_amplitude;
6934  float u_frequency;
6935  float u_phase;
6936  float v_velocity;
6937  float v_amplitude;
6938  float v_frequency;
6939  float v_phase;
6940  bool found_all;
6941 
6942  found_all = pParams->GetFloat("u_vel", &u_velocity);
6943  found_all &= pParams->GetFloat("u_amp", &u_amplitude);
6944  found_all &= pParams->GetFloat("u_freq", &u_frequency);
6945  found_all &= pParams->GetFloat("u_phase", &u_phase);
6946  found_all &= pParams->GetFloat("v_vel", &v_velocity);
6947  found_all &= pParams->GetFloat("v_amp", &v_amplitude);
6948  found_all &= pParams->GetFloat("v_freq", &v_frequency);
6949  found_all &= pParams->GetFloat("v_phase", &v_phase);
6950 
6951  Dbg_MsgAssert(found_all, ("Missing one or more of the wibble parameters. Must fill them all out."));
6952 
6953  p_sector->SetUVWibbleParams(u_velocity, u_amplitude, u_frequency, u_phase, v_velocity, v_amplitude, v_frequency, v_phase);
6954 
6955  return true;
6956 }
6957 
6958 // @script | EnableExplicitUVWibble | Enables explicit setting of the UV wibble offsets.
6959 // To set the offsets, call SetUVWibbleOffsets.
6960 // @parm name | sector | name of sector
6961 bool ScriptEnableExplicitUVWibble(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
6962 {
6963  // Get sector checksum
6964  uint32 checksum;
6965  if (!pParams->GetChecksum("sector", &checksum))
6966  {
6967  Dbg_MsgAssert(0, ("Can't find parameter sector"));
6968  }
6969 
6970  // Find sector
6971  Nx::CSector *p_sector = Nx::CEngine::sGetSector(checksum);
6972  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_sector, ("Can't find sector %x in world", checksum));
6973 
6974  p_sector->UseExplicitUVWibble(true);
6975 
6976  return true;
6977 }
6978 
6979 // @script | DisableExplicitUVWibble | Disables explicit setting of the UV wibble offsets.
6980 // @parm name | sector | name of sector
6981 bool ScriptDisableExplicitUVWibble(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
6982 {
6983  // Get sector checksum
6984  uint32 checksum;
6985  if (!pParams->GetChecksum("sector", &checksum))
6986  {
6987  Dbg_MsgAssert(0, ("Can't find parameter sector"));
6988  }
6989 
6990  // Find sector
6991  Nx::CSector *p_sector = Nx::CEngine::sGetSector(checksum);
6992  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_sector, ("Can't find sector %x in world", checksum));
6993 
6994  p_sector->UseExplicitUVWibble(false);
6995 
6996  return true;
6997 }
6998 
6999 // @script | SetUVWibbleOffsets | Sets the UV wibble offsets explicitly
7000 // @parm name | sector | name of sector
7001 // @parm float | u_off | u offset
7002 // @parm float | v_off | v offset
7003 bool ScriptSetUVWibbleOffsets(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
7004 {
7005  // Get sector checksum
7006  uint32 checksum;
7007  if (!pParams->GetChecksum("sector", &checksum))
7008  {
7009  Dbg_MsgAssert(0, ("Can't find parameter sector"));
7010  }
7011 
7012  // Find sector
7013  Nx::CSector *p_sector = Nx::CEngine::sGetSector(checksum);
7014  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_sector, ("Can't find sector %x in world", checksum));
7015 
7016  // Extract all the parameters
7017  float u_offset;
7018  float v_offset;
7019  bool found_all;
7020 
7021  found_all = pParams->GetFloat("u_off", &u_offset);
7022  found_all &= pParams->GetFloat("v_off", &v_offset);
7023 
7024  Dbg_MsgAssert(found_all, ("Missing one or more of the wibble offset parameters. Must fill them all out."));
7025 
7026  p_sector->SetUVWibbleOffsets(u_offset, v_offset);
7027 
7028  return true;
7029 }
7030 
7031 /******************************************************************/
7032 /* */
7033 /* */
7034 /******************************************************************/
7035 
7036 bool ScriptGetPreferenceString(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
7037 {
7038 
7039  Script::CStruct* pStructure;
7040  Prefs::Preferences* pPreferences;
7041  uint32 field_id, pref_type;
7042  const char* ui_string;
7043  CStruct* pass_back_params;
7044 
7045  pass_back_params = pScript->GetParams();
7046 
7047  pParams->GetChecksum( NO_NAME, &field_id );
7048  pParams->GetChecksum( "pref_type", &pref_type );
7049 
7050  pPreferences = Mdl::GetPreferences(pref_type); // This will assert if it cannot find the prefs
7051 
7052  pStructure = pPreferences->GetPreference( field_id );
7053  Dbg_MsgAssert(pStructure, ("\n%s\nCan't get preference 0x%x (%s)",pScript->GetScriptInfo(),field_id, Script::FindChecksumName(field_id)));
7054 
7055  //pParams->AddStructure( "preference", pStructure );
7056  pStructure->GetString( "ui_string", &ui_string );
7057  pass_back_params->AddString( "ui_string", ui_string );
7058 
7059  return true;
7060 }
7061 
7062 /******************************************************************/
7063 /* */
7064 /* */
7065 /******************************************************************/
7066 
7067 bool ScriptGetPreferencePassword(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
7068 {
7069  Script::CStruct* pStructure;
7070  Prefs::Preferences* pPreferences;
7071  uint32 field_id, pref_type;
7072  const char* ui_string;
7073  CStruct* pass_back_params;
7074  static char s_password_string[32];
7075  uint32 i;
7076 
7077  pass_back_params = pScript->GetParams();
7078 
7079  pParams->GetChecksum( NO_NAME, &field_id );
7080  pParams->GetChecksum( "pref_type", &pref_type );
7081 
7082  pPreferences = Mdl::GetPreferences(pref_type); // This will assert if it cannot find the prefs
7083 
7084  pStructure = pPreferences->GetPreference( field_id );
7085  //pParams->AddStructure( "preference", pStructure );
7086  pStructure->GetString( "ui_string", &ui_string );
7087  for( i = 0; i < strlen( ui_string ); i++ )
7088  {
7089  s_password_string[i] = '*';
7090  }
7091 
7092  Dbg_Assert( i < 32 );
7093  s_password_string[i] = '\0';
7094 
7095  pass_back_params->AddString( "password_string", s_password_string );
7096 
7097  return true;
7098 }
7099 
7100 /******************************************************************/
7101 /* */
7102 /* */
7103 /******************************************************************/
7104 
7105 bool ScriptGetPreferenceChecksum(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
7106 {
7107  Script::CStruct* pStructure;
7108  Prefs::Preferences* pPreferences;
7109  uint32 field_id, checksum, pref_type;
7110  CStruct* pass_back_params;
7111 
7112  pass_back_params = pScript->GetParams();
7113 
7114  pParams->GetChecksum( NO_NAME, &field_id );
7115  pParams->GetChecksum( "pref_type", &pref_type );
7116 
7117  pPreferences = Mdl::GetPreferences(pref_type); // This will assert if it cannot find the prefs
7118 
7119  pStructure = pPreferences->GetPreference( field_id );
7120  //pParams->AddStructure( "preference", pStructure );
7121  pStructure->GetChecksum( "checksum", &checksum );
7122  pass_back_params->AddChecksum( "checksum", checksum );
7123 
7124  return true;
7125 }
7126 
7127 /******************************************************************/
7128 /* */
7129 /* */
7130 /******************************************************************/
7131 
7132 // @script | SetPreference | sets the prefs to those specified in
7133 // the params structure
7134 // @parm name | field | the field id
7135 // @parm structure | params |
7136 bool ScriptSetPreference(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
7137 {
7138 
7139 
7140  // gets either network or splitscreen prefs, as appropriate
7141  Prefs::Preferences* pPreferences = Mdl::GetPreferences( pParams );
7142 
7143  uint32 field_id;
7144  pParams->GetChecksum( "field", &field_id, true );
7145 
7146  Script::CStruct* pSubParams;
7147  pParams->GetStructure( "params", &pSubParams, true );
7148  pPreferences->SetPreference( field_id, pSubParams );
7149 
7150 #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
7151  Script::PrintContents(pSubParams);
7152 #endif
7153  return true;
7154 }
7155 
7156 /******************************************************************/
7157 /* */
7158 /* */
7159 /******************************************************************/
7160 
7161 // @script | PreferenceEquals | returns true if the actual preference value
7162 // for the given field equals the test value
7163 // @parm name | field | the field id
7164 // @parm name | equals | test value
7165 bool ScriptPreferenceEquals(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
7166 {
7167 
7168 
7169  // gets either network or splitscreen prefs, as appropriate
7170  Prefs::Preferences* pPreferences = Mdl::GetPreferences( pParams );
7171 
7172  uint32 field_id;
7173  pParams->GetChecksum("field", &field_id, true);
7174 
7175  uint32 test_value;
7176  pParams->GetChecksum( "equals", &test_value, true );
7177 
7178  Script::CStruct* pStructure = pPreferences->GetPreference( field_id );
7179  Dbg_Assert(pStructure);
7180 
7181  uint32 actual_value;
7182  pStructure->GetChecksum( "checksum", &actual_value, true );
7183 
7184  return ( test_value == actual_value );
7185 }
7186

7188 /* */
7189 /* */
7190 /******************************************************************/
7191 
7192 // @script | ResetCamera |
7193 bool ScriptResetCamera(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
7194 {
7195 
7196  // This is a bit of a patch,
7197  // cycle over the two possible cameras, and reset them
7198  for (int cam = 0; cam < 2; cam ++)
7199  {
7200 
7201  Gfx::Camera *p_cam = Nx::CViewportManager::sGetCamera(cam);
7202  if (p_cam)
7203  {
7204  printf ("TODO: ScriptResetCamera not implemented\n");
7205  }
7206  }
7207  //Gfx::Camera::SetNearFarClipPlanes(Near,Far);
7208  return true;
7209 }
7210 
7211 
7212 /******************************************************************/
7213 /* */
7214 /* */
7215 /******************************************************************/
7216 
7217 // @script | SetVolumeFromValue | sets the volume according to the slider
7218 // @uparm sfxvol | the volume to set (either sfxvol or cdvol)
7219 // @parm name | id | the slider id used to change the volume
7220 bool ScriptSetVolumeFromValue( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
7221 {
7222 
7223  /*
7224  uint32 whichParam;
7225  pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &whichParam, true );
7226 
7227  uint32 slider_id;
7228  pParams->GetChecksum( "id", &slider_id, true );
7229 
7230  Front::MenuFactory* menu_factory = Front::MenuFactory::Instance();
7231  Front::SliderMenuElement* pSliderElement = static_cast<Front::SliderMenuElement*>( menu_factory->GetMenuElement( slider_id, true ) );
7232  Dbg_Assert( pSliderElement );
7233 
7234  switch ( whichParam )
7235  {
7236  case 0x8d6f6554: // "sfxvol"
7237  {
7238  Sfx::CSfxManager * sfx_manager = Sfx::CSfxManager::Instance();
7239  sfx_manager->SetMainVolume( ( float )( 10 * pSliderElement->GetValue( ) ) );
7240  }
7241  break;
7242 
7243  case 0xa5162bd2: // "cdvol"
7244  {
7245  // still set the main music volume even if in the front end!!!
7246  Pcm::SetVolume( ( float )( 10 * pSliderElement->GetValue( ) ) );
7247 
7248  // make sure the music is playing and shit...
7249  Pcm::PauseMusic( false );
7250  }
7251  break;
7252 
7253  default:
7254  {
7255  // unrecognized sound parameter
7256  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0, ( "Unrecognized sound parameter" ) );
7257  }
7258  break;
7259  }
7260  */
7261 
7262  return true;
7263 }
7264 
7265 /******************************************************************/
7266 /* */
7267 /* */
7268 /******************************************************************/
7269 
7270 // @script | GetValueFromVolume |
7271 // @uparm sfxvol | the volume you're interested in (either sfxvol, cdvol, or cutvol)
7272 bool ScriptGetValueFromVolume( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
7273 {
7274 
7275 
7276  uint32 whichParam;
7277  pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &whichParam, true );
7278 
7279  switch ( whichParam )
7280  {
7281  case 0x8d6f6554: // "sfxvol"
7282  {
7283  Sfx::CSfxManager * sfx_manager = Sfx::CSfxManager::Instance();
7284  pScript->GetParams()->AddComponent( Script::GenerateCRC( "value" ), ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER, ( (int) sfx_manager->GetMainVolume() ) / 10 );
7285  }
7286  break;
7287 
7288  case 0xa5162bd2: // "cdvol"
7289  {
7290  pScript->GetParams()->AddComponent( Script::GenerateCRC( "value" ), ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER, ( (int) Pcm::GetVolume() ) / 10 );
7291  }
7292  break;
7293 
7294  case 0xe32f3525: // "cutvol"
7295  {
7296  pScript->GetParams()->AddComponent( Script::GenerateCRC( "value" ), ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER, ( (int) Pcm::GetMusicStreamVolume() ) / 10 );
7297  }
7298  break;
7299 
7300  default:
7301  {
7302  // unrecognized sound parameter
7303  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0, ( "Unrecognized sound parameter" ) );
7304  }
7305  break;
7306  }
7307 
7308  return true;
7309 }
7310 
7311 /******************************************************************/
7312 /* */
7313 /* */
7314 /******************************************************************/
7315 
7316 // @script | SetSliderValue |
7317 // @parm name | id | the slider id
7318 // @parm int | value | value to assign to slider
7319 bool ScriptSetSliderValue( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )

7329 
7330  Front::MenuFactory* menu_factory = Front::MenuFactory::Instance();
7331  Front::SliderMenuElement* pSliderElement = static_cast<Front::SliderMenuElement*>( menu_factory->GetMenuElement( slider_id, true ) );
7332  Dbg_Assert( pSliderElement );
7333  pSliderElement->SetValue( value );
7334  */
7335 
7336  return true;
7337 }

7378 {

7381  pParams->GetFloat( NONAME, &vel );

7384  return true;
7385 }

7584 /******************************************************************/

7587 /******************************************************************/
7588 
7589 // @script | SetViewMode | Debugging function to toggle the camera mode,
7590 // switching between normal, free with fixed skater, and free with moving skater
7591 // usually triggers with Select+X (See buttonscripts.q)
7592 bool ScriptSetViewMode(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
7593 {
7594  int viewMode;
7595  pParams->GetInteger( NONAME, &viewMode, Script::ASSERT );
7596 
7597  Dbg_Assert( viewMode >= 0 && viewMode < Obj::NUM_VIEW_MODES );
7598 
7599  s_view_mode = viewMode;
7600  Mdl::CViewer::sSetViewMode( s_view_mode );
7601  // Handle toggling to different cameras based on view mode
7602 
7603  switch (s_view_mode )
7604  {
7605  case Obj::GAMEPLAY_SKATER_ACTIVE:
7606  SetActiveCamera(CRCD(0x967c138c,"skatercam0"),0, false);
7607  break;
7608  default:
7609  SetActiveCamera(CRCD(0xeb17151b,"viewer_cam"),0, true);
7610  break;
7611  }
7612 
7613 
7614  Obj::CSkater* pSkater;
7615  for ( int i = 0; i < 8; i++ )
7616  {
7617  Mdl::Skate * skate_mod = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
7618  pSkater = skate_mod->GetSkater(i);
7619  if ( pSkater ) // Skater might not exist
7620  {
7621  pSkater->SetViewMode( (Obj::EViewMode)s_view_mode );
7622  }
7623  }
7624 
7625  // clear out the viewer object, if any
7626  Mdl::CViewer* pViewer = Mdl::CViewer::sGetViewer();
7627  if ( pViewer )
7628  {
7629  pViewer->RemoveViewerObject();
7630  }
7631 
7632  return true;
7633 }
7634 
7635 /******************************************************************/
7636 /* */
7637 /* */
7638 /******************************************************************/
7639 
7640 // @script | ToggleMetricItem | ToggleMetricItem will turn on or off
7641 // individual items in the metric display.
7642 // The item parameter is one of: <nl>
7643 // METRIC_TIME <nl>
7644 // METRIC_ARENAUSAGE <nl>
7645 // METRIC_TOTALPOLYS <nl>
7646 // METRIC_POLYSPROC <nl>
7647 // METRIC_VERTS <nl>
7648 // METRIC_RESOURCEALLOCS <nl>
7649 // METRIC_TEXTUREUPLOADS <nl>
7650 // METRIC_VU1 <nl>
7651 // METRIC_DMA1 <nl>
7652 // METRIC_DMA2 <nl>
7653 // METRIC_VBLANKS <nl>
7654 // METRIC_DRAWTIME <nl>
7655 // METRIC_IHANDLERTIME <nl>
7656 // METRIC_SKYCACHE <nl>
7657 // METRIC_VIDEOMODE <nl>
7658 // METRIC_VRAMUSAGE <nl>
7659 // METRIC_MEMUSED <nl>
7660 // METRIC_MEMFREE <nl>
7661 // METRIC_REGIONINFO <nl>
7662 // @parmopt int | item | 0 |
7663 bool ScriptToggleMetricItem( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
7664 {
7665 
7666 
7667 /*
7668  uint32 metricFlags = 0;
7669  pParams->GetInteger( "item", ( int * )&metricFlags );
7670 
7671  Gfx::Manager * gfx_manager = Gfx::Manager::Instance();
7672 
7673  Gfx::Metrics* pMetrics = gfx_manager->GetMetrics();
7674  pMetrics->ToggleMetricItem( metricFlags );
7675 */
7676  return true;
7677 }
7678 
7679 /******************************************************************/
7680 /* */
7681 /* */
7682 /******************************************************************/
7683 
7684 // @script | ToggleMemMetrics | This will replace the PS2 specific
7685 // metrics with a list of the all the memory heaps, together with
7686 // the amount of fragmentation, and the amount of free memory. Note,
7687 // you have to use ToggleMetrics to actually see the metrics before
7688 // using ToggleMemMetrics <nl>
7689 // See the online doc for a full explanation of the various heaps
7690 bool ScriptToggleMemMetrics( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
7691 {
7692  /*
7693  Gfx::Manager * gfx_manager = Gfx::Manager::Instance();
7694  Gfx::Metrics* pMetrics = gfx_manager->GetMetrics();
7695  pMetrics->ToggleMemMetrics();
7696  */
7697  return true;
7698 }
7699 
7700 
7701 
7702 /******************************************************************/
7703 /* */
7704 /* */
7705 /******************************************************************/
7706 // @script | KillAllTextureSplats | Destroys all exisiting texture splats
7707 bool ScriptKillAllTextureSplats( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
7708 {
7709  Nx::KillAllTextureSplats();
7710  return true;
7711 }
7712 
7713 /******************************************************************/
7714 /* */
7715 /* */
7716 /******************************************************************/
7717 
7718 // @script | ProximCleanup | Destroys all proxim nodes
7719 bool ScriptProximCleanup(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
7720 {
7721  // TT12597: Clear out the proxim node pointers in the stream and sound components
7722  // new fast way, just go directly to the components, if any
7723  Obj::CSoundComponent* p_sound_component = static_cast<Obj::CSoundComponent*>( Obj::CCompositeObjectManager::Instance()->GetFirstComponentByType( CRC_SOUND ));
7724  while( p_sound_component )
7725  {
7726  p_sound_component->ClearProximNode();
7727 
7728  p_sound_component = static_cast<Obj::CSoundComponent*>( p_sound_component->GetNextSameType());
7729  }
7730 
7731  Obj::CStreamComponent* p_stream_component = static_cast<Obj::CStreamComponent*>( Obj::CCompositeObjectManager::Instance()->GetFirstComponentByType( CRC_STREAM ));
7732  while( p_stream_component )
7733  {
7734  p_stream_component->ClearProximNode();
7735 
7736  p_stream_component = static_cast<Obj::CStreamComponent*>( p_stream_component->GetNextSameType());
7737  }
7738 
7739  Obj::Proxim_Cleanup();
7740  return true;
7741 }
7742 
7743 /******************************************************************/
7744 /* */
7745 /* */
7746 /******************************************************************/
7747 
7748 // @script | Cleanup | Destroys current world, texture dictionaries, objects and railnodes.
7749 // @flag preserve_skaters | Set this to preserve the skaters
7750 bool ScriptCleanup(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
7751 {
7752  // DumpUnwindStack( 20, 0 );
7753  // Wait for any async rendering to finish before we proceed
7754  Nx::CEngine::sFinishRendering();
7755  #ifdef __PLAT_NGPS__
7756  NxPs2::AllocateExtraDMA(false);
7757  #endif
7758 
7759  Replay::DeallocateReplayMemory();
7760 
7761 // goalmanager stuff moved here from Skate::ChangeLevel
7762  Game::CGoalManager* p_GoalManager = Game::GetGoalManager();
7763  Dbg_MsgAssert( p_GoalManager, ( "couldn't get GoalManager\n" ) );
7764 
7765  p_GoalManager->DeactivateAllGoals();
7766  p_GoalManager->RemoveAllGoals();
7767 
7768  // PARKED4:
7769  Ed::CParkEditor* p_park_editor = Ed::CParkEditor::Instance();
7770  p_park_editor->Cleanup();
7771  p_park_editor->DeletePlayModeGapManager();
7772 
7773  Mdl::Skate * skate_mod = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
7774  bool preserve;
7775  bool was_spawned;
7776 
7777  Dbg_Printf( "Performing Cleanup\n" );
7778 
7779  Gfx::DebuggeryLines_CleanUp( ); // so we remove debug lines between levels
7780 
7781  preserve = false;
7782  if( pParams )
7783  {
7784  preserve = pParams->ContainsFlag("preserve_skaters");
7785  }
7786 
7787 // ********************************************************************************************
7788 // ********************************************************************************************
7789 // ********************************************************************************************
7790  // A hacky way of preserving the running script, since skate's cleanup will destroy all
7791  // spawned scripts.
7792  was_spawned = false;
7793  if( pScript )
7794  {
7795  was_spawned = pScript->mIsSpawned;
7796  pScript->mIsSpawned = false;
7797  }
7798  // Delete's session objects managed by the "Skate::" code module
7799  skate_mod->Cleanup( );
7800  if( pScript )
7801  {
7802  pScript->mIsSpawned = was_spawned;
7803  }
7804 
7805  // Destroy other Session Objects
7806 // These can be recreated, no assets are unloaded
7807 
7808  //skate_mod->GetGoalManager()->RemoveAllGoals();
7809 
7810  Dbg_Printf( "Destroying imposters..." );
7811  Nx::CEngine::sGetImposterManager()->Cleanup();
7812 
7813  Dbg_Printf( "Destroying misc fx..." );
7814  Nx::MiscFXCleanup();
7815 
7816  Dbg_Printf( "Clearing node-name hash table ..." );
7817  SkateScript::ClearNodeNameHashTable();
7818 
7819  // Turn off fogging...let the next level turn it back on if it wants it
7820  Nx::CFog::sEnableFog(false);
7821 
7822  Script::KillStoppedScripts();
7823 
7824 
7825  Dbg_Printf( "Cleaning up terrain soundFX manager." );
7826  Env::CTerrainManager::sReset();
7827  Dbg_Printf( "Done.\n" );
7828 
7829 
7830 // ********************************************************************************************
7831 // ********************************************************************************************
7832 // ********************************************************************************************
7833 // Actual unloading of assets starts here
7834 
7835 // unload sond effects (just resets the SRAM pointer)
7836  Dbg_Printf( "Cleaning up soundFX manager." );
7837  Sfx::CSfxManager * sfx_manager = Sfx::CSfxManager::Instance();
7838  sfx_manager->CleanUp( ); // Sfx manager uses a very primitive memory management system ... check it out..
7839  Dbg_Printf( "Done.\n" );
7840 
7841 // Unload object models and animations
7842  printf ("unloading assman tables ...........\n");
7843  Ass::CAssMan * ass_manager = Ass::CAssMan::Instance();
7844  ass_manager->UnloadAllTables( );
7845  printf ("done unloading assman ...........\n");
7846 
7847 // ********************************************************************************************
7848 // ********************************************************************************************
7849 // ********************************************************************************************
7850  Dbg_Printf( "Unloading NodeArray .QB (level .qn file)" );
7851  Script::CSymbolTableEntry *p_sym=Script::LookUpSymbol(CRCD(0xc472ecc5,"NodeArray"));
7852  if (p_sym)
7853  {
7854  SkateScript::UnloadQB(p_sym->mSourceFileNameChecksum);
7855  }
7856 
7857 // ********************************************************************************************
7858 // ********************************************************************************************
7859 // ********************************************************************************************
7860 // Unload the level specific qb.
7861  // Note: It's ok if s_level_specific_qb is 0, UnloadQB just won't do anything if it can't find it.
7862  #if 0
7863  SkateScript::UnloadQB(s_level_specific_qb);
7864  s_level_specific_qb=0;
7865  #else
7866  for (int qb=0;qb<MAX_LEVEL_QBS;qb++)
7867  {
7868  SkateScript::UnloadQB(s_level_specific_qbs[qb]);
7869  s_level_specific_qbs[qb]=0;
7870  }
7871  #endif
7872 
7873 
7874 // ********************************************************************************************
7875 // ********************************************************************************************
7876 // ********************************************************************************************
7877  // Unload the level geometry
7878 
7879  printf ("Starting to unload Geometry from the engine .....\n");
7880  ScriptUnloadAllLevelGeometry(NULL,NULL);
7881  printf ("Done unloading Geometry from the engine .....\n");
7882 
7883 // ********************************************************************************************
7884 // ********************************************************************************************
7885 // ********************************************************************************************
7886  // Maybe unload the skaters
7887  if (preserve)
7888  {
7889  //ScriptUnhookSkaters(NULL,NULL); // just tell the skaters that there is no world loaded (maybe not needed)
7890 
7891  /*
7892  // NASTY (TEMPORARY) PATCH
7893  // since the skater is preserved, but the animations have been deleted
7894  // then we need to recreate the references to them (what was the "animarray")
7895  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PushContext(Mem::Manager::sHandle().BottomUpHeap());
7896  if( skate_mod->GetLocalSkater())
7897  {
7898  Obj::CAnimationComponent* pAnimComponent = GetAnimationComponentFromObject( skate_mod->GetLocalSkater() );
7899  pAnimComponent->SetAnimArray( Script::GenerateCRC("animload_human") );
7900  }
7901  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PopContext();
7902  */
7903 
7904  }
7905  else
7906  {
7907  printf("Clean up without preserve skaters\n");
7908  //skate_mod->UnloadSkaters();
7909  // as we're leaving a level,
7910  // clean up any additional heaps we might have allocated for the other skaters...
7911  Mem::Manager::sHandle().DeleteSkaterHeaps();
7912  }
7913 
7914 
7915  // Unload any pip pre files that are no longer being used (eg, collision)
7916  const char *p_pre_name=Pip::GetNextLoadedPre();
7917  while (p_pre_name)
7918  {
7919  const char *p_next=Pip::GetNextLoadedPre(p_pre_name);
7920  if (!Pip::PreFileIsInUse(p_pre_name))
7921  {
7922  Pip::UnloadPre(p_pre_name);
7923  }
7924  p_pre_name=p_next;
7925  }
7926 
7927  // unload the skater parts pre file if it is currently loaded
7928  File::PreMgr* pre_mgr = File::PreMgr::Instance();
7929  pre_mgr->UnloadPre( "skaterparts.pre", true );
7930 
7931  // Clear away any old cameras
7932  Nx::CViewportManager::sDeleteMarkedCameras();
7933 
7934  // Clear any currently running FakeLights commands.
7935  Nx::CLightManager::sClearCurrentFakeLightsCommand();
7936 
7937  // Clear away any non-permanent heaps
7938  Nx::FlushParticleTextures(false);
7939 
7940 
7941  // cleanup pathman memory
7942  Obj::CPathMan* pPathMan = Obj::CPathMan::Instance();
7943  pPathMan->DeallocateObjectTrackerMemory();
7944 
7945  if( skate_mod->ShouldAllocateNetMiscHeap())
7946  {
7947  Dbg_Printf( "****** LEVEL: 0x%x 0x%x 0x%x\n", skate_mod->m_requested_level, skate_mod->m_cur_level, skate_mod->m_prev_level );
7948  Mem::Manager::sHandle().InitNetMiscHeap();
7949  }
7950  else
7951  {
7952  Mem::Manager::sHandle().DeleteNetMiscHeap();
7953  }
7954 
7955 
7956  Mem::Manager& mem_man = Mem::Manager::sHandle();
7957 
7958  // destroy the custom heaps, if they exist
7959  // (TODO: Move this to script, since it really
7960  // only applies to the skateshop)
7961  mem_man.DeleteNamedHeap( Script::GenerateCRC("preview"), false );
7962 
7963  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
7964  // sanity checks for fragmentation
7965  Mem::Heap* heap = mem_man.BottomUpHeap();
7966  int fragmentation = heap->mFreeMem.m_count;
7967 
7968  #if 1
7969  if (fragmentation > 10000)
7970  {
7971  // not guaranteed to do anything useful.... might crash the debugger (Mick)
7972  printf ("Dumping Fragments.....\n");
7973  MemView_DumpFragments(heap);
7974  printf ("Done Dumping Fragments.....\n");
7975  }
7976  #endif
7977 
7978  Dbg_MsgAssert(fragmentation < 10000, ("Excessive bottom up fragmentation (%d) after cleanup",fragmentation));
7979 
7980 #ifndef __PLAT_NGC__
7981  heap = mem_man.TopDownHeap();
7982  fragmentation = heap->mFreeMem.m_count;
7983  if (fragmentation > 10000)
7984  {
7985  // not guaranteed to do anything useful.... might crash the debugger (Mick)
7986  printf ("Dumping Fragments.....\n");
7987  MemView_DumpFragments(heap);
7988  printf ("Done Dumping Fragments.....\n");
7989  }
7990 
7991  Dbg_MsgAssert(fragmentation < 10000, ("Excessive top down fragmentation (%d) after cleanup",fragmentation));
7992 #endif // __PLAT_NGC__
7993  #endif
7994 
7995 # if defined( __PLAT_XBOX__ ) && defined( __NOPT_ASSERT__ )
7996 # define AddStr(a,b) ( pstrOut += wsprintf( pstrOut, a, b ))
7997 # define KB ( 1024 )
7998  MEMORYSTATUS stat;
7999  char strOut[1024], *pstrOut;
8000 
8001  // Get the memory status.
8002  GlobalMemoryStatus( &stat );
8003 
8004  // Setup the output string.
8005  pstrOut = strOut;
8006 // AddStr( "%4d total kb of virtual memory.\n", stat.dwTotalVirtual / KB );
8007 // AddStr( "%4d free kb of virtual memory.\n", stat.dwAvailVirtual / KB );
8008  AddStr( "%4d total kb of physical memory.\n", stat.dwTotalPhys / KB );
8009  AddStr( "%4d free kb of physical memory.\n", stat.dwAvailPhys / KB );
8010 // AddStr( "%4d percent of memory is in use.\n", stat.dwMemoryLoad );
8011  OutputDebugString( strOut );
8012 # endif
8013 
8014 # ifdef __PLAT_NGPS__
8015  if( skate_mod->ShouldAllocateInternetHeap())
8016  {
8017  Mem::Manager::sHandle().InitInternetHeap();
8018  }
8019  else
8020  {
8021  Mem::Manager::sHandle().DeleteInternetHeap();
8022  }
8023 # endif // __PLAT_NGPS__
8024 
8025  return true;
8026 }
8027 
8028 /******************************************************************/
8029 /* */
8030 /* */
8031 /******************************************************************/
8032 
8033 // @script | LoadQB | Loads the specified QB file.
8034 // @uparm "data\scripts\ken.qb" | File name of the qb to load
8035 // @uparmopt LevelSpecific | Whether this is the level specific script file
8036 bool ScriptLoadQB(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
8037 {
8038  const char *p_file_name=NULL;
8039  pParams->GetString(NONAME,&p_file_name);
8040  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_file_name,("LoadQB requires a file name."));
8041 
8042  if (pParams->ContainsFlag("LevelSpecific"))
8043  {
8044  #if 0
8045  if (s_level_specific_qb)
8046  {
8047  // Only one level specific qb can exist currently, so make sure
8048  // that the old one is removed, just in case someone did two
8049  // LoadQB's in a row.
8050  SkateScript::UnloadQB(s_level_specific_qb);
8051  }
8052  s_level_specific_qb=Crc::GenerateCRCFromString(p_file_name);
8053  #else
8054  // Now allowing multiple level specific QBs, so
8055  // just look for a free slot
8056  int qb;
8057  for (qb=0;qb<MAX_LEVEL_QBS;qb++)
8058  {
8059  if (!s_level_specific_qbs[qb])
8060  {
8061  s_level_specific_qbs[qb] = Crc::GenerateCRCFromString(p_file_name);
8062  break;
8063  }
8064  }
8065 
8066  Dbg_MsgAssert(qb < MAX_LEVEL_QBS, ("Can't have more that %d level specifc qbs (loading %s)\n",MAX_LEVEL_QBS,p_file_name));
8067 
8068 
8069  #endif
8070 
8071  // Load the QB
8072  SkateScript::LoadQB(p_file_name,ASSERT_IF_DUPLICATE_SYMBOLS);
8073  }
8074  else
8075  {
8076  // This will not assert if duplicate symbols. This is needed for when a
8077  // LoadQB command is put in a button-script as a convenient way to reload
8078  // a qb. If it asserted for duplicate symbols, it would assert due to the
8079  // qb already being loaded.
8080  SkateScript::LoadQB(p_file_name);
8081  }
8082 
8083 
8084  return true;
8085 }
8086 
8087 /******************************************************************/
8088 /* */
8089 /* */
8090 /******************************************************************/
8091 
8092 // @script | UnloadQB | Unloads the specified QB file.
8093 // @uparm "data\scripts\ken.qb" | File name of the qb to unload
8094 bool ScriptUnloadQB(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
8095 {
8096  const char *p_file_name=NULL;
8097  pParams->GetString(NONAME,&p_file_name);
8098  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_file_name,("LoadQB requires a file name."));
8099 
8100  // Unload the QB
8101  uint32 qb_checksum=Crc::GenerateCRCFromString(p_file_name);
8102  SkateScript::UnloadQB(qb_checksum);
8103 
8104  // If it was the level specific qb, which is normally removed automatically
8105  // by ScriptCleanup above.
8106  // Since they removed it manually, reset s_level_specific_qb so that it is consistent.
8107  #if 0
8108  if (qb_checksum==s_level_specific_qb)
8109  {
8110  s_level_specific_qb=0;
8111  }
8112  #else
8113  int qb;
8114  for (qb=0;qb<MAX_LEVEL_QBS;qb++)
8115  {
8116  if (qb_checksum == s_level_specific_qbs[qb])
8117  {
8118  s_level_specific_qbs[qb] = 0;
8119  }
8120  }
8121  #endif
8122 
8123  return true;
8124 }
8125

8127 /* */
8128 /* */

8133 {

8135 
8136  return true;
8137 }

8141 bool ScriptSetRenderMode(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
8142 {

8145  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0x6835b854,"mode"),&mode);
8146  Nx::CEngine::sSetRenderMode(mode);
8147 
8148  return true;
8149 }

8153 {

8156  Nx::CEngine::sSetWireframeMode(mode);
8157

8165 /* */
8166 /******************************************************************/
8167 
8168 // @script | DebugRenderIgnore |
8169 // @parmopt int | ignore_1 | 0 | bitmask of face flags where we ignore this face if bit is 1
8170 // @parmopt int | ignore_0 | 0 | bitmask of face flags where we ignore this face if bit is 0
8171 bool ScriptDebugRenderIgnore(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
8172 {
8173 
8174  int ignore_0 = 0;
8175  int ignore_1 = 0;
8176  pParams->GetInteger("ignore_1",&ignore_1);
8177  pParams->GetInteger("ignore_0",&ignore_0);
8178 
8179  Nx::CEngine::sSetDebugIgnore(ignore_1,ignore_0);
8180 
8181  return true;
8182 }

8184 /******************************************************************/
8185 /* */
8186 /* */
8187 /******************************************************************/
8188 
8189 // @script | SetVRAMPackContext | Currently, there are 4 possible
8190 // contexts, 0 through 3, with 0 being the default. There is a script
8191 // command SetVRAMPackContext which takes a number between 0 and 3.
8192 // All packing handled by the intelligent packer will then only pack
8193 // in blocks with a matching context.
8194 // @uparmopt 0 | context number (int)
8195 bool ScriptSetVRAMPackContext(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
8196 {
8197 
8198 
8199  int context = 0;
8200  pParams->GetInteger( NONAME, &context );
8201 
8202 # ifdef __PLAT_NGPS__
8203 // RpSkyNXSetVRAMPackContext( (uint32)context );
8204 # endif
8205 
8206  return true;
8207 }
8208 
8209 /******************************************************************/
8210 /* */
8211 /* */
8212 /******************************************************************/
8213 
8214 // @script | ScreenShot | save a screenshot with specified filename
8215 // @parmopt string | filename | screen | place to save screenshot
8216 bool ScriptScreenShot(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
8217 {
8218  const char *fileName;
8219  bool ret;
8220 
8221  ret = pParams->GetText( "filename", &fileName );
8222  if ( !ret )
8223  fileName = "screen";
8224 
8225  Gfx::Manager * gfx_manager = Gfx::Manager::Instance();
8226  gfx_manager->ScreenShot( fileName );
8227 
8228  return true;
8229 }
8230 
8231 /******************************************************************/
8232 /* */
8233 /* */
8234 /******************************************************************/
8235 // @script | DumpShots | dump memory card screenshots to PC
8236 bool ScriptDumpShots(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
8237 {
8238  #ifdef __PLAT_NGPS__
8239  Gfx::Manager * gfx_manager = Gfx::Manager::Instance();
8240  gfx_manager->DumpMemcardScreeenshots( );
8241  #endif
8242 
8243  return true;
8244 }
8245

8254 {

8257  pScript->SwitchOnIfDebugging();
8258  return true;
8259 }

8271  pScript->SwitchOffIfDebugging();
8272  return true;
8273 }

8341 bool ScriptGunslinger(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
