11185 // @parm string | string | initials string
11186 bool ScriptSetInitialsString( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11187 {
11188

11197 /******************************************************************/
11198 /* */
11199 /* */
11200 /******************************************************************/
11201 
11202 // @script | AttachToSkater | (DEPRECATED) Make the current script be running on the skater <nl>
11203 // used for the gameflow, where we are not always sure if there is a skater there <nl>
11204 // use this in place of SpawnSkaterScript in the gameflow <nl>
11205 // if "AttachToSkater End" is called then will detatch it <nl>
11206 // must be in mathcing pairs <nl>
11207 // otherwise the gameflow gets messed up <nl>
11208 // when the skater is deleted (as the gameflow gets stopped and deleted) <nl>
11209 // @flag End |
11210 bool ScriptAttachToSkater( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11211 {
11212 
11213  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("ScriptAttachToSkater should not be called, as it is old and dangerous\n"));
11214 
11215  if (pParams->ContainsFlag("End"))
11216  {
11217  pScript->mpObject = NULL;
11218  }
11219  else
11220  {
11221  Mdl::Skate * skate_mod = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
11222  Obj::CSkater *pSkater = skate_mod->GetLocalSkater();
11223  Dbg_MsgAssert(pSkater,("AttachToSkater called before skater exists"));
11224  pScript->mpObject = pSkater;
11225  }
11226  return true;
11227 }
11228 
11229 /******************************************************************/
11230 /* */
11231 /* */
11232 /******************************************************************/
11233 
11234 // @script | TryCheatString |
11235 // @parm string | string | cheat string to try
11236 bool ScriptTryCheatString( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11237 {
11238 
11239  char b[128];
11240  const char *p;
11241  pParams->GetText("string",&p,true);
11242  if (strlen(p) < 6)
11243  {
11244  Script::RunScript("cheat_playsound_bad");
11245  return false;
11246  }
11247 
11248  sprintf(b,"12345678901234567890"); // just in case.....
11249  sprintf(b,p);
11250 
11251  // (Mick)
11252  // We want to generate a 64 bit CRC
11253  // so we take 3 checksums, starting from 3 different places
11254  // and add the first one to the second two
11255  // and use those two numbers as a 64 bit checksum
11256  // The idea here is to create a number, from which is is difficult to
11257  // go back to the original string
11258  // (to do this, you need a fairlry long string, otherwise, you could just try them all
11259  // now we do 1 second worth of PS2 precessing the generate the key,
11260  // so even on a computer 1000 times as fast, it would take ~30 years to try all six letter keys
11261  // So, barring a flaw in my algorithm, should be pretty safe even with short keys
11262 
11263  uint32 check0 = Script::GenerateCRC(p); // get checksum
11264 
11265  uint32 check1 = 0;
11266  for (int i = 0;i< 100000;i++) // a hundred thousand calls, to mess with Ken
11267  {
11268  sprintf (b,"%d",i+check0); // print a different number at the start
11269  b[strlen(b)]='X'; // link it to the rest of the string
11270  char *p1 = b;
11271  while (*p1)
11272  {
11273  check1 += 1023 * (*p1++); // and just add up the bytes, oh, how sweet...
11274  }
11275  check0 = Script::GenerateCRC(b); // oh, I slay myself...
11276  }
11277  uint32 check2 = Script::GenerateCRC(&p[strlen(p)/3]);
11278  uint32 check3 = Script::GenerateCRC(b); // use the final string, so no correlation with check2
11279 
11280 // printf ("%x,%x,%x\n",check1,check2,check3); // three pretty dang random looking numbers
11281 
11282  check2 ^= check1; // munched into two
11283  check3 ^= check1; // (hopefully not a fatal mistake)
11284 
11285 // printf ("%x,%x,%x\n",check1,check2,check3);
11286  // Print it out, so we can cut and paste
11287  printf ("\n{c1=%d c2=%d CheatScript=cheat_xxx }, ; %s\n\n",check2, check3,p);
11288  // then search through the cheat array to see if we have a match
11289 
11290 
11291  #ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
11292  Script::CArray *pCheatArray = Script::GetArray( "Cheat_Array_Xbox" );
11293  #endif
11294  #ifdef __PLAT_NGC__
11295  Script::CArray *pCheatArray = Script::GetArray( "Cheat_Array_Gamecube" );
11296  #endif
11297  #ifdef __PLAT_NGPS__
11298  Script::CArray *pCheatArray = Script::GetArray( "Cheat_Array_PS2" );
11299  #endif
11300 
11301  Dbg_MsgAssert( pCheatArray,( "No Cheat_Array found" ));
11302  int cheats = pCheatArray->GetSize();
11303  bool cheated = false;
11304  for (int cheat = 0;cheat<cheats;cheat++)
11305  {
11306  Script::CStruct *pStruct = pCheatArray->GetStructure(cheat);
11307  Dbg_MsgAssert( pStruct,( "Cheat Array messed up" ));
11308  uint32 c1,c2;
11309  uint32 cheat_script;
11310  pStruct->GetInteger("c1",(int*)&c1,true);
11311  pStruct->GetInteger("c2",(int*)&c2,true);
11312  pStruct->GetChecksum("cheatscript",&cheat_script,true);
11313  if (c1 == check2 && c2 == check3)
11314  {
11315  Script::RunScript("cheat_playsound_good");
11316  Script::RunScript(cheat_script);
11317  cheated = true;
11318  }
11319  }
11320 
11321  if (!cheated)
11322  {
11323  Script::RunScript("cheat_playsound_bad");
11324  }
11325 
11326 
11327 
11328  return false;
11329 }
11330 
11331 /******************************************************************/
11332 /* */
11333 /* */
11334 /******************************************************************/
11335 
11336 // @script | LevelIs | true if the level matches the specified level
11337 // @uparm name | level name
11338 bool ScriptLevelIs( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11339 {
11340 
11341 
11342  Mdl::Skate * skate_mod = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
11343 
11344  // GJ: this may not work in park editor mode
11345  uint32 level_name;
11346  pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &level_name, true );
11347 
11348  return ( skate_mod->m_cur_level == level_name );
11349 }

11367 /* */
11368 /******************************************************************/
11369 
11370 // @script | ObserversAllowed |
11371 bool ScriptObserversAllowed( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11372 {
11373  Net::Manager * net_man = Net::Manager::Instance();
11374 
11375  // Modem games cannot host observers
11376  return( net_man->GetConnectionType() != Net::vCONN_TYPE_MODEM );
11377 }
11378 
11379 /******************************************************************/
11380 /* */
11381 /* */
11382 /******************************************************************/
11383 
11384 // @script | NumPlayersAllowed |
11385 // @uparm name | number of players allowed
11386 bool ScriptNumPlayersAllowed( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11387 {
11388 
11389 
11390  uint32 checksum = 0;
11391  Net::Manager * net_man = Net::Manager::Instance();
11392 
11393  // Non-Modem games have no max player restriction
11394  if( net_man->GetConnectionType() != Net::vCONN_TYPE_MODEM )
11395  {
11396  return true;
11397  }
11398 
11399  pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &checksum );
11400  if( checksum == Script::GenerateCRC( "num_4" ))
11401  {
11402  return false;
11403  }
11404 
11405  return true;
11406 }
11407 
11408 /******************************************************************/
11409 /* */
11410 /* */
11411 /******************************************************************/
11412 
11413 // @script | AutoDNS | true if auto DNS
11414 bool ScriptAutoDNS( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11415 {
11416  GameNet::Manager * gamenet_man = GameNet::Manager::Instance();
11417  Script::CStruct* pStructure;
11418  Prefs::Preferences* pPreferences;
11419  uint32 auto_dns_checksum;
11420 
11421  pPreferences = gamenet_man->GetNetworkPreferences();
11422 
11423  pStructure = pPreferences->GetPreference( Script::GenerateCRC("auto_dns") );
11424  pStructure->GetChecksum( "Checksum", &auto_dns_checksum, true );
11425  return ( auto_dns_checksum == Script::GenerateCRC( "boolean_true" ));
11426 }
11427 
11428 /******************************************************************/
11429 /* */
11430 /* */
11431 /******************************************************************/
11432 
11433 // @script | UsingDefaultMasterServers | true if using the default master
11434 // servers
11435 bool ScriptUsingDefaultMasterServers( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11436 {
11437  GameNet::Manager * gamenet_man = GameNet::Manager::Instance();
11438  Script::CStruct* pStructure;
11439  Prefs::Preferences* pPreferences;
11440  uint32 default_servers;
11441 
11442  pPreferences = gamenet_man->GetNetworkPreferences();
11443 
11444  pStructure = pPreferences->GetPreference( Script::GenerateCRC("use_default_master_servers") );
11445  pStructure->GetChecksum( "Checksum", &default_servers, true );
11446  return ( default_servers == Script::GenerateCRC( "boolean_true" ));
11447 }
11448

11450 /* */
11451 /* */
11452 /******************************************************************/
11453 
11454 // @script | UsingDHCP | true if using DHCP
11455 bool ScriptUsingDHCP( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11456 {
11457  GameNet::Manager * gamenet_man = GameNet::Manager::Instance();
11458  Script::CStruct* pStructure;
11459  Prefs::Preferences* pPreferences;
11460  uint32 ip_assignment;
11461 
11462  pPreferences = gamenet_man->GetNetworkPreferences();
11463 
11464  pStructure = pPreferences->GetPreference( Script::GenerateCRC("broadband_type") );
11465  pStructure->GetChecksum( "Checksum", &ip_assignment, true );
11466  return ( ip_assignment == Script::GenerateCRC( "ip_dhcp" ));
11467 }

11481 
11482 /******************************************************************/
11483 /* */
11484 /* */
11485 /******************************************************************/
11486 
11487 // @script | EnteringNetGame | true if we're in a network game but not
11488 // read to play
11489 bool ScriptEnteringNetGame( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11490 {
11491  GameNet::Manager * gamenet_man = GameNet::Manager::Instance();
11492  Mdl::Skate * skate_mod = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
11493 
11494  return(( gamenet_man->InNetGame()) &&
11495  ( skate_mod->m_prev_level == Script::GenerateCRC( "Load_Skateshop" )));
11496 }
11497 
11498 /******************************************************************/
11499 /* */
11500 /* */
11501 /******************************************************************/
11502 
11503 // @script | DeviceChosen | true if a device type has been chosen
11504 bool ScriptDeviceChosen( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11505 {
11506  GameNet::Manager * gamenet_man = GameNet::Manager::Instance();
11507  uint32 checksum;
11508  Prefs::Preferences* pPreferences;
11509  Script::CStruct* pStructure;
11510 
11511  pPreferences = gamenet_man->GetNetworkPreferences();
11512  Dbg_Assert( pPreferences );
11513 
11514  pStructure = pPreferences->GetPreference( Script::GenerateCRC("device_type") );
11515  pStructure->GetChecksum( "checksum", &checksum, true );
11516 
11517  return ( checksum != Script::GenerateCRC("device_none"));
11518 }
11519

11522 /* */
11523 /* */
11524 /******************************************************************/

11526 // @script | GameIsOver | true if game is over
11527 bool ScriptGameIsOver( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11528 {
11529  GameNet::Manager * gamenet_man = GameNet::Manager::Instance();
11530 
11531  return gamenet_man->GameIsOver();
11532 }
11533 
11534 static char s_level_name[64];
11535 
11536 /******************************************************************/
11537 /* */
11538 /* */
11539 /******************************************************************/
11540 
11541 // @script | SetLevelName | gets the level name into the above static, so it can be used for the DumpHeaps memory profile dump
11542 bool ScriptSetLevelName( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11543 {
11544  const char* pName;
11545  pParams->GetText( NONAME, &pName, true );
11546  sprintf(s_level_name,pName);
11547  return true;
11548 }
11549 
11550 /******************************************************************/
11551 /* */
11552 /* */
11553 /******************************************************************/
11554 
11555 // @script | ResetPS2 | For testing the reset button handler when
11556 // the Sony Network adapter is loaded
11557 bool ScriptResetPS2( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11558 {
11559 
11560 # ifdef __PLAT_NGPS__
11561  int stat;
11562 
11563  Dbg_Printf( "Resetting PS2\n" );
11564 
11565  while( sceDevctl("dev9x:", DDIOC_OFF, NULL, 0, NULL, 0 ) < 0 );
11566  // PS2 power off
11567  while( !sceCdPowerOff( &stat ) || stat );
11568 # endif // __PLAT_NGPS__
11569 
11570  return true;
11571 }
11572 
11573 /******************************************************************/
11574 /* */
11575 /* */
11576 /******************************************************************/
11577 
11578 // @script | ResetHD | For testing the reset button handler when
11579 // the Sony Network adapter is loaded
11580 bool ScriptResetHD( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11581 {
11582  Dbg_Printf( "Resetting PS2\n" );
11583 
11584 # ifdef __PLAT_NGPS__
11585  int stat;
11586  sceDevctl("pfs:", PDIOC_CLOSEALL, NULL, 0, NULL, 0);
11587  while (sceDevctl("hdd:", HDIOC_DEV9OFF, NULL, 0, NULL, 0) < 0);
11588  while (sceDevctl("dev9x:", DDIOC_OFF, NULL, 0, NULL, 0) < 0);
11589  while (!sceCdPowerOff(&stat) || stat);
11590 # endif
11591 
11592  return true;
11593 }
11594 
11595 /******************************************************************/
11596 /* */
11597 /* */
11598 /******************************************************************/
11599 
11600 // @script | PAL | returns true if we're in PAL mode
11601 bool ScriptPAL( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11602 {
11603 
11604 #ifdef PAL
11605  return true;
11606 #else
11607  return false;
11608 #endif
11609 }
11610 
11611 /******************************************************************/
11612 /* */
11613 /* */
11614 /******************************************************************/
11615 
11616 // @script | Change | changes the symbol to the new value specified. will do nothing
11617 // if called on the following: a symbol that doesn't already exist, a script symbol, c-function
11618 // or member function symbols <nl>
11619 // should really only be called on strings, floats, and ints <nl>
11620 // example: Change Foo=7
11621 // @uparm name | the name of the symbol to change
11622 // @uparm value | the value to assign to the symbol (make sure type is correct)
11623 // @flag Resolve | If specified, resolve the right hand side if it is a name of a global, so as to lose
11624 // the reference to that global. Ie, Change a=b Resolve where a=6 and b=3.141 will change a to be 3.141,
11625 // and it will remain so even if b is then changed to something else.
11626 bool ScriptChangeSymbolValue(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
11627 {
11628  // Extract the first component from pParams, which is used to define the name of the
11629  // symbol to change and the new value to give to it.
11630  CComponent *pComp=pParams->GetNextComponent();
11631  Dbg_MsgAssert(pComp,("\n%s\nChange function requires a symbol name and new value, eg Change Foo=7",pScript->GetScriptInfo()));
11632  Dbg_MsgAssert(pComp->mNameChecksum,("\n%s\nChange function requires a symbol name and new value, eg Change Foo=7",pScript->GetScriptInfo()));
11633  if (!pComp)
11634  {
11635  return false;
11636  }
11637 
11638  // Do a few checks on the old symbol.
11639  CSymbolTableEntry *pOld=Script::LookUpSymbol(pComp->mNameChecksum);
11640 
11641  // Require that the old symbol must exist, otherwise continuing will create the symbol and it will never get deleted,
11642  // causing fragmentation & memory leaks etc.
11643  if (!pOld)
11644  {
11645  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("\n%s\nTried to change the value of the non-existent symbol '%s'",pScript->GetScriptInfo(),FindChecksumName(pComp->mNameChecksum)));
11646  return false;
11647  }
11648  // Don't allow script symbols to be changed. If this were allowed then all existing CScripts that were running that
11649  // script would have to get halted to avoid their PC's becoming invalid, which would require some extra code
11650  // and seems kind of a silly thing to want to do anyway.
11651  if (pOld->mType==ESYMBOLTYPE_QSCRIPT)
11652  {
11653  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("\n%s\nTried to change the value of the script '%s'",pScript->GetScriptInfo(),FindChecksumName(pComp->mNameChecksum)));
11654  return false;
11655  }
11656  // Don't allow c-function or member function symbols to be changed, cos once changed they'll never be able to be put back.
11657  if (pOld->mType==ESYMBOLTYPE_CFUNCTION)
11658  {
11659  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("\n%s\nTried to change the value of the c-function '%s'",pScript->GetScriptInfo(),FindChecksumName(pComp->mNameChecksum)));
11660  return false;
11661  }
11662  if (pOld->mType==ESYMBOLTYPE_MEMBERFUNCTION)
11663  {
11664  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("\n%s\nTried to change the value of the member function '%s'",pScript->GetScriptInfo(),FindChecksumName(pComp->mNameChecksum)));
11665  return false;
11666  }
11667 
11668  // Hmmm, in theory other types could be changed, but they shouldn't be cos it'll cause fragmentation.
11669  switch (pOld->mType)
11670  {
11671  case ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER:
11672  case ESYMBOLTYPE_FLOAT:
11673  case ESYMBOLTYPE_NAME:
11674  break;
11675  default:
11676  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("\n%s\nCannot change the value of '%s' because it has type '%s', and reallocating it will cause memory fragmentation. So there.",pScript->GetScriptInfo(),FindChecksumName(pComp->mNameChecksum),GetTypeName(pOld->mType)));
11677  break;
11678  }
11679 
11680  // Remove the old symbol.
11681  Script::CleanUpAndRemoveSymbol(pOld);
11682 
11683  // Create it afresh.
11684  CSymbolTableEntry *pNew=Script::CreateNewSymbolEntry(pComp->mNameChecksum);
11685 
11686  CComponent temp;
11687  temp.mType=pComp->mType;
11688  temp.mUnion=pComp->mUnion;
11689 
11690  // If they are changing a value to some name, then support the option of resolving that name,
11691  // in case it might be a global.
11692  // For example, suppose a=6, and b=3.141
11693  // 'Change a=b' will change a from 6 to the checksum b. This means it will preserve the reference to b,
11694  // so in the C code if a GetFloat("a") is done it will return 3.141, but if b is changed to 28.3,
11695  // GetFloat("a") will now return 28.3, because it preserves the reference to b.
11696  // However, 'Change a=b Resolve' will change a to be the float 3.141. Even if b is now changed, a has
11697  // lost the reference to b and will stay as 3.141.
11698  if (temp.mType==ESYMBOLTYPE_NAME)
11699  {
11700  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x991a7bc3,"Resolve")))
11701  {
11702  CSymbolTableEntry *p_global=Script::Resolve(temp.mChecksum);
11703  if (p_global)
11704  {
11705  temp.mType=p_global->mType;
11706  temp.mUnion=p_global->mUnion;
11707  }
11708  }
11709  }
11710 
11711  // Copy the new value into the symbol just created.
11712  switch (temp.mType)
11713  {
11714  case ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER:
11715  pNew->mType=ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER;
11716  pNew->mIntegerValue=temp.mIntegerValue;
11717  break;
11718 
11719  case ESYMBOLTYPE_FLOAT:
11720  pNew->mType=ESYMBOLTYPE_FLOAT;
11721  pNew->mFloatValue=temp.mFloatValue;
11722  break;
11723 
11724  case ESYMBOLTYPE_NAME:
11725  pNew->mType=ESYMBOLTYPE_NAME;
11726  pNew->mChecksum=temp.mChecksum;
11727  break;
11728 
11729  default:
11730  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("\n%s\nChange function does not support component type '%s'",pScript->GetScriptInfo(),GetTypeName(temp.mType)));
11731  break;
11732  }
11733 
11734  // This is to prevent an assert in the CComponent destructor
11735  temp.mUnion=0;
11736 
11737  return true;
11738 }
11739 
11740 /******************************************************************/
11741 /* */
11742 /* */
11743 /******************************************************************/
11744 
11745 // @script | DumpScripts | Prints out the names of all the currently existing scripts.
11746 bool ScriptDumpScripts( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11747 {
11748  bool just_stack = pParams->ContainsFlag("just_stack");
11749 
11750  if (!just_stack)
11751  Script::DumpScripts();
11752 
11753  // XXX
11754  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
11755  printf("Script stack is: %s\n", pScript->GetScriptInfo());
11756  #endif
11757 
11758  return true;
11759 }
11760 
11761 /******************************************************************/
11762 /* */
11763 /* */
11764 /******************************************************************/
11765 
11766 // @script | TimeUp | true if time is up
11767 bool ScriptTimeUp( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
11768 {
11769  Mdl::Skate * skate_mod = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
11770 
11771  return skate_mod->GetGameMode()->ShouldUseClock() && ( skate_mod->GetGameMode()->GetTimeLeft() <= 0 );
11772 }
11773 
11774 /******************************************************************/
11775 /* */
11776 /* */
11777 /******************************************************************/
11778 
11779 // @script | LaunchViewer |
11780 bool ScriptLaunchViewer( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
11781 {
11782  Mdl::Manager * mdl_manager = Mdl::Manager::Instance();
11783  Mdl::CViewer* viewer_mod;
11784  static bool initialized = false;
11785 
11786  if( initialized )
11787  {
11788  return true;
11789  }
11790 
11791  viewer_mod = new Mdl::CViewer;
11792 
11793  mdl_manager->RegisterModule ( *viewer_mod );
11794  mdl_manager->StartModule( *viewer_mod );
11795  initialized = true;
11796 
11797 
11798  // Add the parameters for the skater camera component
11799  // so it can get me as the target
11800  Script::CStruct * p_cam_params = new Script::CStruct;
11801  p_cam_params->AddChecksum("name",CRCD(0xeb17151b,"viewer_cam"));
11802 
11803  // Also create the camera components here.
11804  Obj::CCompositeObject *p_cam_object = Obj::CCompositeObjectManager::Instance()->CreateCompositeObjectFromNode(
11805  Script::GetArray("viewercam_composite_structure"),p_cam_params);
11806 
11807  delete p_cam_params;
11808  p_cam_object->SetLockOn(); // Lock it so it does not get deleted between levels
11809 
11810 
11811  return true;
11812 }
11813 
11814 // @script | LaunchViewer |
11815 bool ScriptLaunchScriptDebugger( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
11816 {
11817  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
11818  static bool initialized = false;
11819 
11820  if( initialized )
11821  {
11822  return true;
11823  }
11824 
11825  Mdl::Manager::Instance()->StartModule( *Dbg::CScriptDebugger::Instance() );
11826 
11827  initialized = true;
11828  #endif
11829 
11830  return true;
11831 }
11832 
11833 /******************************************************************/
11834 /* */
11835 /* */
11836 /******************************************************************/
11837 
11838 // @script | SetViewerModel |
11839 bool ScriptSetViewerModel( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
11840 {
11841  Mdl::CViewer* pViewer = Mdl::CViewer::sGetViewer();
11842 
11843  s_view_mode = (int)Obj::VIEWER_SKATER_PAUSED;
11844 
11845  // sync the viewer up to cfuncs.cpp's version of s_view_mode
11846  pViewer->sSetViewMode( s_view_mode );
11847  // Handle toggling to different cameras based on view mode
11848 
11849  switch (s_view_mode )
11850  {
11851  case Obj::GAMEPLAY_SKATER_ACTIVE:
11852  SetActiveCamera(CRCD(0x967c138c,"skatercam0"),0, false);
11853  break;
11854  default:
11855  SetActiveCamera(CRCD(0xeb17151b,"viewer_cam"),0, true);
11856  break;
11857  }
11858 
11859 
11860  Obj::CSkater* pSkater;
11861  for ( int i = 0; i < 8; i++ )
11862  {
11863  Mdl::Skate * skate_mod = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
11864  pSkater = skate_mod->GetSkater(i);
11865  if ( pSkater ) // Skater might not exist
11866  {
11867  pSkater->SetViewMode( (Obj::EViewMode)s_view_mode );
11868  }
11869  }
11870 
11871  if ( pViewer )
11872  {
11873  pViewer->ResetCameraToViewerObject();
11874 
11875  Script::PrintContents(pParams);
11876 
11877  pViewer->AddViewerObject(pParams);
11878 
11879  /*
11880  Obj::CViewerObject* pViewerObject = pViewer->GetViewerObject();
11881  if ( pViewerObject )
11882  {
11883  pViewerObject->UnloadModel();
11884 
11885  pViewerObject->LoadModel( pParams );
11886  }
11887  */
11888  }
11889 
11890  return true;
11891 }
11892 
11893 /******************************************************************/
11894 /* */
11895 /* */
11896 /******************************************************************/
11897 
11898 // @script | SetViewerAnim |
11899 bool ScriptSetViewerAnim( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
11900 {
11901  Mdl::CViewer* pViewer = Mdl::CViewer::sGetViewer();
11902 
11903  if ( pViewer )
11904  {
11905  uint32 animName;
11906  pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &animName, true );
11907 
11908  Obj::CViewerObject* pViewerObject = pViewer->GetViewerObject();
11909  if ( pViewerObject )
11910  {
11911  pViewerObject->SetAnim( animName );
11912  }
11913  }
11914 
11915  return true;
11916 }
11917 
11918 /******************************************************************/
11919 /* */
11920 /* */
11921 /******************************************************************/
11922 
11923 // @script | ScriptSetViewerLODDist |
11924 bool ScriptSetViewerLODDist( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
11925 {
11926  Mdl::CViewer* pViewer = Mdl::CViewer::sGetViewer();
11927 
11928  if ( pViewer )
11929  {
11930  Script::CPair thePair;
11931  if ( !pParams->GetPair( NONAME, &thePair, Script::NO_ASSERT ) )
11932  {
11933  Dbg_Message( "Looking for pair in the format: SetViewerLODDist (1,500.0f)" );
11934  return false;
11935  }
11936 
11937  Obj::CViewerObject* pViewerObject = pViewer->GetViewerObject();
11938  if ( pViewerObject )
11939  {
11940  GetModelComponentFromObject( pViewerObject )->SetModelLODDistance( (int)thePair.mX, thePair.mY );
11941  }
11942  }
11943 
11944  return true;
11945 }
11946 
11947 /******************************************************************/
11948 /* */
11949 /* */
11950 /******************************************************************/
11951 
11952 bool ScriptGetViewerObjectID( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
11953 {
11954  // clear out the viewer object, if any
11955  Mdl::CViewer* pViewer = Mdl::CViewer::sGetViewer();
11956  if ( pViewer )
11957  {
11958  Obj::CCompositeObject* pViewerObject = pViewer->GetViewerObject();
11959  pScript->GetParams()->AddChecksum( CRCD(0x0830ecaf,"objID"), pViewerObject->GetID() );
11960  pScript->GetParams()->AddChecksum( CRCD(0x52280066,"viewerObjectId"), pViewerObject->GetID() );
11961  }
11962 
11963  return true;
11964 }
11965 
11966 /******************************************************************/
11967 /* */
11968 /* */
11969 /******************************************************************/
11970 
11971 bool ScriptReloadViewerAnim( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
11972 {
11973  Mdl::CViewer* pViewer = Mdl::CViewer::sGetViewer();
11974 
11975  if ( pViewer )
11976  {
11977  Obj::CViewerObject* pViewerObject = pViewer->GetViewerObject();
11978  if ( pViewerObject )
11979  {
11980  uint32 animName;
11981  const char* fileName;
11982 
11983  if ( pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &animName )
11984  && pParams->GetText( NONAME, &fileName ) )
11985  {
11986  pViewerObject->ReloadAnim( fileName, animName );
11987  }
11988  else
11989  {
11990  Dbg_Message( "Need 2 parameters to viewer anim: filename string, and anim checksum" );
11991  }
11992  }
11993  }
11994 
11995  return true;
11996 }
11997 
11998 /******************************************************************/
11999 /* */
12000 /* */
12001 /******************************************************************/
12002 
12003 // @script | AddRestartsToMenu | adds all restart points to the menu
12004 bool ScriptAddRestartsToMenu( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12005 {
12006 
12007  Script::CStruct* p_restart_params;
12008  int node = -1;
12009  int entry = 0;
12010  do
12011  {
12012  node = Obj::GetRestartNode(0, 0, node);
12013  if (node != -1)
12014  {
12015  Script::CArray *pNodeArray=Script::GetArray(CRCD(0xc472ecc5,"NodeArray"));
12016  Script::CScriptStructure *pNode=pNodeArray->GetStructure(node);
12017  const char *pName;
12018  if (!pNode->GetText("RestartName",&pName))
12019  {
12020  pName = "Unnamed restart";
12021  }
12022  p_restart_params = new Script::CStruct;
12023  p_restart_params->AddString("text",pName);
12024  p_restart_params->AddChecksum("id",123456 + entry);
12025  p_restart_params->AddChecksum("no_bg",CRCD(0x9f67b2c8,"no_bg"));
12026  p_restart_params->AddChecksum("centered",CRCD(0x2a434d05,"centered"));
12027  p_restart_params->AddChecksum("pad_choose_script",Script::GenerateCRC("skip_to_selected_restart"));
12028 
12029  // create the parameters that are passed to the X script
12030  Script::CStruct *p_script_params= new Script::CStruct;
12031  p_script_params->AddInteger("node_number",node);
12032  p_restart_params->AddStructure("pad_choose_params",p_script_params);
12033 
12034  /*if (!Script::GetInt("SimpleRestarts",false))
12035  {
12036  p_restart_params->AddChecksum("focus_script",Script::GenerateCRC("preview_restart"));
12037  // also pass it too the Focus script
12038  p_restart_params->AddStructure("focus_params",p_script_params);
12039  }*/
12040 
12041  // scale the restarts
12042  float initial_scale;
12043  pParams->GetFloat( "initial_scale", &initial_scale, Script::ASSERT );
12044  p_restart_params->AddFloat( "scale", initial_scale );
12045  //p_restart_params->AddChecksum( "unfocus_script", Script::GenerateCRC( "scale_down_restart" ) );
12046 
12047  Script::RunScript("theme_menu_add_item",p_restart_params);
12048  delete p_restart_params;
12049  delete p_script_params;
12050 
12051  entry++;
12052  }
12053  } while (node != -1);
12054 
12055  if (entry == 0)
12056  {
12057  p_restart_params = new Script::CStruct;
12058  p_restart_params->AddString("text","No restarts in level");
12059  p_restart_params->AddChecksum("id",123456 + entry);
12060  p_restart_params->AddChecksum("no_bg",CRCD(0x9f67b2c8,"no_bg"));
12061  p_restart_params->AddChecksum("centered",CRCD(0x2a434d05,"centered"));
12062  p_restart_params->AddChecksum("pad_choose_script",Script::GenerateCRC("skip_to_selected_restart"));
12063  Script::RunScript("theme_menu_add_item",p_restart_params);
12064  delete p_restart_params;
12065  }
12066 
12067 
12068 
12069 
12070 
12071  return true;
12072 }
12073 
12074 /******************************************************************/
12075 /* */
12076 /* */
12077 /******************************************************************/
12078 
12079 bool ScriptAddWarpPointsToMenu( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript ) {
12080  Script::CStruct* p_restart_params;
12081 
12082  // grab array of warp points
12083  Script::CArray *p_Array = NULL;
12084 
12085  pParams->GetArray( "nodes", &p_Array );
12086  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_Array, ("AddWarpPointsToMenu requires an array of nodes"));
12087  // better only be names
12088  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_Array->GetType()==ESYMBOLTYPE_NAME,("\n%s\nnodes: Array must be of names",pScript->GetScriptInfo()));
12089 
12090 
12091  // add nodes to menu
12092  for (uint32 i=0; i<p_Array->GetSize(); ++i) {
12093  // Obj_MoveToNode name = <nodename> Orient NoReset
12094 
12095  p_restart_params = new Script::CStruct;
12096 
12097  Script::CScriptStructure *pNode = SkateScript::GetNode( SkateScript::FindNamedNode( p_Array->GetChecksum( i ) ) );
12098  const char *pName;
12099  if (!pNode->GetText("RestartName",&pName))
12100  {
12101  pName = "Unnamed restart";
12102  }
12103 
12104  p_restart_params->AddString( "text", pName );
12105  p_restart_params->AddChecksum("pad_choose_script",Script::GenerateCRC("WarpSkater"));
12106 
12107  // create the parameters that are passed to the script
12108  Script::CStruct *p_script_params = new Script::CStruct;
12109  p_script_params->AddChecksum( "nodename", p_Array->GetChecksum( i ) );
12110  p_restart_params->AddStructure( "pad_choose_params", p_script_params );
12111 
12112  Script::RunScript( "make_text_sub_menu_item", p_restart_params );
12113  delete p_restart_params;
12114 
12115  }
12116  return true;
12117 }
12118 
12119 /******************************************************************/
12120 /* */
12121 /* */
12122 /******************************************************************/
12123 
12124 // @script | ScriptRunScriptOnObject | allows you to access Obj_ type functions, from a global script
12125 bool ScriptRunScriptOnObject( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12126 {
12127  // searches for object by name
12128 
12129  uint32 obj_id;
12130  pParams->GetChecksum("id", &obj_id, true);
12131 
12132  uint32 scriptName;
12133  pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME, &scriptName, true);
12134 
12135  Script::CStruct* pSubParams = NULL;
12136  pParams->GetStructure(CRCD(0x7031f10c,"params"), &pSubParams);
12137 
12138  pScript->GetParams()->RemoveComponent(CRCD(0xa2b033fd,"UniqueID"));
12139 
12140  // this returns all objects, not just game objects and peds
12141  Obj::CObject* pObject = Obj::ResolveToObject( obj_id );
12142 
12143  if ( pObject )
12144  {
12145  /*
12146  Script::CScript *pNewScript=Script::SpawnScript(scriptName,pSubParams,0,NULL,scriptName);
12147  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
12148  pNewScript->SetCommentString("Spawned by script command RunScriptOnObject");
12149  pNewScript->SetOriginatingScriptInfo(pScript->GetCurrentLineNumber(),pScript->mScriptChecksum);
12150  #endif
12151 
12152  pNewScript->mpObject = pObject;
12153 
12154  pScript->GetParams()->AddChecksum("UniqueID",pNewScript->GetUniqueId());
12155 // Script::RunScript( scriptName, pSubParams, obj_and_id.pObj );
12156 
12157  */
12158 
12159  if (pObject->GetScript())
12160  {
12161  // (Mick) If this object has a script, but it's got a NULL mpObject
12162  // that means that script has been cleared in the current game loop
12163  // but not got around to being deleted.
12164  // it's quite safe to re-use it, we just need to set the object on it
12165  if (pObject->GetScript()->mpObject == NULL)
12166  {
12167  pObject->GetScript()->mpObject = pObject;
12168  }
12169 
12170  Dbg_MsgAssert(pObject->GetScript()->mpObject == pObject,("%s\nscript object %p not same as object %p",pScript->GetScriptInfo(),pObject->GetScript()->mpObject.Convert(),pObject));
12171  }
12172  // (Mick) Instead of spawning a script, call it on the main script
12173  // Which allows us to set exceptions and event handlers
12174  // It's also a lot quicker
12175  // (Might be problem with parameter conflicts?)
12176  pObject->CallScript(scriptName, pSubParams);
12177 
12178 
12179  return true;
12180 
12181 
12182  }
12183  else
12184  {
12185  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
12186  printf( "Warning: Couldn't find object %s on which to run script %s\n", Script::FindChecksumName(obj_id), Script::FindChecksumName(scriptName) );
12187  #endif
12188  }
12189 
12190  return false;
12191 }
12192 
12193 /******************************************************************/
12194 /* */
12195 /* */
12196 /******************************************************************/
12197 
12198 // @script | RunScriptOnComponentType |
12199 bool ScriptRunScriptOnComponentType( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
12200 {
12201  uint32 componentType;
12202  pParams->GetChecksum( CRCD(0xb6015ea8,"component"), &componentType, Script::ASSERT );
12203 
12204  uint32 target;
12205  pParams->GetChecksum( CRCD(0xb990d003,"target"), &target, Script::ASSERT );
12206 
12207  Script::CStruct* pSubParams = NULL;
12208  pParams->GetStructure( CRCD(0x7031f10c,"params"), &pSubParams, Script::NO_ASSERT );
12209 
12210  // new fast way, just go directly to the components, if any
12211  Obj::CBaseComponent *p_component = Obj::CCompositeObjectManager::Instance()->GetFirstComponentByType( componentType );
12212  while( p_component )
12213  {
12214  p_component->CallMemberFunction( target, pSubParams, pScript );
12215 
12216  p_component = p_component->GetNextSameType();
12217  }
12218 
12219  return true;
12220 }
12221 
12222 /******************************************************************/
12223 /* */
12224 /* */
12225 /******************************************************************/
12226 
12227 // @script | Debounce | This will ignore the specified button
12228 // until either the time has elapsed, or the button has been
12229 // released and subsequently re-pressed.
12230 // For X, this prevents the press of X from carrying over from one
12231 // screen to the next, and removes the need to have a delay,
12232 // whilst still allowing the user to actively X past things
12233 // @uparm X | button name
12234 // @parmopt float | time | 1.0 | time to wait (in seconds)
12235 // @parmopt int | clear | 0 | if 1, then clear the current pressed and triggered states
12236 
12237 bool ScriptDebounce( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12238 {
12239  uint32 ButtonChecksum=0;
12240  pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME,&ButtonChecksum);
12241  if (!ButtonChecksum)
12242  {
12243  return true;
12244  }
12245 
12246  float time=1.0f;
12247  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x906b67ba, "time"),&time);
12248 
12249  int clear = 0;
12250  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0x1a4e0ef9, "clear"),&clear);
12251 
12252  Obj::CInputComponent* p_input_component
12253  = static_cast< Obj::CInputComponent* >(Obj::CCompositeObjectManager::Instance()->GetFirstComponentByType(CRC_INPUT));
12254  while (p_input_component)
12255  {
12256  p_input_component->Debounce(ButtonChecksum, time, clear);
12257  p_input_component = static_cast< Obj::CInputComponent* >(p_input_component->GetNextSameType());
12258  }
12259 
12260  return true;
12261 }
12262 
12263 /******************************************************************/
12264 /* */
12265 /* */
12266 /******************************************************************/
12267 
12268 // @script | SetStatOverride | Set a global stat override for debugging
12269 // set it to 0 to use normal stats
12270 bool ScriptSetStatOverride( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12271 {
12272  float value = 0.0f;
12273  pParams->GetFloat(NONAME,&value);
12274  Mdl::Skate * skate_mod = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
12275  skate_mod->SetStatOverride(value);
12276  return true;
12277 }
12278

12280 /* */
12281 /* */
12282 /******************************************************************/
12283 
12284 // @script | ToggleRails | Toggle the debug display of rails on and off
12285 bool ScriptToggleRails( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12286 {
12287  Mdl::Skate * skate_mod = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
12288  skate_mod->SetDrawRails(!skate_mod->GetDrawRails());
12289  return true;
12290 }

12299 {
12300  Obj::CRigidBodyComponent::sToggleDrawRigidBodyDebugLines();
12301  return true;
12302 }

12316 /******************************************************************/
12317 /* */
12318 /* */
12319 /******************************************************************/
12320 
12321 // @script | OnXbox |
12322 bool ScriptOnXbox( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12323 {
12324 #ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
12325  return true;
12326 #else
12327  return false;
12328 #endif // __PLAT_XBOX__
12329 }
12330 
12331 /******************************************************************/
12332 /* */
12333 /* */
12334 /******************************************************************/
12335 
12336 // @script | GotoXboxDashboard |
12337 bool ScriptGotoXboxDashboard( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12338 {
12339 # ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
12340  LD_LAUNCH_DASHBOARD ld;
12341  ZeroMemory( &ld, sizeof(ld) );
12342 
12343  // In the case where we are rebooting to the memory management section of the dashboard,
12344  // this value should contain the total number of blocks needed.
12345  uint32 total_blocks_needed = 0;
12346 
12347  if( pParams->ContainsFlag( 0x1592cbca /*"memory"*/ ))
12348  {
12349  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0xb204db86,"total_blocks_needed"),(int*)&total_blocks_needed);
12350 
12351  ld.dwReason = XLD_LAUNCH_DASHBOARD_MEMORY;
12352  ld.dwParameter1 = 'U';
12353  ld.dwParameter2 = total_blocks_needed;
12354  }
12355  else
12356  {
12357  ld.dwReason = XLD_LAUNCH_DASHBOARD_MAIN_MENU;
12358  }
12359 
12360  XLaunchNewImage( NULL, PLAUNCH_DATA( &ld ) );
12361 # endif // __PLAT_XBOX__
12362 
12363  return true;
12364 }
12365 
12366 /******************************************************************/
12367 /* */
12368 /* */
12369 /******************************************************************/
12370 
12371 bool ScriptSystemLinkEnabled( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12372 {
12373 #ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
12374  DWORD result;
12375 
12376  result = XNetGetEthernetLinkStatus();
12377  if(( result & XNET_ETHERNET_LINK_ACTIVE ) == 0 )
12378  {
12379  return false;
12380  }
12381 #endif
12382  return true;
12383 }
12384 
12385 /******************************************************************/
12386 /* */
12387 /* */
12388 /******************************************************************/
12389 
12390 // Particle system functions.
12391 // @script | CreateParticleSystem | Creates a particle system.
12392 // @parm name | name | the name of the particle system. (Should be Particle_UnNamed if created from a node)
12393 // @parmopt int | max | 256 | maximum number of particles this system can display.
12394 // @parmopt name | texture | | the name of the texture to apply. No name means use flat shaded.
12395 // @parmopt name | emitscript | | the name of the script to call for emission.
12396 // @parmopt name | updatescript | | the name of the script to call to update position etc.
12397 // @parmopt name | blendmode | diffuse | The blendmode: blend/add/sub/modulate/brighten &
12398 // fixblend/fixadd/fixsub/fixmodulate/fixbrighten & diffuse (no blend at all). Defaults to diffuse.
12399 // @parmopt int | fix | 0 | Fixed alpha value. 128 is normal. Range is 0-255.
12400 // @parmopt name | params | | Sets a parameter block for use with the created particle scripts.
12401 // @parmopt name | type | flat | Sets the type of particle (flat/shaded/smooth/glow). Defaults to flat.
12402 // @parmopt int | segments | 8 | The number of segments in a segmented particle, such as 'Glow'.
12403 // @parmopt float | split | 0.5 | Sets the split point in a segmented particle. 0 = split at center. 1 means split at outer edge.
12404 // @parmopt int | history | 1 | Number of history lists to keep. Minimum is 1 when using trail particle types.
12405 // @parmopt int | perm | 0 | set to 1 if particle system stays between levels (like the skaters)
12406 // update script to grab bone/node positions when attaching.
12407 //
12408 //
12409 bool ScriptCreateParticleSystem( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12410 {
12411  uint32 name = 0;
12412  pParams->GetChecksum("Name",&name);
12413 
12414  int max = 256;
12415  pParams->GetInteger("Max",&max);
12416 
12417  int max_streams = 2;
12418  pParams->GetInteger("MaxStreams",&max_streams);
12419 
12420  uint32 texture = 0;
12421  pParams->GetChecksum("Texture",&texture);
12422 
12423  uint32 blendmode = 0x515e298e; // Defaults to diffuse.
12424  pParams->GetChecksum("blendmode",&blendmode);
12425 
12426  uint32 type = 0xaab555bb; // Defaults to flat.
12427  pParams->GetChecksum("type",&type);
12428 
12429  int fix = 0;
12430  pParams->GetInteger("fix",&fix);
12431 
12432  int segments = 8;
12433  pParams->GetInteger("segments",&segments);
12434 
12435  float split = 0.5f;
12436  pParams->GetFloat("split",&split);
12437 
12438  int history = 1;
12439  pParams->GetInteger("history",&history);
12440 
12441  int perm = 0;
12442  pParams->GetInteger("perm",&perm);
12443 
12444  // Create a particle. Will be internally added to the process list, so we don't need to do
12445  // anything after it has been created.
12446  Nx::CParticle * p_particle = Nx::create_particle( name, type, max, max_streams, texture, blendmode, fix, segments, split, history, perm );
12447 
12448  Script::CStruct* pSubParams = NULL;
12449  pParams->GetStructure( "params", &pSubParams, Script::NO_ASSERT );
12450 
12451  uint32 emitscript = 0;
12452  if ( pParams->GetChecksum("emitscript",&emitscript) )
12453  {
12454  p_particle->set_emit_script( emitscript, pSubParams );
12455  }
12456 
12457 
12458 // p_particle->SetActive( false );
12459 //
12460 // uint32 active = 0;
12461 // if ( pParams->GetChecksum("active",&active) )
12462 // {
12463 // p_particle->SetActive( active );
12464 // }
12465 
12466  uint32 updatescript = 0;
12467  if ( pParams->GetChecksum("updatescript",&updatescript) )
12468  {
12469  p_particle->set_update_script( updatescript, pSubParams );
12470  }
12471 
12472  return true;
12473 }
12474 
12475 /******************************************************************/
12476 /* */
12477 /* */
12478 /******************************************************************/
12479 
12480 // @script | SetScript | Sets the emission script.
12481 // @parm name | name | the name of the particle system.
12482 // @parmopt name | emitscript | | the name of the script to call for emission.
12483 // @parmopt name | updatescript | | the name of the script to call to update position etc.
12484 // @parmopt name | params | | Sets a parameter block for use with the created particle scripts.
12485 bool ScriptSetScript( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12486 {
12487  uint32 name = 0;
12488  pParams->GetChecksum("Name",&name);
12489 
12490  Script::CStruct* pSubParams = NULL;
12491  pParams->GetStructure( "params", &pSubParams, Script::NO_ASSERT );
12492 
12493  Nx::CParticle * p_particle = Nx::get_particle( name );
12494  Dbg_MsgAssert( p_particle, ( "Couldn't find the requested particle system." ) );
12495 
12496  uint32 emitscript = 0;
12497  if ( pParams->GetChecksum("emitscript",&emitscript) )
12498  {
12499  p_particle->set_emit_script( emitscript, pSubParams );
12500  }
12501 
12502  uint32 updatescript = 0;
12503  if ( pParams->GetChecksum("updatescript",&updatescript) )
12504  {
12505  p_particle->set_update_script( updatescript, pSubParams );
12506  }
12507 
12508  return true;
12509 }
12510 
12511 /******************************************************************/
12512 /* */
12513 /* */
12514 /******************************************************************/
12515 
12516 // @script | DestroyParticleSystem | Destroys a particle system.
12517 // @parm name | name | the name of the particle system.
12518 // @parmopt int | ifempty | 0 | Set this to 1 if you want the particle system to be destroyed only when empty.
12519 bool ScriptDestroyParticleSystem( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12520 {
12521  uint32 name = 0;
12522  pParams->GetChecksum("Name",&name);
12523 
12524  int ifempty = 0;
12525  pParams->GetInteger("IfEmpty",&ifempty);
12526 
12527  if ( ifempty )
12528  {
12529  Nx::destroy_particle_when_empty( name );
12530  }
12531  else
12532  {
12533  Nx::destroy_particle( name );
12534  }
12535 
12536  return true;
12537 }
12538 
12539 /******************************************************************/
12540 /* */
12541 /* */
12542 /******************************************************************/
12543 
12544 // @script | EmptyParticleSystem | Empties the particle system immediately (sets number of particles to 0.
12545 // @parm name | name | the name of the particle system.
12546 bool ScriptEmptyParticleSystem( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12547 {
12548  uint32 name = 0;
12549  pParams->GetChecksum("Name",&name);
12550 
12551  Nx::CParticle * p_particle = Nx::get_particle( name );
12552  Dbg_MsgAssert( p_particle, ( "Couldn't find the requested particle system." ) );
12553 
12554  p_particle->SetNumParticles( 0 );
12555 
12556  return true;
12557 }
12558 
12559 /******************************************************************/
12560 /* */
12561 /* */
12562 /******************************************************************/
12563 
12564 // @script | ParticleExists | Returns whether the specified particle system exists
12565 // @parm name | name | the name of the particle system.
12566 bool ScriptParticleExists( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12567 {
12568  uint32 name = 0;
12569  if ( !pParams->GetChecksum("Name",&name ) )
12570  {
12571  pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME,&name,Script::ASSERT);
12572  }
12573 
12574  Nx::CParticle * p_particle = Nx::get_particle( name );
12575 
12576  if ( p_particle )
12577  {
12578  return true;
12579  }
12580  else
12581  {
12582  return false;
12583  }
12584 }
12585 
12586 /******************************************************************/
12587 /* */
12588 /* */
12589 /******************************************************************/
12590 
12591 // @script | StructureContains | true if the structure contains an element
12592 // or flag with the specified name
12593 // @parm structure | structure | the structure to check
12594 // @uparm name | the named param to look for
12595 bool ScriptStructureContains( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12596 {
12597  Script::CStruct* p_struct;
12598  if ( pParams->GetStructure( "structure", &p_struct, Script::NO_ASSERT ) )
12599  {
12600  // printf("got a structure\n");
12601  uint32 name;
12602  pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &name, Script::NO_ASSERT );
12603  Dbg_MsgAssert( name, ( "StructureContains called without a param name" ) );
12604  // printf("checking for a name of %x\n", name );
12605  if ( p_struct->ContainsComponentNamed( name ) )
12606  {
12607  return true;
12608  }
12609  else
12610  return p_struct->ContainsFlag( name );
12611  }
12612  // printf("didn't get a structure\n");
12613  return false;
12614 }
12615 
12616 /******************************************************************/
12617 /* */
12618 /* */
12619 /******************************************************************/
12620 
12621 // @script | GetBonePosition | allows you to access Obj_ type functions, from a global script
12622 bool ScriptGetBonePosition( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12623 {
12624  Mth::Vector bonePos;
12625  bool success = false;
12626 
12627  // searches for object by m_id
12628  uint32 obj_id;
12629  pParams->GetChecksum( CRCD(0x40c698af,"id"), &obj_id, Script::ASSERT );
12630 
12631  Mdl::Skate * skate_mod = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
12632  Obj::CGeneralManager* pObjectManager = skate_mod->GetObjectManager();
12633  Dbg_Assert( pObjectManager );
12634 
12635  Obj::CObject* pObject = pObjectManager->GetObjectByID( obj_id );
12636  if ( pObject )
12637  {
12638  Dbg_MsgAssert( static_cast<Obj::CMovingObject*>( pObject ), ( "This function only works on moving objects." ) );
12639  Obj::CMovingObject* pMovingObject = (Obj::CMovingObject*)pObject;
12640 
12641  uint32 boneName;
12642  pParams->GetChecksum( CRCD(0xcab94088,"bone"), &boneName, Script::ASSERT );
12643 
12644  Obj::CSkeletonComponent* p_skeleton_component = GetSkeletonComponentFromObject(pMovingObject);
12645  Dbg_Assert(p_skeleton_component);
12646  success = p_skeleton_component->GetBoneWorldPosition( boneName, &bonePos );
12647  }
12648 
12649  // make sure we have somewhere to return the data
12650  Dbg_Assert( pScript && pScript->GetParams() );
12651  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat( CRCD(0x7323e97c,"x"), bonePos[X] );
12652  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat( CRCD(0x424d9ea,"y"), bonePos[Y] );
12653  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat( CRCD(0x9d2d8850,"z"), bonePos[Z] );
12654 
12655  return success;
12656 }
12657 
12658 /******************************************************************/
12659 /* */
12660 /* */
12661 /******************************************************************/
12662 
12663 // @script | ShouldEmitParticles | tests whether the specified particle system is active
12664 bool ScriptShouldEmitParticles( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12665 {
12666  uint32 name;
12667  pParams->GetChecksum( CRCD(0xa1dc81f9,"name"), &name, Script::ASSERT );
12668 
12669  Nx::CParticle * p_particle = Nx::get_particle( name );
12670 
12671  if ( p_particle )
12672  {
12673  return p_particle->IsEmitting();
12674  }
12675  else
12676  {
12677  return false;
12678  }
12679 }
12680 
12681 /******************************************************************/
12682 /* */
12683 /* */
12684 /******************************************************************/
12685 
12686 // @script | ParticlesOn | turns on the specified particle system
12687 bool ScriptParticlesOn( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12688 {
12689  uint32 name;
12690  pParams->GetChecksum( "name", &name, Script::ASSERT );
12691 
12692  Nx::CParticle * p_particle = Nx::get_particle( name );
12693 
12694  if ( p_particle )
12695  {
12696  p_particle->SetEmitting( true );
12697  }
12698  else
12699  {
12700 // Dbg_MsgAssert( 0, ( "Couldn't find particle system to turn on" ) );
12701  }
12702 
12703  return ( p_particle != NULL );
12704 }
12705 
12706 /******************************************************************/
12707 /* */
12708 /* */
12709 /******************************************************************/
12710 
12711 // @script | ParticlesOff | turns off the specified particle system
12712 bool ScriptParticlesOff( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12713 {
12714  uint32 name;
12715  pParams->GetChecksum( "name", &name, Script::ASSERT );
12716 
12717  Nx::CParticle * p_particle = Nx::get_particle( name );
12718 
12719  if ( p_particle )
12720  {
12721  p_particle->SetEmitting( false );
12722  }
12723  else
12724  {
12725 // Dbg_MsgAssert( 0, ( "Couldn't find particle system to turn off" ) );
12726  }
12727 
12728  return ( p_particle != NULL );
12729 }
12730 
12731 /******************************************************************/
12732 /* */
12733 /* */
12734 /******************************************************************/
12735 
12736 // @script | MangleChecksums | adds 2 checksums together and returns the result in "mangled_id"
12737 // @parm name | a | First checksum
12738 // @parm name | b | Second checksum
12739 // @parm name | mangled_id | The returned value for the mangled checksum
12740 bool ScriptMangleChecksums( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12741 {
12742  uint32 a;
12743  if ( !pParams->GetChecksum( CRCD(0x174841bc,"a"), &a, Script::NO_ASSERT ) )
12744  {
12745  pParams->GetInteger( CRCD(0x174841bc,"a"), (int*)&a, Script::ASSERT );
12746  }
12747 
12748  uint32 b;
12749  if ( !pParams->GetChecksum( CRCD(0x8e411006,"b"), &b, Script::NO_ASSERT ) )
12750  {
12751  pParams->GetInteger( CRCD(0x8e411006,"b"), (int*)&b, Script::ASSERT );
12752  }
12753 
12754  uint32 mangled_id = a + b;
12755  Dbg_Assert( pScript && pScript->GetParams() );
12756  pScript->GetParams()->AddChecksum( CRCD(0xfba40626,"mangled_id"), mangled_id );
12757 
12758  return true;
12759 }
12760 
12761 /******************************************************************/
12762 /* */
12763 /* */
12764 /******************************************************************/
12765 
12766 // @script | AppendSuffixToChecksum | Appends a string suffix to a checksum and returns the result in "appended_id"
12767 // @parm name | Base | The base checksum
12768 // @parm string | SuffixString | The suffix string
12769 bool ScriptAppendSuffixToChecksum( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12770 {
12771  uint32 base_checksum;
12772  pParams->GetChecksum(CRCD(0x3f4b019e, "Base"), &base_checksum, Script::ASSERT);
12773 
12774  const char* suffix_string;
12775  pParams->GetString(CRCD(0x94542eea, "SuffixString"), &suffix_string, Script::ASSERT);
12776 
12777  pScript->GetParams()->AddChecksum(CRCD(0xafb911c6, "appended_id"), Crc::ExtendCRCWithString(base_checksum, suffix_string));
12778 
12779  return true;
12780 }
12781 
12782 /******************************************************************/
12783 /* */
12784 /* */
12785 /******************************************************************/
12786 
12787 // @script | RotateVector | rotates a vector by the specified amount
12788 // @parm float | x | X value of the vector to be rotated (also, the return value)
12789 // @parm float | y | Y value of the vector to be rotated (also, the return value)
12790 // @parm float | z | Z value of the vector to be rotated (also, the return value)
12791 // @parm float | rx | Amount to rotate on X, in degrees
12792 // @parm float | ry | Amount to rotate on Y, in degrees
12793 // @parm float | rz | Amount to rotate on Z, in degrees
12794 bool ScriptRotateVector( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12795 {
12796  // get original vector:
12797  Mth::Vector vec;
12798  pParams->GetFloat( "x", &vec[X], Script::ASSERT );
12799  pParams->GetFloat( "y", &vec[Y], Script::ASSERT );
12800  pParams->GetFloat( "z", &vec[Z], Script::ASSERT );
12801  vec[W] = 1.0f;
12802 
12803  // get amount to rotate (in degrees)
12804  float rx = 0.0f;
12805  float ry = 0.0f;
12806  float rz = 0.0f;
12807  pParams->GetFloat( "rx", &rx, Script::NO_ASSERT );
12808  pParams->GetFloat( "ry", &ry, Script::NO_ASSERT );
12809  pParams->GetFloat( "rz", &rz, Script::NO_ASSERT );
12810 
12811  // rotate the vector
12812  Mth::Matrix mat;
12813  mat.Ident();
12814  mat.RotateXLocal( Mth::DegToRad(rx) );
12815  mat.RotateYLocal( Mth::DegToRad(ry) );
12816  mat.RotateZLocal( Mth::DegToRad(rz) );
12817  vec = mat.Transform( vec );
12818 
12819  // return the vector
12820  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat( "x", vec[X] );
12821  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat( "y", vec[Y] );
12822  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat( "z", vec[Z] );
12823 
12824  return true;
12825 }
12826 
12827 /******************************************************************/
12828 /* */
12829 /* */
12830 /******************************************************************/
12831 
12832 // @script | IsPS2 | Returns true if the current hardware is PS2 (proview/devkit/regular).
12833 bool ScriptIsPS2( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12834 {
12835  if (( Config::GetHardware() == Config::HARDWARE_PS2 ) ||
12836  ( Config::GetHardware() == Config::HARDWARE_PS2_PROVIEW ) ||
12837  ( Config::GetHardware() == Config::HARDWARE_PS2_DEVSYSTEM ) )
12838  {
12839  return true;
12840  }
12841  else
12842  {
12843  return false;
12844  }
12845 }
12846 
12847 /******************************************************************/
12848 /* */
12849 /* */
12850 /******************************************************************/
12851 
12852 // @script | IsNGC | Returns true if the current hardware is GameCube.
12853 bool ScriptIsNGC( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12854 {
12855  if ( ( Config::GetHardware() == Config::HARDWARE_NGC ) )
12856  {
12857  return true;
12858  }
12859  else
12860  {
12861  return false;
12862  }
12863 }
12864

12866 /* */
12867 /* */
12868 /******************************************************************/

12872 {
12873  if ( ( Config::GetHardware() == Config::HARDWARE_XBOX ) )
12874  {
12875  return true;
12876  }
12877  else
12878  {
12879  return false;
12880  }
12881 }

12884 /* */
12885 /* */
12886 /******************************************************************/
12887 
12888 // @script | IsWin32 | Returns true if the current hardware is Win32.
12889 bool ScriptIsWIN32( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12890 {
12891  if ( ( Config::GetHardware() == Config::HARDWARE_WIN32 ) )
12892  {
12893  return true;
12894  }
12895  else
12896  {
12897  return false;
12898  }
12899 }
12900 
12901 /******************************************************************/
12902 /* */
12903 /* */
12904 /******************************************************************/
12905 
12906 // @script | GetPlatform | Puts the name of the current platform as a checksum into a parameter
12907 // called Platform. The value will be either ps2, xbox, ngc or win32
12908 // Handy for use in script switch statements, rather than having to have nested if's
12909 bool ScriptGetPlatform( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12910 {
12911  uint32 platform=0;
12912 
12913  switch (Config::GetHardware())
12914  {
12915  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2:
12916  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_PROVIEW:
12917  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_DEVSYSTEM:
12918  platform=0x988a3508; // ps2
12919  break;
12920  case Config::HARDWARE_NGC:
12921  platform=0xbcf00d45; // ngc
12922  break;
12923  case Config::HARDWARE_XBOX:
12924  platform=0x87d839b8; // xbox
12925  break;
12926  case Config::HARDWARE_WIN32:
12927  platform=0x4af45e2e; // win32
12928  break;
12929  default:
12930  break;
12931  }
12932 
12933  pScript->GetParams()->AddChecksum("Platform",platform);
12934  return true;
12935 }
12936

12938 /* */
12939 /* */
12940 /******************************************************************/
12941 
12942 bool ScriptIsPal( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12943 {
12944  return Config::PAL();
12945 }

12953 bool ScriptPushMemProfile( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12954 {
12955 
12956  const char* pContext;
12957  pParams->GetText( NONAME, &pContext, true );
12958  Mem::PushMemProfile((char*)pContext);
12959  return true;
12960 }

12974 /******************************************************************/
12975 /* */
12976 /* */
12977 /******************************************************************/
12978 
12979 // @script | TogglePass | Toggle which passes are displayed
12980 bool ScriptTogglePass( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
12981 {
12982  #ifdef __PLAT_NGPS__
12983  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
12984  static int pass = 0;
12985  pass++;
12986 
12987  // Let us put a pass value in that will override the toggling value
12988  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0x318f2bdb,"Pass"),&pass);
12989 
12990  if (pass == 5)
12991  {
12992  pass = 0;
12993  }
12994  if (pass)
12995  {
12996  NxPs2::gPassMask1 = 0xc0; // 1<<6 | 1<<7 (0x40, 0x80)
12997  NxPs2::gPassMask0 = (pass-1)<<6;
12998  }
12999  else
13000  {
13001  NxPs2::gPassMask1 = 0;
13002  NxPs2::gPassMask0 = 0;
13003  }
13004  #endif
13005  #endif
13006  return true;
13007 }
13008 
13009 /******************************************************************/
13010 /* */
13011 /* */
13012 /******************************************************************/
13013 
13014 // @script | SetScreen | Sets default screen aspect ratio and camera
13015 // @parm float | Aspect | aspect ratio, usually 16/9 (1.777777777) or 4/3 (1.3333333333)
13016 // @parm float | Angle | screen angle in degrees usally 72, or 80 for 16:9
13017 // @parm int | Letterbox | 0 for non-letterbox, 1 for letterboxed. Normally used with 4/3 aspect
13018 bool ScriptSetScreen( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
13019 {
13020  float Aspect;
13021  float Angle;
13022 
13023  if (pParams->GetFloat("Aspect",&Aspect))
13024  {
13025  Nx::CViewportManager::sSetScreenAspect(Aspect);
13026  }
13027 
13028  if (pParams->GetFloat("Angle",&Angle))
13029  {
13030  Nx::CViewportManager::sSetScreenAngle(Angle);
13031  }
13032 
13033  int letterbox;
13034  if (pParams->GetInteger("Letterbox",&letterbox))
13035  {
13036  Nx::CEngine::sSetLetterbox(letterbox);
13037  }
13038 
13039  return true;
13040 
13041 }
13042

13044 /* */
13045 /* */
13046 /******************************************************************/
13047 
13048 bool ScriptGetUpperCaseString( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
13049 {
13050  const char* initial_string;
13051  pParams->GetString( NONAME, &initial_string, Script::ASSERT );
13052 
13053  char new_string[128];
13054  strcpy( new_string, initial_string );
13055 
13056  Str::UpperCase( new_string );
13057  pScript->GetParams()->AddString( "UpperCaseString", new_string );
13058  return true;
13059 }

13069  uint32 gameMode = skate_mod->GetGameMode()->GetNameChecksum();
13070 
13071  pScript->GetParams()->AddChecksum( "GameMode", gameMode );
13072  return true;
13073 }
