13129 /******************************************************************/
13130 /* */
13131 /* */
13132 /******************************************************************/
13133 
13134 // @script | CreateIndexArray | creates an array of ints, where each element
13135 // is equal to its own index
13136 // @uparm 1 | size of array
13137 bool ScriptCreateIndexArray( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
13138 {
13139  int size;
13140  pParams->GetInteger( NONAME, &size, Script::ASSERT );
13141 
13142  if ( size < 1 )
13143  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0, ( "CreateIndexArray called with size less than 1" ) );
13144 
13145  Script::CArray *p_index_array = new Script::CArray();
13146  p_index_array->SetSizeAndType( size, ESYMBOLTYPE_INTEGER );
13147 
13148  for ( int i = 0; i < size; i++ )
13149  p_index_array->SetInteger( i, i );
13150 
13151  pScript->GetParams()->AddArray( "index_array", p_index_array );
13152  Script::CleanUpArray( p_index_array );
13153  delete p_index_array;
13154  return true;
13155 }
13156 
13157 /******************************************************************/
13158 /* */
13159 /* */
13160 /******************************************************************/
13161 
13162 // @script | GetRescaledTargetValue |
13163 // @parm float | min |
13164 // @parm float | max |
13165 // @parm float | target |
13166 // @parm float | result |
13167 bool ScriptGetRescaledTargetValue( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
13168 {
13169  float min;
13170  float max;
13171  float target;
13172  float result;
13173 
13174  pParams->GetFloat( "min", &min, true );
13175  pParams->GetFloat( "max", &max, true );
13176  pParams->GetFloat( "target", &target, true );
13177 
13178  result = ( target - min ) / ( max - min );
13179 
13180  if ( pParams->ContainsFlag( "sin_curve" ) )
13181  {
13182  result = asinf( result ) * 4096.0f / ( 2.0f * Mth::PI );
13183 
13184  if ( pParams->ContainsFlag( "backwards" ) )
13185  {
13186  result = 2048.0f - result;
13187  }
13188  }
13189 
13190 // Dbg_Message( "min = %f max = %f target = %f result = %f", min, max, target, result );
13191 
13192  // this finds the scaled value between 0.0 and 1.0
13193  pScript->GetParams()->AddFloat( "result", result );
13194 
13195  return true;
13196 }
13197 
13198 /******************************************************************/
13199 /* */
13200 /* */
13201 /******************************************************************/
13202 
13203 // @script | MenuIsSelected | Checks names in pArray to find selected
13204 bool ScriptMenuIsSelected(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
13205 {
13206  // If there is an array of names, check them.
13207  Script::CArray *pArray=NULL;
13208  if (pParams->GetArray(NONAME,&pArray))
13209  {
13210  Dbg_MsgAssert(pArray,("Eh? NULL pArray?"));
13211  for (uint32 i=0; i<pArray->GetSize(); ++i)
13212  {
13213  if (MenuIsSelected(pArray->GetNameChecksum(i)))
13214  {
13215  return true;
13216  }
13217  }
13218  }
13219 
13220  uint32 id=0;
13221  if (pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME,&id))
13222  {
13223  if (MenuIsSelected(id))
13224  {
13225  return true;
13226  }
13227  }
13228 
13229  return false;
13230 }
13231 
13232 /******************************************************************/
13233 /* */
13234 /* */
13235 /******************************************************************/
13236 
13237 // @script | GetNodeName | Gets the node name of the object running this script, and puts
13238 // it into a parameter called NodeName.
13239 // If there is no such object, it will not add NodeName and will return false.
13240 bool ScriptGetNodeName(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
13241 {
13242  if (pScript->mpObject)
13243  {
13244  Obj::CMovingObject *p_pos_obj = static_cast<Obj::CMovingObject*>(pScript->mpObject.Convert());
13245  if (p_pos_obj)
13246  {
13247  if (p_pos_obj->GetID())
13248  {
13249  pScript->GetParams()->AddChecksum("NodeName",p_pos_obj->GetID());
13250  return true;
13251  }
13252  }
13253  }
13254 
13255  return false;
13256 }
13257 
13258 /******************************************************************/
13259 /* */
13260 /* */
13261 /******************************************************************/
13262 
13263 // @script | SetTesterScript | Sets and starts running the tester script. This is a script which
13264 // will never die and will always be having its update function called every frame.
13265 // Used for auto testing levels.
13266 // SetTesterScript may be called more than once. Any new call will stop the current tester script
13267 // and start the new one.
13268 // If the tester script hits an endscript it still won't die, it will just stick on the endscript
13269 // and not do anything. (This uses negligible processing time)
13270 // @uparm name | The name of the script to run.
13271 bool ScriptSetTesterScript(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
13272 {
13273  uint32 tester_script=0;
13274  CStruct *p_params=NULL;
13275 
13276  pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME,&tester_script);
13277  pParams->GetStructure(CRCD(0x7031f10c,"params"),&p_params);
13278 
13279  Mdl::Skate * pSkate = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
13280 
13281  Dbg_MsgAssert(pSkate->mp_gameFlow,("NULL pSkate->mp_gameFlow ??"));
13282  pSkate->mp_gameFlow->SetTesterScript(tester_script, p_params);
13283  return true;
13284 }
13285 
13286 /******************************************************************/
13287 /* */
13288 /* */
13289 /******************************************************************/
13290 
13291 // @script | KillTesterScript | Kills any tester script that is running.
13292 // Returns true if a tester script was running before, false otherwise.
13293 bool ScriptKillTesterScript(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
13294 {
13295  Mdl::Skate * pSkate = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
13296 
13297  Dbg_MsgAssert(pSkate->mp_gameFlow,("NULL pSkate->mp_gameFlow ??"));
13298  return pSkate->mp_gameFlow->KillTesterScript();
13299 }
13300 
13301 // Memory manager related functions
13302 
13303 /******************************************************************/
13304 /* */
13305 /* */
13306 /******************************************************************/
13307 
13308 // @script | MemPushContext |
13309 // @uparm 1 | value
13310 bool ScriptMemPushContext( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
13311 {
13312 // MemViewToggle();
13313 
13314  // 0 is the special case name
13315  int Val=0; // default to 0
13316  if ( pParams->GetInteger(NONAME,&Val,false) )
13317  {
13318  if ( Val == 0 )
13319  {
13320  // is the bottom up heap
13321  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PushContext(Mem::Manager::sHandle().BottomUpHeap());
13322  }
13323  else
13324  {
13325  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0, ( "Must specify heap name (instead of number) for MemPushContext (ex: BottomUpHeap)" ) );
13326  }
13327  }
13328  else
13329  {
13330  // otherwise, look it up by name
13331  uint32 whichHeap;
13332  pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &whichHeap, true );
13333  Mem::Manager& mem_man = Mem::Manager::sHandle();
13334  Mem::Heap* pHeap = mem_man.GetHeap( whichHeap );
13335  Dbg_Assert( pHeap );
13336 
13337  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PushContext( pHeap );
13338  }
13339 
13340  return true;
13341 }
13342 
13343 /******************************************************************/
13344 /* */
13345 /* */
13346 /******************************************************************/
13347 
13348 // @script | MemPopContext |
13349 bool ScriptMemPopContext( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
13350 {
13351  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PopContext();
13352  return true;
13353 }
13354 
13355 /******************************************************************/
13356 /* */
13357 /* */
13358 /******************************************************************/
13359 
13360 // @script | MemInitHeap |
13361 // @parm name | name | the name of heap to create
13362 // @parm int | size | the size of heap to create
13363 bool ScriptMemInitHeap(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
13364 {
13365  const char* pHeapName;
13366  pParams->GetText( "name", &pHeapName, true );
13367 
13368  int heapSize;
13369  pParams->GetInteger( "size", &heapSize, true );
13370 
13371  uint32 heapName;
13372  heapName = Script::GenerateCRC( pHeapName );
13373 
13374  Mem::Manager& mem_man = Mem::Manager::sHandle();
13375  Dbg_MsgAssert( !mem_man.NamedHeap(heapName, false), ( "named heap %s already exists", pHeapName ) )
13376  mem_man.InitNamedHeap( heapName, heapSize, pHeapName );
13377  return true;
13378 }
13379 
13380 /******************************************************************/
13381 /* */
13382 /* */
13383 /******************************************************************/
13384 
13385 // @script | MemDeleteHeap |
13386 // @parm name | name | the name of heap to delete
13387 bool ScriptMemDeleteHeap(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
13388 {
13389  const char* pHeapName;
13390  pParams->GetText( "name", &pHeapName, true );
13391 
13392  Mem::Manager& mem_man = Mem::Manager::sHandle();
13393  return mem_man.DeleteNamedHeap( Script::GenerateCRC( pHeapName ), false );
13394 }
13395 
13396 /******************************************************************/
13397 /* */
13398 /* */
13399 /******************************************************************/
13400 
13401 bool ScriptMemThreadSafe( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
13402 {
13403  if (pParams->ContainsFlag( Script::GenerateCRC( "off" )))
13404  {
13405  Mem::SetThreadSafe( false );
13406  }
13407  else
13408  {
13409  Mem::SetThreadSafe( true );
13410  }
13411  return true;
13412 }
13413 
13414 /******************************************************************/
13415 /* */
13416 /* */
13417 /******************************************************************/
13418 
13419 // @script | AnalyzeHeap | analyzes specified heap
13420 // @uparmopt BottomUpHeap | heap to analyze
13421 bool ScriptAnalyzeHeap( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
13422 {
13423  // GJ: I am planning to refactor this!
13424  Mem::Manager& mem_man = Mem::Manager::sHandle();
13425  Mem::Heap* pHeap = NULL;
13426  uint32 whichHeap = Script::GenerateCRC("BottomUpHeap");
13427  if ( pParams )
13428  {
13429  pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &whichHeap );
13430  }
13431 
13432  pHeap = mem_man.GetHeap( whichHeap );
13433 
13434 #ifndef __PLAT_NGC__
13435  if ( pHeap )
13436  {
13437  MemView_AnalyzeHeap( pHeap );
13438  }
13439 #endif // __PLAT_NGC__
13440 
13441  return true;
13442 }
13443 
13444 /******************************************************************/
13445 /* */
13446 /* */
13447 /******************************************************************/
13448 
13449 // @script | PrintMemInfo | displays mem info about specified heap
13450 // @uparmopt BottomUpHeap | which heap to print
13451 bool ScriptPrintMemInfo( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
13452 {
13453  Mem::Manager& mem_man = Mem::Manager::sHandle();
13454  Mem::Heap* pHeap = NULL;
13455  char buf[64];
13456  uint32 whichHeap = Script::GenerateCRC("BottomUpHeap");
13457  if ( pParams )
13458  {
13459  pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &whichHeap );
13460  }
13461 
13462  pHeap = mem_man.GetHeap( whichHeap );
13463  strcpy( buf, mem_man.GetHeapName( whichHeap ) );
13464 
13465  if ( pHeap )
13466  {
13467  printf( "\n" );
13468 
13469  printf( "%s:\n", buf );
13470  printf( "Used %dK (%d) Peak %dK (%d)\n",
13471  pHeap->mUsedMem.m_count / 1024,
13472  pHeap->mUsedBlocks.m_count,
13473  pHeap->mUsedMem.m_peak / 1024,
13474  pHeap->mUsedBlocks.m_peak );
13475  printf( "Frag %dK (%d) Peak %dK (%d)\n",
13476  pHeap->mFreeMem.m_count / 1024,
13477  pHeap->mFreeBlocks.m_count,
13478  pHeap->mFreeMem.m_peak / 1024,
13479  pHeap->mFreeBlocks.m_peak );
13480 
13481  printf( "\n" );
13482  }
13483 
13484  return true;
13485 }
13486 
13487 
13488 /******************************************************************/
13489 /* */
13490 /* */
13491 /******************************************************************/
13492 
13493 // @script | DisplayFreeMem | displays free mem info of specified heap
13494 bool ScriptDisplayFreeMem( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
13495 {
13496  Mem::Manager& mem_man = Mem::Manager::sHandle();
13497 
13498  Mem::Heap* heap;
13499 
13500  Script::CStruct* params;
13501 
13502  params = new Script::CStruct;
13503  for (heap = mem_man.FirstHeap(); heap != NULL; heap = mem_man.NextHeap(heap))
13504  {
13505  Mem::Region* region = heap->ParentRegion();
13506 
13507  params->Clear();
13508 
13509  params->AddChecksum( "id", Script::GenerateCRC( heap->GetName() ) );
13510  params->AddInteger( "free_mem", region->MemAvailable() );
13511  params->AddInteger( "min_free_mem", region->MinMemAvailable() );
13512 
13513  Script::RunScript( "UpdateDisplayFreeMemory", params );
13514 
13515  }
13516 
13517  delete params;
13518  return true;
13519 }
13520 
13521 /******************************************************************/
13522 /* */
13523 /* */
13524 /******************************************************************/
13525 
13526 // @script | DumpHeaps | prints out heap contents
13527 // @flag ExactValues | Prints the exact heap sizes in bytes.
13528 bool ScriptDumpHeaps( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
13529 {
13530 # if !defined( __PLAT_NGC__ ) || ( defined( __PLAT_NGC__ ) && !defined( __NOPT_FINAL__ ) )
13531 
13532  Script::DumpLastStructs();
13533 
13534  Mem::Manager& mem_man = Mem::Manager::sHandle();
13535 
13536 # ifndef __PLAT_XBOX__
13537 #ifndef __PLAT_NGC__
13538  char buf[512];
13539 #endif // __PLAT_NGC__
13540 # endif
13541 
13542  Mem::Heap* heap;
13543 
13544 # ifndef __PLAT_XBOX__
13545 #ifndef __PLAT_NGC__
13546  dump_open("blah.txt");
13547 #endif // __PLAT_NGC__
13548 # endif
13549 
13550  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xd65b9ac7,"ExactValues")))
13551  {
13552  printf("Name Used Frag Free Min Blocks\n");
13553  printf("--------------- ------ ------- ------- ------ ------\n");
13554  for (heap = mem_man.FirstHeap(); heap != NULL; heap = mem_man.NextHeap(heap))
13555  {
13556  Mem::Region* region = heap->ParentRegion();
13557  printf( "%12s: %8d %7d %7d %7d %5d \n",
13558  heap->GetName(),
13559  heap->mUsedMem.m_count ,
13560  heap->mFreeMem.m_count ,
13561  region->MemAvailable() ,
13562  region->MinMemAvailable() ,
13563  heap->mUsedBlocks.m_count
13564  );
13565  }
13566  }
13567  else
13568  {
13569  printf("Name Used Frag Free Min Blocks\n");
13570  printf("--------------- ----- ----- ---- ------ ------\n");
13571  for (heap = mem_man.FirstHeap(); heap != NULL; heap = mem_man.NextHeap(heap))
13572  {
13573  Mem::Region* region = heap->ParentRegion();
13574  printf( "%12s: %5dK %4dK %4dK %4dK %5d \n",
13575  heap->GetName(),
13576  heap->mUsedMem.m_count / 1024,
13577  heap->mFreeMem.m_count / 1024,
13578  region->MemAvailable() / 1024,
13579  region->MinMemAvailable() / 1024,
13580  heap->mUsedBlocks.m_count
13581  );
13582  }
13583  }
13584 
13585 # ifndef __PLAT_XBOX__
13586 #ifndef __PLAT_NGC__
13587  dump_close();
13588 #endif // __PLAT_NGC__
13589 # endif
13590 
13591  Sfx::CSfxManager * sfx_manager = Sfx::CSfxManager::Instance();
13592  printf( "\nSound mem free %d K (%d bytes)\n",
13593  sfx_manager->MemAvailable() / 1024, sfx_manager->MemAvailable() );
13594 
13595 # ifndef __PLAT_XBOX__
13596 #ifndef __PLAT_NGC__
13597  char fileName[256];
13598  int i = 0;
13599  while ( TRUE )
13600  {
13601  // The filename is formed from the level name a number, and the free memory
13602  // you should sort them by DATE, and not by filename
13603  //
13604  sprintf( fileName, "dumps\\%s_dump_%02d_%s.txt",
13605  s_level_name,
13606 // __nDATE__,
13607  // __nTIME__,
13608  i,
13609  Str::PrintThousands((mem_man.BottomUpHeap()->ParentRegion()->MemAvailable())) );
13610 
13611  printf ("Filename = <%s>, %d chars\n",fileName,strlen(fileName));
13612 
13613  if ( FALSE == File::Exist( fileName ))
13614  break;
13615 
13616  i++;
13617  }
13618 #endif // __PLAT_NGC__
13619 # endif // __PLAT_XBOX__
13620 
13621 # ifndef __PLAT_XBOX__
13622 #ifndef __PLAT_NGC__
13623  if( dump_open(fileName))
13624  {
13625  sprintf(buf,"Name Used Frag Free Blocks\n");
13626  dump_printf(buf);
13627  sprintf(buf,"--------------- ----- ----- ------ ------\n");
13628  dump_printf(buf);
13629  for (heap = mem_man.FirstHeap(); heap != NULL; heap = mem_man.NextHeap(heap))
13630  {
13631  Mem::Region* region = heap->ParentRegion();
13632  sprintf(buf, "%12s: %5dK %4dK %4dK %5d \n",
13633  heap->GetName(),
13634  heap->mUsedMem.m_count / 1024,
13635  heap->mFreeMem.m_count / 1024,
13636  region->MemAvailable() / 1024,
13637  heap->mUsedBlocks.m_count
13638  );
13639  dump_printf(buf);
13640  }
13641  sprintf( buf, "\nSound mem free %d K (%d bytes)\n\n\n",
13642  sfx_manager->MemAvailable() / 1024, sfx_manager->MemAvailable() );
13643  dump_printf(buf);
13644 
13645  sprintf(buf,"Summary\n----------\n\n");
13646  dump_printf(buf);
13647  Mem::DumpMemProfile(3);
13648  sprintf(buf,"\n\nDetails\n----------\n\n");
13649  dump_printf(buf);
13650  Mem::DumpMemProfile(100);
13651 
13652  dump_close();
13653  }
13654 #endif // __PLAT_NGC__
13655 # endif //__PLAT_XBOX__
13656 
13657  printf("\nScript pool usage:\n");
13658  printf("CStruct: %5d of %5d, max %5d\n",CStruct::SGetNumUsedItems(),CStruct::SGetTotalItems(),CStruct::SGetMaxUsedItems());
13659  printf("CComponent: %5d of %5d, max %5d\n",CComponent::SGetNumUsedItems(),CComponent::SGetTotalItems(),CComponent::SGetMaxUsedItems());
13660  printf("CSymbolTableEntry: %5d of %5d, max %5d\n",CSymbolTableEntry::SGetNumUsedItems(),CSymbolTableEntry::SGetTotalItems(),CSymbolTableEntry::SGetMaxUsedItems());
13661  printf("CVector: %5d of %5d, max %5d\n",CVector::SGetNumUsedItems(),CVector::SGetTotalItems(),CVector::SGetMaxUsedItems());
13662  printf("CPair: %5d of %5d, max %5d\n",CPair::SGetNumUsedItems(),CPair::SGetTotalItems(),CPair::SGetMaxUsedItems());
13663  printf("CArray: %5d of %5d, max %5d\n",CArray::SGetNumUsedItems(),CArray::SGetTotalItems(),CArray::SGetMaxUsedItems());
13664  printf("CScript: %5d of %5d, max %5d\n",CScript::SGetNumUsedItems(),CScript::SGetTotalItems(),CScript::SGetMaxUsedItems());
13665  Mem::CCompactPool *p_hash = Mem::PoolManager::SGetPool(Mem::PoolManager::vHASH_ITEM_POOL);
13666  printf("CHashItem: %5d of %5d, max %5d\n",p_hash->GetNumUsedItems(),p_hash->GetTotalItems(),p_hash->GetMaxUsedItems());
13667  printf("\n(HashItems are init in main.cpp, others are in init.cpp)\n");
13668 #endif // __NOPT_FINAL__
13669 
13670  return true;
13671 }
13672 
13673 /******************************************************************/
13674 /* */
13675 /* */
13676 /******************************************************************/
13677 
13678 // @script | DumpFragments | prints out heap fragments
13679 bool ScriptDumpFragments( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
13680 {
13681  int maxFragmentation = 10000;
13682  pParams->GetInteger( NONAME, &maxFragmentation, Script::NO_ASSERT );
13683 
13684  if ( pParams->ContainsFlag( "K" ) )
13685  {
13686  maxFragmentation *= 1024;
13687  }
13688 
13689 #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
13690  Mem::Manager& mem_man = Mem::Manager::sHandle();
13691 
13692  // sanity checks for fragmentation
13693  Mem::Heap* heap = mem_man.BottomUpHeap();
13694  int fragmentation = heap->mFreeMem.m_count;
13695 
13696  if (fragmentation > maxFragmentation)
13697  {
13698  // not guaranteed to do anything useful.... might crash the debugger (Mick)
13699  printf ("Dumping Fragments.....\n");
13700  MemView_DumpFragments(heap);
13701  printf ("Done Dumping Fragments.....\n");
13702  }
13703 
13704  Dbg_MsgAssert(fragmentation < maxFragmentation, ("Excessive bottom up fragmentation (%d) after cleanup (max=%d)",fragmentation,maxFragmentation));
13705 
13706  heap = mem_man.TopDownHeap();
13707  fragmentation = heap->mFreeMem.m_count;
13708  if (fragmentation > maxFragmentation)
13709  {
13710  // not guaranteed to do anything useful.... might crash the debugger (Mick)
13711  printf ("Dumping Fragments.....\n");
13712  MemView_DumpFragments(heap);
13713  printf ("Done Dumping Fragments.....\n");
13714  }
13715 
13716  Dbg_MsgAssert(fragmentation < maxFragmentation, ("Excessive top down fragmentation (%d) after cleanup (max=%d)",fragmentation,maxFragmentation));
13717 #endif
13718 
13719  return true;
13720 }
13721 
13722 /******************************************************************/
13723 /* */
13724 /* */
13725 /******************************************************************/
13726 
13727 bool ScriptClearStruct( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
13728 {
13729  uint32 structName;
13730  pParams->GetChecksum( "struct", &structName, Script::ASSERT );
13731 
13732  Script::CStruct* pStruct = Script::GetStructure( structName, Script::ASSERT );
13733  pStruct->Clear();
13734 
13735  return true;
13736 }
13737 
13738 /******************************************************************/
13739 /* */
13740 /* */
13741 /******************************************************************/
13742 
13743 bool ScriptAppendStruct( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
13744 {
13745  uint32 structName;
13746  pParams->GetChecksum( "struct", &structName, Script::ASSERT );
13747 
13748  uint32 fieldName;
13749  pParams->GetChecksum( "field", &fieldName, Script::ASSERT );
13750 
13751  Script::CStruct* pAppendParams;
13752  pParams->GetStructure( "params", &pAppendParams, Script::ASSERT );
13753 
13754  Script::CStruct* pSubStruct = new Script::CStruct;
13755  pSubStruct->AppendStructure( pAppendParams );
13756 
13757  Script::CStruct* pStruct = Script::GetStructure( structName, Script::ASSERT );
13758  pStruct->AddStructurePointer( fieldName, pSubStruct );
13759 
13760  return true;
13761 }
13762 
13763 /******************************************************************/
13764 /* */
13765 /* */
13766 /******************************************************************/
13767 
13768 bool ScriptScriptExists( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
13769 {
13770  uint32 script_name_checksum=0;
13771  pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME,&script_name_checksum);
13772 
13773  CSymbolTableEntry *p_entry=Resolve(script_name_checksum);
13774  if (p_entry && p_entry->mType==ESYMBOLTYPE_QSCRIPT)
13775  {
13776  return true;
13777  }
13778  return false;
13779 }
13780 
13781 /******************************************************************/
13782 /* */
13783 /* */
13784 /******************************************************************/
13785 
13786 bool ScriptSpawnSecondControllerCheck( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
13787 {
13788  Mlp::Manager * mlp_manager = Mlp::Manager::Instance();
13789  int not_used;
13790 
13791  if( s_second_controller_check_task != NULL )
13792  {
13793  return true;
13794  }
13795 
13796  not_used = 0;
13797  s_second_controller_check_task = new Tsk::Task< int > ( s_second_controller_check_code, not_used );
13798  mlp_manager->AddLogicTask ( *s_second_controller_check_task );
13799 
13800  return true;
13801 }
13802 
13803 /******************************************************************/
13804 /* */
13805 /* */
13806 /******************************************************************/
13807 
13808 bool ScriptStopSecondControllerCheck( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
13809 {
13810  Dbg_Assert( s_second_controller_check_task != NULL );
13811 
13812  delete s_second_controller_check_task;
13813  s_second_controller_check_task = NULL;
13814 
13815  return true;
13816 }

13823 // @script | LoadExecPS2 |
13824 // @parm string | elf | elf file to load
13825 // if this fails on a TOOL turn off SN profiling in main.cpp
13826 // and check the media type in prepare_to_exit
13827 bool ScriptLoadExecPS2( Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript )
13828 {
13829 
13830 #ifdef __PLAT_NGPS__
13831  const char* p_string;
13832  pParams->GetText( "elf", &p_string, true );
13833  Sys::LoadExec( p_string );
13834 #endif // __PLAT_NGPS__
13835 
13836  return true; // actually will never get here}
13837 }

13840 /******************************************************************/
13841 /* */
13842 /* */
13843 /******************************************************************/
13844 
13845 /*
13846 - TODO - factor out the common functionality of ExitDemo into LoadExecPS2
13847 
13848 the LoadExecPS2() references lists some common gotchas:
13849 
13850 The total size of the character strings for the filename and all of the
13851 arguments must not exceed 256 bytes.
13852 
13853 Note the following points before calling LoadExecPS2().
13854 * Terminate or delete all threads other than the thread that will
13855  execute LoadExecPS2().
13856 * Cancel all callbacks and interrupt handlers.
13857 * Execute scePadEnd().
13858 * Execute sceSifExitCmd().
13859 */
13860 
13861 bool ScriptExitDemo( Script::CStruct*, Script::CScript* )
13862 {
13863 #ifdef __PLAT_NGPS__
13864  Sys::ExitDemo();
13865 #endif
13866 
13867  return true; // actually will never get here
13868 }

13876 {
13877  Script::CArray* pTest = NULL;
13878  if ( pParams->GetArray( NONAME, &pTest, Script::NO_ASSERT ) )
13879  return true;
13880  return false;
13881 }

13888 // @script | UseUserSoundtrack | xbox only - uses a certain soundtrack
13889 // @uparm 1 | the soundtrack number
13890 bool ScriptUseUserSoundtrack( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
13891 {
13892  Dbg_MsgAssert( Config::GetHardware() == Config::HARDWARE_XBOX, ( "UseUserSoundtrack should only be called on the XBox" ) );
13893 
13894  int soundtrack;
13895  pParams->GetInteger( NONAME, &soundtrack, Script::ASSERT );
13896  Pcm::UseUserSoundtrack( soundtrack );
13897  return true;
13898 }

13918 // @script | DisableReset | ngc only - disable the reset button. If the user presses reset when disabled, a screen will be displayed until it is enabled, and it will reset.
13919 bool ScriptDisableReset( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
13920 {
13921 #ifdef __PLAT_NGC__
13922  //printf("DisableReset ...\n");
13923  NxNgc::EngineGlobals.disableReset = true;
13924 #endif // __PLAT_NGC__
13925 
13926  return true;
13927 }

13930 /* */
13931 /* */
13932 /******************************************************************/

13934 // @script | EnableReset | ngc only - enable the reset button. If reset was pressed while disabled, it will now reset.
13935 bool ScriptEnableReset( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
13936 {
13937 #ifdef __PLAT_NGC__
13938  //printf("WARNING! EnableReset ...\n");
13939 
13940  NxNgc::EngineGlobals.disableReset = false;
13941 #endif // __PLAT_NGC__
13942 
13943  return true;
13944 }

13952 bool ScriptResetToIPL( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
13953 {

13956 #endif // __PLAT_NGC__

13960 
13961 /******************************************************************/
13962 /* */
13963 /* */
13964 /******************************************************************/
13965 
13966 bool ScriptInitAnimCompressTable( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
13967 {
13968  const char* pFileName;
13969  pParams->GetText( NONAME, &pFileName, Script::ASSERT );
13970 
13971  uint32 compressTableName;
13972  pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &compressTableName, Script::ASSERT );
13973 
13974  char filename[256];
13975  sprintf( filename, "%s", pFileName );//, Nx::CEngine::sGetPlatformExtension() );
13976 
13977  switch ( compressTableName )
13978  {
13979  case 0xc6a56fe3: // q48
13980  {
13981  Gfx::InitQ48Table( filename );
13982  }
13983  break;
13984 
13985  case 0xc06ead08: // t48
13986  {
13987  Gfx::InitT48Table( filename );
13988  }
13989  break;
13990 
13991  default:
13992  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0, ( "Unrecognized compress table name %s", Script::FindChecksumName(compressTableName) ) );
13993  break;
13994  }
13995 
13996  return true;
13997 }
13998 
13999 /******************************************************************/
14000 /* */
14001 /* */
14002 /******************************************************************/
14003 
14004 // Test_Composite is a test array of structures
14005 // that are the components of the composite object, and the parameters passed to it
14006 /*
14007 test_composite = [
14008  {
14009  component = model
14010  model = "gameobjects\skate\letter_a\letter_a.mdl"
14011  }
14012 
14013  {
14014  component = exceptions
14015  }
14016 
14017  {
14018  component = bouncyphysics
14019  bounce = 2
14020  }
14021  {
14022  components = [model, exceptions, explodingphysics]
14023  model = "gameobjects\skate\letter_a\letter_a.mdl"
14024  bounce = 2
14025 
14026 }
14027 ]
14028 */
14029 
14030 /******************************************************************/
14031 /* */
14032 /* */
14033 /******************************************************************/
14034 
14035 bool ScriptCreateCompositeObject( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
14036 {
14037  // Required array of structures containing "component="
14038  Script::CArray* p_array = NULL;
14039  pParams->GetArray(CRCD(0x11b70a02,"components"),&p_array,Script::ASSERT);
14040 
14041  // Optional extra structure of parameters that override any provided in the array
14042  Script::CStruct* p_struct = NULL;
14043  pParams->GetStructure(CRCD(0x7031f10c,"params"),&p_struct);
14044 
14045  Obj::CCompositeObjectManager::Instance()->CreateCompositeObjectFromNode(p_array, p_struct);
14046 
14047  return true;
14048 }
14049 
14050 /******************************************************************/
14051 /* */
14052 /* */
14053 /******************************************************************/
14054 
14055 // Given the id of an object, and a structure,
14056 bool ScriptRefreshObject( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
14057 {
14058 
14059 
14060  return true;
14061 }
14062 
14063 /******************************************************************/
14064 /* */
14065 /* */
14066 /******************************************************************/
14067 
14068 // @script | AutoRail |
14069 // auto-generates rails based of the level's collidable geometry
14070 // @parmopt float | min_rail_edge_angle | 30.0 |
14071 // rails are created only on edges as least as sharp as this angle
14072 // @parmopt float | max_rail_angle_of_assent | 45.0 |
14073 // rails are created only on edges less steep than this angle
14074 // @parmopt float | min_railset_length | 36.0 |
14075 // autorail attempts to join contiguous edges together in order to determine the effective length of a curved rail;
14076 // once this is done, rails shorter than this length in inches are dropped
14077 // @parmopt float | min_edge_length | 0.0 |
14078 // edges below this length in inches are not considered for rail creation, even if they could be part of a curved rail
14079 // @parmopt float | max_corner_in_railset | 50.0 |
14080 // maximum angle between two edges for them to be connected as a curved rail
14081 // @parmopt float | connection_slop | 0.1 |
14082 // slop distance allowed between rail endpoints below which those rails will be snapped togeather
14083 // @parmopt float | farthest_degenerate_rail | 12.0 |
14084 // auto-generated rails within this distance in inches of an old rail will not be created
14085 // @parmopt float | max_degenerate_rail_angle | 20.0 |
14086 // if the angle between an auto-generated rail and a nearly old rail is below this angle, the auto-generated rail will not be created
14087 // @parmopt float | max_low_curb_height | 8.0 |
14088 // curbs below this height in inches are not given rails; controls the low-curb collision feeler length
14089 // @parmopt float | vertical_feeler_length | 60.0 |
14090 // length in inches of the vertical collision feeler
14091 // @parmopt float | crossbar_feeler_length | 12.0 |
14092 // length in inches of the crossbar collision feeler
14093 // @parmopt float | crossbar_feeler_elevation | 12.0 |
14094 // height in inches of the crossbar collision feeler
14095 // @parmopt float | curb_feeler_angle_of_assent | 30.0 |
14096 // low-curb collision feeler radiates from the rail at this angle above the bordering faces
14097 // @parmopt float | feeler_increment | 36.0 |
14098 // collision feelers are used at each step of this distance in inches along the rail
14099 // @flag no_feelers |
14100 // turns off the checking of the volume around rails by collision feelers
14101 // otherwise this checking is done in order to insure that a rail is not cramped or on a low curb
14102 // @flag no_vertical_feeler |
14103 // turns off the collision feeler which radiates upward from the rail
14104 // @flag no_crossbar_feeler |
14105 // turns off the collision feeler which lies just above the rail and runs perpendicular to it
14106 // @flag no_low_curb_feeler |
14107 // turns off the collision feelers which radiate from the rail just above the bordering faces;
14108 // these collision feelers are used to insure rails are not created on low curbs
14109 // @flag overwrite |
14110 // deletes old rails before auto-generating rails
14111 bool ScriptAutoRail( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
14112 {
14113  Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetRailManager()->AutoGenerateRails(pParams);
14114  return true;
14115 }
14116 
14117 /******************************************************************/
14118 /* */
14119 /* */
14120 /******************************************************************/
14121 
14122 bool ScriptInside(Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript)
14123 {
14124  Dbg_MsgAssert(Mdl::Skate::Instance()->mpProximManager->IsInsideFlagValid(), ("Inside called outside of a proxim trigger script or within a proxim trigger script with a ProximObject"));
14125  return Mdl::Skate::Instance()->mpProximManager->IsInside();
14126 }

14133 bool ScriptSetSpecialBarColors(Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript)
14134 {

14136  pParams->GetInteger( "skater", &skater_num, Script::ASSERT );
14137 
14138  Mdl::Skate * pSkate = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
14139  Obj::CSkater* pSkater = pSkate->GetSkater( skater_num );
14140  Mdl::Score *pScore = pSkater->GetScoreObject();
14141 
14142  pScore->setSpecialBarColors();
14143  return true;
14144 }

14147 /* */
14148 /* */
14149 /******************************************************************/
14150 
14151 bool ScriptGetMetrics(Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript)
14152 {
14153 // get various metrics into a structure for display
14154 // You can run this on a spawned script to see in the viewer
14155 
14156  Script::CStruct *p_metrics = new Script::CStruct();
14157  Nx::CEngine::sGetMetrics(p_metrics);
14158 
14159  Script::CStruct *p_script_params = pScript->GetParams();
14160  p_script_params->AddStructure("Metrics",p_metrics);
14161 
14162  return true;
14163 }
14164 
14165 /******************************************************************/
14166 /* */
14167 /* */
14168 /******************************************************************/
14169 
14170 bool ScriptMoveNode(Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript)
14171 {
14172  // Given a name and a position, move the node to that position
14173  // This can only be applied to one node at once, as it's an absolute position
14174  // So we just do everything here.
14175 
14176  uint32 name;
14177  if ( ! pParams->GetChecksum(CRCD(0xa1dc81f9,"name"),&name) )
14178  {
14179  printf ("Missing Name\n");
14180  return false;
14181  }
14182 
14183  int node_num = SkateScript::FindNamedNode( name, false );
14184  if( node_num == -1 )
14185  {
14186  Dbg_Printf( "MoveNode failed. Could not find node %p in the scene\n", name );
14187  return false;
14188  }
14189  Script::CStruct *pNode = SkateScript::GetNode( node_num );
14190 
14191  Mth::Vector new_pos, old_pos;
14192 
14193  if ( !pParams->GetVector(CRCD(0xb9d31b0a,"position"),&new_pos)
14194  && !pParams->GetVector(CRCD(0x7f261953,"pos"),&new_pos) )
14195  {
14196  printf("Missing position parameter in MoveNode\n");
14197  return false;
14198  }
14199 
14200  if ( !pNode->GetVector(CRCD(0xb9d31b0a,"position"),&old_pos)
14201  && !pNode->GetVector(CRCD(0x7f261953,"pos"),&old_pos) )
14202  {
14203  printf("node is missing position\n");
14204  return false;
14205  }
14206 
14207  // Move the original node
14208  // GJ: i'm pretty sure that the following is incorrect,
14209  // and that the Z component needs to be negated, but since we don't
14210  // actually reference the "position" component after the object has
14211  // been created, the bug has slipped through the cracks... we're
14212  // switching over to the new-style "pos" vector anyway
14213 // pNode->AddVector(CRCD(0xb9d31b0a,"position"),new_pos[X],new_pos[Y],new_pos[Z]);
14214  pNode->AddVector(CRCD(0x7f261953,"pos"),new_pos[X],new_pos[Y],new_pos[Z]);
14215 
14216  // Now look for the node type, and handle the mode for each type of thing
14217 
14218  Obj::CCompositeObject * p_object = (Obj::CCompositeObject *) Obj::CCompositeObjectManager::Instance()->GetObjectByID(name);
14219 
14220  if (p_object)
14221  {
14222  // Might also have to set the pos of the components
14223  // as they can store internal absolute positions
14224  // and the pos of the object is only used for display
14225  p_object->SetPos(new_pos);
14226  }
14227 
14228  uint32 ClassChecksum = 0;
14229  pNode->GetChecksum( 0x12b4e660 /*"Class"*/, &ClassChecksum );
14230  switch (ClassChecksum)
14231  {
14232  case 0xe47f1b79: //vehicle
14233  break;
14234 
14235  case 0xa0dfac98: //pedestrian
14236  case 0x61a741e: // ped
14237 // Obj::CreatePed( skate_mod->GetObjectManager(), nodeIndex );
14238  break;
14239 
14240  case 0xef59c100: //gameobject
14241  break;
14242 
14243  case 0x19b1e241: // ParticleEmitter
14244  {
14245  Nx::CParticle * p_particle = Nx::get_particle( name );
14246  if (p_particle)
14247  {
14248  p_particle->Refresh();
14249  }
14250  }
14251  break;
14252 
14253  case 0xb7b3bd86: // LevelObject
14254  {
14255  }
14256  break;
14257 
14258  case 0xbf4d3536: // LevelGeometry
14259  {
14260  /*Dbg_MsgLog(("LevelGeometry"));
14261  uint32 checksumName = 0;
14262  if ( pNode->GetChecksum( 0xa1dc81f9, &checksumName ) ) // checksum 'name'
14263  {
14264 // Nx::CSector *p_sector = Nx::CEngine::sGetSector(checksumName);
14265  // We only want to get sectors from the main scene, as that is what the node array applies to
14266  Nx::CScene * p_main_scene = Nx::CEngine::sGetMainScene();
14267  Nx::CSector *p_sector = p_main_scene->GetSector(checksumName);
14268  if (p_sector)
14269  {
14270  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_sector,("sGetSector(0x%x) returned NULL (%s)",checksumName,Script::FindChecksumName(checksumName)));
14271  p_sector->SetWorldPosition(new_pos);
14272  }
14273  else
14274  {
14275  printf(" WARNING: sGetSector(0x%x) returned NULL (%s)\n",checksumName,Script::FindChecksumName(checksumName));
14276  }
14277  //Bsp::ClearWorldSectorFlag( checksumName, mSD_KILLED | mSD_NON_COLLIDABLE | mSD_INVISIBLE | mSD_INVISIBLE2);
14278  }*/
14279  break;
14280  }
14281 
14282  case CRCC(0x30c19600, "ClimbingNode"):
14283  case 0x8e6b02ad: // railnode
14284  Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetRailManager()->MoveNode( node_num, new_pos );
14285  break;
14286  case 0x8470f2e: // proximnode
14287 // Obj::Proxim_SetActive( nodeIndex, true );
14288  break;
14289  default:
14290  return ( false );
14291  break;
14292  }
14293 
14294  return true;
14295 }
14296 
14297 /******************************************************************/
14298 /* */
14299 /* */
14300 /******************************************************************/
14301 
14302 // @script | SetActiveCamera |
14303 // Sets the active camera to be the camera component of this object
14304 // @parmopt checksum | id | 0 |
14305 // @parmopt integer | viewport | 0 |
14306 // @flag move | move the new camera to the position of the old camera
14307 bool ScriptSetActiveCamera(Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript)
14308 {
14309  uint32 id=0;
14310  pParams->GetChecksum(CRCD(0x40c698af,"id"),&id);
14311  int viewport=0;
14312  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0x9fd29151,"viewport"),&viewport);
14313  bool move = pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x10c1c887,"move"));
14314 
14315  return SetActiveCamera(id,viewport, move);
14316 }

14323 bool ScriptSin(Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript)
14324 {
14325  float x,sin;
14326  pParams->GetFloat( NONAME , &x, Script::ASSERT );
14327 
14328  sin = sinf(Mth::DegToRad(x));
14329 
14330  Script::CStruct *p_script_params = pScript->GetParams();
14331  p_script_params->AddFloat("sin",sin);
14332  return true;
14333 }

14346 
14347  Script::CStruct *p_script_params = pScript->GetParams();
14348  p_script_params->AddFloat("cos",cos);
14349  return true;
14350 }

14380  asin = Mth::RadToDeg(asin);
14381

14383  p_script_params->AddFloat("asin",asin);
14384  return true;

14398  acos = Mth::RadToDeg(acos);
14399 
14400  Script::CStruct *p_script_params = pScript->GetParams();
14401  p_script_params->AddFloat("acos",acos);
14402  return true;
14403 }

14411 {

14414

14416  atan = Mth::RadToDeg(atan);
14417 
14418  Script::CStruct *p_script_params = pScript->GetParams();
14419  p_script_params->AddFloat("atan",atan);
14420  return true;
14421 }
14422 
14423 /******************************************************************/
14424 /* */
14425 /* */
14426 /******************************************************************/
14427 
14428 // Load tracking info from a file, and display it as immediate mode lines
14429 bool ScriptShowTracking(Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript)
14430 {
14431  Gfx::DebugGfx_CleanUp();
14432  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PushContext(Mem::Manager::sHandle().DebugHeap());
14433 
14434  bool do_bonks = pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xb426bf5a,"bonks"));
14435  bool do_grinds = pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x14240297,"grinds"));
14436  bool do_verts = pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x969d3af6,"verts"));
14437  bool do_lines = pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xb0fe7369,"lines"));
14438 
14439  // if nothing specificed, then do everything
14440  if (!do_bonks && !do_grinds && !do_verts && !do_lines)
14441  {
14442  do_bonks = do_grinds = do_verts = do_lines = true;
14443  }
14444 
14445  const char *p_name="";
14446  pParams->GetString(NONAME,&p_name);
14447  if (p_name[1] == ':')
14448  {
14449  // skip over any 'c:' the user might be specifying
14450  // hopefully they don't try to load things off q:, or something
14451  printf ("WARNING: stripped drive name off file\n");
14452  p_name+=2;
14453  }
14454  int size=0;
14455  void * p_file;
14456  if (File::Exist(p_name))
14457  {
14458  p_file = File::LoadAlloc(p_name,&size);
14459 
14460  printf ("Loaded %s, size = %d, at %p\n",p_name,size,p_file);
14461 
14462  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PopContext();
14463  }
14464  else
14465  {
14466  printf ("Can't find file: %s\n",p_name);
14467  return false;
14468  }
14469 
14470  int bonks = 0;
14471  int grinds = 0;
14472  int verts = 0;
14473  int lines = 0;
14474  char *p = (char*)p_file;
14475  while (p < ((char*)p_file+size))
14476  {
14477  if (
14478  p[0] == 0x0a
14479  && p[1] == 'T'
14480  && p[2] == 'r'
14481  && p[3] == 'a'
14482  && p[4] == 'c'
14483  && p[5] == 'k'
14484  && p[6] == 'i'
14485  && p[7] == 'n'
14486  && p[8] == 'g'
14487  )
14488  {
14489  int type = p[9] - '0';
14490  p += 11;
14491  float f[6];
14492  for (int i=0;i<6;i++)
14493  {
14494  f[i] = (float)atof(p);
14495  while (*p=='-' || *p=='.' || (*p>='0' && *p<='9'))
14496  {
14497  p++;
14498  }
14499  p++; // skip the comma (or half the EOL)
14500  }
14501  p--; // back up!
14502 // printf ("%d: %f,%f,%f - %f,%f,%f,%f\n",type,f[0],f[1],f[2],f[3],f[4],f[5]);
14503 
14504  Mth::Vector start = Mth::Vector(f[0],f[1],f[2]);
14505  Mth::Vector end = Mth::Vector(f[3],f[4],f[5]);
14506 
14507  uint32 color = 0xff00ff;
14508  switch (type)
14509  {
14510  case 1:
14511  bonks++;
14512  if (!do_bonks) goto sorry;
14513  color = 0xffffff; // white = Bonk
14514  start -= (end-start)*10;
14515  break;
14516  case 2:
14517  grinds++;
14518  if (!do_grinds) goto sorry;
14519  color = 0x0000ff; // Red = Grind
14520  //start -= (end-start)*2;
14521  break;
14522  case 3:
14523  verts++;
14524  if (!do_verts) goto sorry;
14525  color = 0xffff00; // Cyan = Vert
14526  start -= (end-start)*2;
14527  break;
14528  case 4:
14529  lines++;
14530  if (!do_lines) goto sorry;
14531  color = 0x008000; // Green = Line
14532  start -= (end-start)*4;
14533  break;
14534  default:
14535  color = 0xffff;
14536  }
14537  Gfx::AddDebugArrow(start, end,color,color,0);
14538 sorry:
14539  ;
14540  }
14541 
14542 
14543  p++;
14544  }
14545 
14546  printf ("Bonks = %d, Grinds = %d, verts= %d, lines = %d\n",bonks, grinds, verts, lines);
14547 
14548  Mem::Free(p_file);
14549  return true;
14550 }
14551 
14552 /******************************************************************/
14553 /* */
14554 /* */
14555 /******************************************************************/
14556 
14557 // @script | IsGrind |
14558 bool ScriptIsGrind(Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript)
14559 {
14560  return pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x255ed86f, "Grind"));
14561 }

14564 /* */
14565 /* */
14566 /******************************************************************/
14567 
14568 // @script | SetColorBufferClear |
14569 // @parmopt integer | clear | 0 |
14570 bool ScriptSetColorBufferClear(Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript)
14571 {
14572  int clear = 0;
14573  pParams->GetInteger( CRCD( 0x1a4e0ef9, "clear" ), &clear );
14574 
14575  Nx::CEngine::sSetColorBufferClear( clear > 0 );
14576  return true;
14577 }
14578 
14579 /******************************************************************/
14580 /* */
14581 /* */
14582 /******************************************************************/
14583 
14584 // @script | ShowCamOffset |
14585 // @parm name | Name | The name of the node we want to get the offset from
14586 // Printfs the cam offset in EE0
14587 bool ScriptShowCamOffset(Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript)
14588 {
14589  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
14590  // Given a node name
14591  // then calculate a good targetOffset and positionOffset
14592  // so we can mode the camera into that position later
14593 
14594  // Some common code to either relative, or world specific
14595  Mth::Matrix cam_matrix = Nx::CViewportManager::sGetActiveCamera()->GetMatrix();
14596  Mth::Vector cam_pos = Nx::CViewportManager::sGetActiveCamera()->GetPos();
14597 
14598  // get a line segment extending fromthe camera forward (note -z)
14599  Mth::Line cam_fwd;
14600  cam_fwd.m_start = cam_pos;
14601  cam_fwd.m_end = cam_pos - cam_matrix[Z] * 10000;
14602 
14603 
14604  uint32 name = 0;
14605  if (pParams->GetChecksum(CRCD(0xa1dc81f9,"name"),&name))
14606  {
14607 
14608  if (name != CRCD(0xc588eebc,"world"))
14609  {
14610  // get the node from the node array, and get the position
14611  int node = SkateScript::FindNamedNode(name);
14612  if (node != -1)
14613  {
14614  Script::CStruct *pNode = SkateScript::GetNode(node);
14615  Mth::Vector pos;
14616  pNode->GetVector(CRCD(0x7f261953,"pos"),&pos);
14617 
14618 
14619  Mth::Matrix cam_matrix = Nx::CViewportManager::sGetActiveCamera()->GetMatrix();
14620  Mth::Vector cam_pos = Nx::CViewportManager::sGetActiveCamera()->GetPos();
14621 
14622 
14623  // get a line segment extending fromthe camera forward (note -z)
14624  Mth::Line cam_fwd;
14625  cam_fwd.m_start = cam_pos;
14626  cam_fwd.m_end = cam_pos - cam_matrix[Z] * 10000;
14627 
14628  Mth::Line node_up;
14629  node_up.m_start = pos;
14630  node_up.m_end = pos + Mth::Vector(0,10000,0);
14631 
14632  Mth::Vector pa, pb;
14633  float mua,mub;
14634  if (Mth::LineLineIntersect( cam_fwd, node_up, &pa, &pb, &mua, &mub, false ))
14635  {
14636  Gfx::AddDebugArrow(pos, pa,0xff0000,0,100);
14637  // Gfx::AddDebugArrow(pa, pb ,0xff00 ,0,100);
14638  }
14639  else
14640  {
14641  printf ("Can't calculate intersection, move camera a bit\n");
14642  }
14643 
14644  //Need to find the offset from this point to the line of sight of the camera
14645  // we have cam_pos = position of camera
14646  // pos = position of node
14647  // pa = position of the focus
14648 
14649  Mth::Vector target_offset = pa-pos;
14650  Mth::Vector position_offset = cam_pos - pa;
14651 
14652  /*
14653  printf ("\nUnrotated - Use if focussing relative to the ground\n");
14654  printf (" targetOffset=(%.1f, %.1f, %.1f)\n",target_offset[X],target_offset[Y],target_offset[Z]);
14655  printf (" positionOffset=(%.1f, %.1f, %.1f)\n",position_offset[X],position_offset[Y],position_offset[Z]);
14656  */
14657 
14658  // Now we have to transform it by the inverse fo the matrix representing the orientation fo the node
14659  Obj::CCompositeObject *p_obj = (Obj::CCompositeObject *)Obj::CCompositeObjectManager::Instance()->GetObjectByID(name);
14660  if (!p_obj)
14661  {
14662  printf ("Can't find the oject this node represents\n");
14663  return false;
14664  }
14665  // Get the matrix
14666  Mth::Matrix obj_mat = p_obj->GetMatrix();
14667  // Invert it, as we want to do the opposite of what we will do with the actual values
14668  obj_mat.Invert();
14669  // apply this, to get the values
14670  target_offset = obj_mat.TransformAsPos(target_offset);
14671  position_offset = obj_mat.TransformAsPos(position_offset);
14672 
14673 // printf ("\nRotated (Use if focussing relative to the object's orientation)\n");
14674  printf (" targetid=%s\n",Script::FindChecksumName(name));
14675  printf (" targetOffset=(%.1f, %.1f, %.1f)\n",target_offset[X],target_offset[Y],target_offset[Z]);
14676  printf (" positionOffset=(%.1f, %.1f, %.1f)\n",position_offset[X],position_offset[Y],position_offset[Z]);
14677 
14678  return true;
14679  }
14680  }
14681  }
14682 
14683  // Looks like we want world coordinates, so print up targetOffset as a point 100 feet in front of the camera
14684  // and positionoffset as the actual point of the camera
14685  printf (" targetid=world\n");
14686  printf (" targetOffset=(%.1f, %.1f, %.1f)\n",cam_fwd.m_end[X],cam_fwd.m_end[Y],cam_fwd.m_end[Z]);
14687  printf (" positionOffset=(%.1f, %.1f, %.1f)\n",cam_pos[X],cam_pos[Y],cam_pos[Z]);
14688 
14689 
14690 
14691  #endif
14692  return true;
14693 }
14694 
14695 
14696 
14697 /******************************************************************/
14698 /* */
14699 /* */
14700 /******************************************************************/
14701 
14702 
14703 // @script | SetEventHandler | register this script to listen for the given event and gosub to the given script in response to the event
14704 // @parm name | Ex | the name of the event listened for
14705 // @parm script | Scr | the script to be run in response to the event
14706 // @parmopt name | Group | the name of this event listeners group; used to identify which listeners to clear when clearing listener groups
14707 // @parmopt structure | Params | this structure is added to the parameter list of the script
14708 // @parmopt flag | exception | set if this causes an exception, rather than a goto
14709 bool ScriptSetEventHandler(Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript)
14710 {
14711  uint32 ex = 0;
14712  pParams->GetChecksum(CRCD(0xf8728bec,"Ex"), &ex, true);
14713  uint32 scr = 0;
14714  pParams->GetChecksum(CRCD(0xa6d2d890,"Scr"), &scr, true);
14715  uint32 group = CRCD(0x1ca1ff20,"default");
14716  pParams->GetChecksum(CRCD(0x923fbb3a,"group"), &group);
14717  bool exception = pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x80367192,"exception"));
14718  Script::CStruct *pExtraParams=NULL;
14719  pParams->GetStructure(CRCD(0x7031f10c,"params"),&pExtraParams);
14720  pScript->SetEventHandler(ex,scr,group,exception,pExtraParams);
14721  return true;
14722 }
14723 
14724 bool ScriptClearEventHandler(Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript)
14725 {
14726  uint32 type;
14727  pParams->GetChecksum(NO_NAME, &type, Script::ASSERT);
14728  pScript->RemoveEventHandler(type);
14729  return true;
14730 }
14731 
14732 bool ScriptClearEventHandlerGroup(Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript)
14733 {
14734  uint32 group = Obj::CEventHandlerTable::vDEFAULT_GROUP;
14735  pParams->GetChecksum(NO_NAME, &group);
14736  pScript->RemoveEventHandlerGroup(group);
14737  return true;
14738 }
14739 
14740 // @script | OnExceptionRun | run the specified script on exception
14741 // @uparm name | script name to run
14742 // can be called without a parameter to clear it
14743 bool ScriptOnExceptionRun(Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript)
14744 {
14745  uint32 OnExceptionScriptChecksum = 0;
14746  pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &OnExceptionScriptChecksum);
14747  pScript->SetOnExceptionScriptChecksum(OnExceptionScriptChecksum);
14748  return true;
14749 }
14750 
14751 bool ScriptOnExitRun(Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript)
14752 {
14753  uint32 OnExitScriptChecksum = 0;
14754  pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &OnExitScriptChecksum);
14755  pScript->SetOnExitScriptChecksum(OnExitScriptChecksum);
14756  return true;
14757 }
14758 
14759 
14760 // @script | Block | Stop execution of this script, allowing to still be woken up by events and exceptions
14761 bool ScriptBlock(Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript)
14762 {
14763  pScript->Block();
14764  return true;
14765 }
14766 
14767 // @script | PrintEventHandlerTable | Prints the event handler table of the current script
14768 bool ScriptPrintEventHandlerTable ( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
14769 {
14770  pScript->PrintEventHandlerTable();
14771  return true;
14772 }
14773 
14774 
14775 // @script | AllocateSplitScreenDMA | (PS2 only) allocated extra memory for DMA usage
14776 bool ScriptAllocateSplitScreenDMA ( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
14777 {
14778  #ifdef __PLAT_NGPS__
14779 
14780  Nx::CEngine::sFinishRendering();
14781  NxPs2::AllocateExtraDMA(true);
14782 
14783  #endif
14784 
14785  return true;
14786 }
14787 
14788 
14789 
14790 // @script | AddSkaterEarly | Create and load a skater, so when we autolaunch a level, it's there. DEBUG ONLY
14791 bool ScriptAddSkaterEarly( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
14792 {
14793 
14794  if (Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetNumSkaters() == 0)
14795  {
14796  Obj::CSkaterProfile* pSkaterProfile = Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetProfile(0);
14797  Mdl::Skate::Instance()->add_skater( pSkaterProfile, true, 0, 0);
14798  }
14799  return true;
14800 }
14801 
14802 /******************************************************************/
14803 /* */
14804 /* */
14805 /******************************************************************/
14806 
14807 bool ScriptPreLoadStreamDone( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
14808 {
14809  uint32 streamId;
14810  pParams->GetChecksum( NONAME, &streamId, Script::ASSERT );
14811  return Pcm::PreLoadStreamDone( streamId );
14812 }
14813 
14814 /******************************************************************/
14815 /* */
14816 /* */
14817 /******************************************************************/
14818 
14819 bool ScriptStartPreLoadedStream( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
14820 {
14821  uint32 streamId;
14822  pParams->GetChecksum( CRCD(0x8a68ab90,"streamId"), &streamId, Script::ASSERT );
14823  float vol = 100;
14824  pParams->GetFloat( CRCD(0x46653221,"volume"), &vol, Script::NO_ASSERT );
14825  Sfx::sVolume* p_volume = new Sfx::sVolume();
14826  p_volume->SetChannelVolume( 0, vol );
14827  p_volume->SetChannelVolume( 1, vol );
14828  bool rc = Pcm::StartPreLoadedStream( streamId, p_volume );
14829  delete p_volume;
14830  return rc;
14831 }
14832 
14833 /******************************************************************/
14834 /* */
14835 /* */
14836 /******************************************************************/
14837 
14838 bool ScriptFinishRendering( Script::CStruct* pParams, Script::CScript* pScript )
14839 {
14840  Nx::CEngine::sFinishRendering();
14841 
14842  return true;
14843 }
14844 
14845 /******************************************************************/
14846 /* */
14847 /* */
14848 /******************************************************************/
14849 
14850 } // namespace CFuncs
